I have seen Dr Galic on a couple of occasions. I did see him in the hospital as an emergency without an appointment.
I waited 6 hours. There were many people ahead of me and it looked like they needed special attention.
Dr Galic stayed till 8pm to make sure that my treatment was done properly and did not let me leave without making sure I was OK. I did appreciate the extended time he took. I asked what time he started.... 7am

The second time I was seen for another retina detachment (emergency) I went to the hospital but since it was late they did not have a specialist to help me. 
Dr Galic did make time at his private clinique. Yes I had to wait. 
I was the last patient of the day and even though he just worked 12 hours. He took the time to make sure I was OK.

The frustration of waiting in order to receive treatment is a fact of life in Quebec

From the patients met and how I was treated, I can only saw good things
Dr. Galic was very knowledgeable, intelligent and had great manners. It's worth it to wait the time for such a quality doctor.

Very disappointed. I lost my eyesight! Each time, I spent at least 5 hours in the ophthalmology dept. then was sent back home with a teared retina which became a complete detached retina over the weeks that I saw the doctor at the hospital. I was told to come back the following weeks because there ‘’was too much blood in my eye’’!!! Then I was given an appointment 2 months after my first visit at the hospital. For a situation that is supposed to be urgent, it was not treated efficiently; I would not recommended this doctor even if some comments are positive because it was a very bad experience for me. On the first appointment, the intern who saw me was compassionate.
Excellent doctor. He's patient, knowledgeable, and helpful. Over the years the staff and the punctuality have improved. Definitely recommend.

Not only he is arrogant and doesnt have manners, he doesnt know how to explain a treatment plan. I would not recommand him. His staff at the private clinic is a bunch of low lives. His resident has no knowledge and she should def change fields. My father got his retina detachment surgery after 4 weeks and making him go to his private office, charging him every time, total of 8 times, Doctor does not know if the surgery was successful. What kind of a moron is he...

I have been reading everyone's comments and am surprised. I am young and not long ago discovered that because of my badly taken care of diabetes I now have problems with my eyes and can lose my eye sight if I don't get it fixed. He has been very helpful. His staff has been very patient with me and often ask "are you ok?" as they know what I am going through is not easy. No, he is not always on time but that is normal and I believe if he overbooks it's because he has a lot of people waiting to see him. - The treatments are very uncomfortable but he is very understanding and makes it easier. I would recomment him hands down! His nurse is very nice as well! I had a but of an issue with my left eye and she told me to go see him at the royal vic and I did not have to wait more than 30-45 minutes!

Un medecin tres competent mais il faut attendre parfois 4 ou 5 hrs meme avec rendez vous fixe.J avais rendez vous en mai dernier a mon arrivee on me dit qu il etait en Floride et nous etions 3 personnes en meme temps dans la meme situation la secretaire n avait pas telephone a personne pour canceller.

I had a follow-up with doctor Galic after a retina detachment operation in florida which was recomanded by the american surgeon and I was very satisfied by his competence. I also had two cataract surgeries with him, everything was perfect. As for waiting, in public hospital in Montreal, waiting is normal. The first time I waited about two hours and the second time one and half hour. At his office? It depends, sometime it's full because he is on demand. You have to be patient, it pays.

Dr. Galic treated a small retinal tear of mine. He appears to be a very competent and professional doctor. He does a good job getting you through a very uncomfortable procedure. My wait was approx two hours which I didn't consider excessive considering the highly specialized work that was performed.

Ce médecin est un rétinologue, donc, un sur-spécialiste. Délais d'attente très long (4-5 heures) avec rendez-vous fixé. Très compétent, traite aussi des afflictions de l'oeil rares / This doctor is a retinolgist. Therefore, he has a long patient list. Waiting time very long, but he knows how to treat rare retina sicknesses

We had a 9 am appt. to be taken at 11.30 and seen by his assistant and resident. We did not opt for a private clinic, to be waiting as long as at a normal clinic and then to be seen by a resident!!!!!!!! He is arrogant and very keen on just making money to be able to pay his fancy Westmount clinic and entourage. He may be a good ophtalmol. but he lacks manners
The minimum wait time is 3 hours. I have waited up to 5 hours. This is understandable at a walk-in clinic, but not acceptable when you have a fixed appointment.
I have had nothing but good experiences with this doctor.Not fond of the staff. Very long waiting periods but it's worth the wait.

Have had many dealings with the staff. I told him the staff in his private office were "morons". He pretty much knew it. They are rude, uncompassionate, young pishers who should not be working in the medical profession. I refuse to pay money to be treated like that, so now I only see him in the hospital clinic - i bring snacks and meals for the wait!!

A very good, knowledgable doctor. Had very good bedside manner. Agree that they over book patients. The biggest problem is the staff. Receptionist is rude and always seems flustered. The technician is unfriendly and is always in a rush.

Always extremely overbooked. My dear mother sat for 3 and a half hours in a cold waiting room after having eye drops put into her eyes that lose effect after 4 hrs. Finally he appeared, unappologetic. Way too many disruptions when he finally enterd the room. On the up side appears knowledgable about his specialty. I would suggest increase clinic days, decrease overbooking, less time spent discussing vacations and purchases with support satff while the examining rooms are filled with patiants waiting to be seen. There is no reason why a 9 a.m appointement should still be there at 3 p.m.

This doctor treated my 63 yr. old mother for her macular hole in her eye. He cancelled on her 2hrs. prior her appointment, making her wait 6hrs without any food in her stomach!! The rescheduled date was NOT WITHIN THE NEXT WEEK BUT IN 1 WHOLE MONTH!! His staff which included 3 incompetent, lying receptionists gave us the runaround of why it would be in 1 MONTH. Each receptionist gave us a completely different reason! "He's going out of the country for a conference" or "He's completely booked" or "He's the one who does the scheduling". Fast forward to 1 Month later, my mother still had to wait another 6hrs, AND WAS STILL ALMOST GOING TO BE CANCELLED ON AGAIN, but the nurse sympathized with us and made it so that my mother wouldn't be CANCELLED ON AGAIN! Thank you nurse Evelyn. My mother is still recovering being all weak and vomitting. Even though he is a skilled at what he does I would recommend to go to someone else. Him and his horrid staff are appalling.
Dr Callejo est très humaine et rassurante. On se sent en sécurité avec elle.
Dre Callejo is a wonderful & qualified doctor. Takes the time to answer all our questions & is transparent & honest about all options & consequences. Highly recommend her.

one of the best that I ever meet. takes her time to explain every detail. no nonsense. very accurate. and very Hamble.takes her time to explain every detail.Dr. Collejo is an amazing doctor apart from being a wonderful human being. thank you.
Such a sweet woman! Very happy with her care. Was taken on time and given plenty of time for my concerns.
She has no respect for her patients. You always wait 3-4 hours for her to see you and that is with an appointment. Knowledgeable doctor but not worth a 5 hour appointment

I can't thank enough Dr. Callejo.

I had ocular melanoma, which she treated successfully. She is very knowledgeable and compassionate , and takes her time to explain every detail. She saved my life.

Her staff also deserve praise for being very competent
Ce médecin est très professionnelle, très humaine et elle prend soin de ses patients, autant physiquement qu'emotionnellememt . Je lui fait entierement confiance!

Excellent doctor who works with an incredible team at Notre Dame Hospital. 

I was called within 3 days of being referred after waiting for over 6 months to see other ophthalmologists who were not able to help me.

She is caring, warm, and an inspiring human being with a difficult job of telling paitents that they have cancer and all the consecuences that the diagnosis brings with it. I am counting my lucky starts to have her as my doctor.

J'ai eu un diagnostique de cancer de l'œil en 2014 et j'ai été référé au Dre. Callejo pour me traiter.
Les infirmières m'ont dit que c'était la meilleure au Québec et c'était bien vrai, en plus de sauver mon œil elle a sauvée ma vie, (she saved my eye and my life) elle est très compétente. je lui suis très reconnaissant, elle a toujours bien répondu à mes questions et m'a donnée des soins de premières classe. Si parfois l'attente est un peu longue ce n'est pas de sa faute, c'est le système de santé du Québec qui est fait comme ça. Tout ce que je peut dire au Dre. Callejo c'est : un gros MERÇi !!

Dr callejo seems to dont care about her patients. She is very cold, doesnt give any explanations and get easily frustrated when challenged (simply asking questions). If my case is a lost cause i would have prefer her to be more forward about it. Very disapointed with my 2 visits over 2 years.

I have never ever met an MD with as much compassion, kindness and warmth. She not only saved my life and sanity, but taught me about humanity. Dr. Collejo is an amazing doctor apart from being a wonderful human being. Punctuality is not her fault, but that of the medical system.

Superb doctor. Extremelly happy with the care she delivers. My father was diagnosed with an ocular cancer. Being a doctor myself, I really appreciate her care, advice, availability and support to my ederly father and the rest of the family. Very dedicated and meticulous, takes in every visit all the time my father needs to answer his questions and guide him through the next steps of care.

I have benn treated by her for a few years because I had no choice. You come in her office at 08h00 and wait 3-4 hours even if you have an appointment at 08h00. She is very cold and has no bed side manners at all. She doesn't explain problems and solutions in detail and she, at least for my case, had very limited solutions, I had to go somewhere else to get treated. Overall not a very good doctor.
Dr. El-Saheb is amazing….I did not worry for one minute about my recent cataract surgery. His treatment of his patients is wonderful and beyond reproach!!!!! Thank You so much!!!

Dr Saheb compétent et rassurant 👍

Je suis entre de très bonnes mains 

Merci 🙏🏻

A straight forward, personable, intelligent Doctor who takes the time to LISTEN to concerns of the Patient and explains all that is required for 1 to know, in a language that can be understood.

He is an asset to the eye clinic as well as to humanity...

I respect him in every way...

“THANK YOU” Dr. El Saheb for being the way you are!!!

Dr El Saheb is more than just an excellent, knowledgeable and professional doctor. He is a kind hearted and compassionate human being. I have never come accross a doctor that is excellent at what he does as well as empathetic to the needs as well as well being of his patients. Dr. El Saheb will always be my shooting star!
Absolutely inappropriate approach to patients. Low qualified.
Médecin attentive, promte certes,toujours à l'heure et qui correspond à ce que je recherche comme medecin.Comme on dit,pas de temps à perdre.

Je demande un rendez-vous en urgence, et lorsque j'arrive dans son cabinet, elle se met à me parler très bête et fâchée contre moi. Elle n'a pas l'humeur égal. 

Elle ne répond jamais à mes questions, visite trop rapide à chaque fois.

Rapid diagnostic on my eyes' degeneration and needed a followup so to check the lost of my driver's permit. Went to another clinic, and on my second visit, no important degeneration after a check on my macular. After discussion, 2 drug were prescribed for infection in both eyes. The decision was made to schedule a surgery for new lens implants, removing my cataracts, so to regain my 20/20 vision. Years of doubt. I would not recommend her services. Look up her suspension for malpractice on her record !
Femme ignoble, sans empathie. Elle se prend vraiment pour une autre et te fait sentir comme un idiot quand tu lui poses des questions. Trouvez-en une autre !!
Excellent, very competent doctor, no waiting time, friendly staff

Elle a été sympathie courtoise et répond aux questions !! J'ai observé aucun indice qui me permet d'avoir un doute sur ces compétences. Elle ma fait une exérèse de chalazion , un succès !! Tout a été fait de façon très professionnelle. Je retourne la voir sans hésitation si c'est nécessaire.
compétente en humaine. à consulter je suis convaincue que je consultais, avec grande satisfaction, la meilleure en ville depuis une dizaine d’années
Excellent, very competent doctor. She find my problem right at the first visit and was very welcoming. She was punctual and clearly explained to me what was going on. That was reassuring.

Si compassion et une bonne écoute vous sont indispensables, il vaut mieux regarder ailleurs. 

Knowledge : comment pouvoir évaluer les connaissances de votre ophtalmologiste ? J’étais convaincue que je consultais, avec grande satisfaction, la meilleure en ville depuis une dizaine d’années mais j’avoue être remuée par les commentaires que je lis ici juste au moment où j’allais la recommander à une amie et après qu’une autre soit allée ailleurs pour cause de non-écoute d’un problème d’infection.
Very professional and knowledgeable, no waiting time, friendly staff and convenient location with underground parking
Amazing knowledgeable doctor , nice clinic, super punctuality

Côte-des-Neiges eye doctor suspended from practising for three months

Élizabeth-Louise Gariépy is also fined $7,500. One of her patients learned he had a brain tumour after visiting another ophthalmologist.

La Docteur Gariepy prend à la légère les problèmes mentionnés. Elle semble vouloir "avoir du bon temps" et étonnamment est peu intéressée par sa cliente mais aime raconter son expérience personnelle qui, entre parenthèses, ne nous apporte rien.
L'examen trop incomplet ne lui a pas permis de déceler la nécessité de faire nettoyer la lentille mise lors de l'opération de la cataracte.
Elle n'a pas non plus décelé un décollement du vitré dans l'autre oeil alors qu'une jeune optométriste l'a fait! Parlerait- on de négligence ou d'incompétence.

Pire médecin que j'ai rencontré de ma vie. Manque total de compassion et de patience. Elle a complètement discrédité mes symptômes, me traitant pratiquement d'hypochondriaque, alors qu'un deuxième avis chez un autre médecin a révélé un vrai problème et un traitement efficace. Le personnel était cependant gentil.

Dr Gariépy a un problème de personnalité. Elle n'explique pas à ses patients. Elle fait des colères lorsqu'on lui pose des questions sur ses choix de traitements. Manque de professionnalisme. N'allez pas voir ce médecin!

tres expeditive , incapable de diagnostiquer ma retinopathie et malgre tt elle m a donne un rdv ds un an quamnd je suis aller voir l optometriste pour un examen de la vue car ma vision a baissee il avait de la misere a comprendre comment elle n a pas vu toutes les anomalies que j ai ds ma retine , a eviter a tout pris car elle n est pas vraiment bonne .
Expéditive, mais à mon avis, compétente. Très peu d'attente à son cabinet au Sanctuaire.
J'ai pu avoir un rendez-vous rapidement même si je n'étais pas sa patiente. Elle a pris son temps pour faire l'examen et m'expliquer mon problème. Je la recommande sans hésitation.

Je la vois depuis dix ans. C'est vrai que c'est expéditif mais c'est bien fait et je n'ai pas de temps à perdre. Elle est toujours à l'heure. Pour ce qui est des frais de $20,je ne paie rien car je la vois à l'hôpital Jean-Talon.Je la recommande sur toute la ligne.
Directe, précise et compétente. Comme tous les ophtalmos, elle est débordée; par conséquent, elle ne s'épanche pas sur des considérations inutiles. Je l'ai beaucoup appréciée.

Cette femme a aggravé mon cas en me prescrivant des corticostéroïdes topiques au lieux d'antibiotiques alors qu'il était évident qu'il s'agissait en vu des différents éléments que je lui ai apporté d'une simple infection. Par contre elle répond bien à toutes les questions même si elle a l'air très pressée. Je précise que je l'ai vu qu'une seule fois.

Je redoute d'aller à mon RDV avec ce médecin car je sais qu'elle va me consacrer à peine 3 minutes et me décourager à poser des questions sur ma vue. Elle vous montre clairement qu'elle n'a pas de temps à perdre avec vous. Je n'ai jamais connu une spécialiste aussi froide, pressée et peu courtoise avec ses patients. Elle se considère supérieure et peu compatissante à l'égard des autres. J'ai toujours payé le montant de 20$ que l'on me réclame. Je vais chercher un autre ophtalmologue.

Bonjour, Mme Gariepy est, selon moi, de loin la pire médecin consultée à vie. Elle est bête comme ses pieds, examine brièvement ses patients et rend un diagnostic pressé. Elle voyait aussi 2 personnes que je connais et sont du même avis que moi. Perte de temps et surtout, mauvais conseils car elle a empiré mon cas. J'ai du consulter un autre ophtalmo (très professionnel et compétent cette fois:) pour régler mon problème.
Elle a disgnostiquer le glocome ,il ya pres de 8 ans,Avec bon suivi et et le medicament qu`elle mà prescrit cela n`a pas augmenter.Tres professionnelle et intentionnee.J ela recommande

Semble savoir ce qu'elle fait; j'en suis à ma 3e visite. Pour l'instant je poursuis en espérant que ses diagnostics sont bons. Recommandée par deux personnes de mon entourage. Mais le $20 à chaque visite pour deux goûtes anesthésiantes, par couvert par la RAMQ ni les assurances, c'est difficile à justifier. J'ai téléphoné au Collège des médecins qui me recommande de faire une plainte pour qu'il puisse enquêter sur ces frais exagérés.

Je suis déçu par les services rendus par ce médecin. Elle consacre peu de temps à ses patients (quelques petites minutes), semble trop pressée et a hâte de finir la visite. Ce n'est pas professionnel!
Dr Gariepy est très compétente et rigoureuse. J'en suis à ma troisième visite et elle est toujours de bonne humeur. Je lui fait tout à fait confiance.

Médecin très expéditif qui ne prend pas le temps de répondre à nos questions. Probablement bien compétente au point de vue médical, mais nous fait vraiment sentir comme des numéros.... 'Next, au suivant'
Rencontrée pour la première fois, je l'ai trouvée un peu trop rapide à mon goût. Je n'ai même pas été 5 minutes dans son bureau.

slow down, don't rush!! she saw my mom and recommended immediate laser surgery, or she might go BLIND. what a bunch of B.S., we got a second opinion from a professional who is careful and diligent. my mom does NOT need any operation. so don't take her word for god. get your eyes checked with another doctor before sugery.

I have seen Dr gariepy at three occasions. She was very helpfull and competent when my son had problems. As for myslef, she delivered good service, but a bit expeditive as some have already noticed 5 minutes and you are out ! Instructions are givent at the speed of light : better be attentive ! on the money side, she did not disclose all the fees before performing her stuff. I must say that 20$ a drop seems a bit exagerated for the product she puts in our eyes. If she sees a patein per 10 minutes, that makes 42 patients in a 7 hour shift, at 40$ each for the drops, she bags in some 1 680$. I doubt the little bottle costs that much...

Dr. Gariépy is very nice, listen very well, takes her time, makes me feel like a human being who needs her expertise. She would find some time to see a patient if it seems urgent. I would recommend her to everybody who needs a human expert!

Je vois le Dr. Gariepy depuis environ 8 ans. Elle est très professionnelle. L'an passé j'avais une conjonctivite et elle a tout désinfecté les appareils jusqu'a la poignée de porte. Vrai, elle travaille très vite et tant mieux...Pourquoi passé du temps en trop pour dire qu'il fait beau dehors ? je la recommande.

Comme Lucky Luke, ce médecin tire plus vite que son ombre. Pour elle, time is money. Elle peut vous recevoir entre 1 et 5 minutes au maximum. Elle répond rarement à vos questions. Faute de temps. Elle met tout temps une goutte dans chacun de vos yeux et vous charge 20.00$ pour ce médicament qui est une grâcieuseté des compagnies pharmaceutiques. Désolé, je ne peux pas recommander ce docteur à qui que ce soit.

Aye aye aye, ya vraiment du monde frustré et pas de vie pour prendre la penne d'aller écrire des commmentaires comme ça (que les personnes se reconnaissent). Bref, je n'ai que 15 ans et je le remarque déjà. Voilà ce qui est un manque d'éthique!
ce docteur est compétente mais a des préjugés que je ne nommerai pas et les a laissé transparaître lors de notre rencontre; il y a eu un manque évident d'empathie et d'éthique.
She is a great doctor. Very knowledgeable, very quick.
Très compétente, professionnelle, rassurante. Elle ne laisse rien passé et les suivis sont précis.Pour mo elle vaut le déplacement.

Effectivement, le docteur est très expéditive et dans mon cas elle a jugé avant même que je termine ma phrase et je nai pu procéder aux tests demandés par mon médecin de famille. J'ai dû opter pour changer de médecin. Et pourtant je venais de recevoir de l'urethane dans l'oeil droit 2 semaines auparavant et mon métier a beaucoup affecté mes yeux. Mais ça, elle ne l'a jamais sû; je suis trop jeune pour être un cas intéressant, je vois encore ...(50 ans...)! Dommage, je suis certaine qu'elle soit pourtant compétente mais devrait être plus à l'écoute. Un bon médecin est aussi quelqu'un d'empathique.
Une ophtalmo vivante, qui écoute bien, expéditive tout en étant généreuse et rassurante.
Que de bonnes notes pour cette ophtalmologiste, competente et rassurante pour ses clients.
Inflexible, judgemental, arrogant, does not listen, not good follow up,

I have had cataract and glaucoma treatment with Dr. Saheb, he is brilliant and although very busy l am grateful to the amazing treatment and follow-up I have had thus far. Certainly glad he is my eye specialist. Thank You.

I can’t seem to understand any of this mans positive reviews. Dr Saheb decided to change my glaucoma medication cause he didn’t believe in them. Which ended up increasing my pressure drastically. Too which he then proceeded with inserting a drainage tube in my one of my eyes. Extremely painful procedure that scared up & isn’t useful anymore. I ended up changing clinic and my glaucoma has been stable for the last 5 years. Seriously run & change glaucoma doctor now.
Dr. El Saheb saved my eyesight! He is very thoughtful and patient. I h recommend him.
Dr EL Saheb is an exceptional doctor but an arrogant man with a God complex.
No matter how knowledgeable you are or how good you think you are, people skills are equally important when you decide to work in the medical field.
Great doctor very compassionate and professional, operated on my eyes. Highly recommended

Dr Saheb is an absolute gem. He has conducted two stellar operations to remove cataract from both of my eyes, one in May and the other in June. Both procedures went amazing, and I am forever grateful to Dr Saheb.

Furthermore, I strongly disagree with the negative comments that some have left. My personal experience was simply impeccable.

Please never go to this doctor - he is arrogant, uncaring, and does not even look at you - only typing on the computer with his back turned the entire time. He thinks he is good but he isn’t. He cuts you off and doesn’t listen. Please please please never go.
Very knowledgeable Dr, Extremely polite and helpful!!

I agree with the negative ratings of this doctor and the clinic eye care clinic on Decarie. pretend to be top notch but are not. I have seen negative ratings on doctors from there removed. This doctor is arrogant, rigid, with at.tines poor follow ups after surgery.

he could not have been more disinterested in me. I was kept waiting in a chair for over an hour for a two second visit with him. he was interested in teaching students but he was so abrupt and rude. I am sure he is an expert in his field. but he has to remember that he is dealing with people, not teaching objects.

Excellent doctor 
Very helpful and professional and expert in his field

Had a recent cataract surgery. 4 weeks post-op I started having issues with my right eye (pain, difficult seeing and sensitive to light). After several days of experiencing these symptoms, I reached out to Eye Health MD (located on 8000 Decarie) to request an emergency visit with Dr. Saheb, only to be told they could not do anything for me. I was advised to wait until my next visit with Dr. Saheb as he was OOO until the following week. I asked to be seen by another doctor and was told this was not possible as no back-ups were available and they were busy and could not accommodate this visit. I was told to go see an optometrist and they would be able to help me with my issues. I asked if it was possible to get an appointment with my regular doctor at Health MD and was told that the only availability she had was in mid-sept.
I am beyond disappointed by the lack of FU or urgency for pts with recent Sx. Furthermore the receptionist are extremely rude and not very eager to assist their patients (no empathy what so ever). I would never recommend this clinic nor would I ever go back for any further interventions. They were quick to however take my money.
Nasty doctor I told him that I had dry eye, and then he told me it was not his expertise and I should see another opthalmologist .

I have had a negative experience with Dr Saheb

I found him judgemental , arrogant and lack of empathy

I wasted my time
Excellent doctor. Really knows what he is doing. Excellent polite and friendly manner with his patients. I never worry when he operates on my eyes.
Sorted out my unusual glaucoma issue and solved it through cataract surgery. Really knowledgable and and answered all my questions. Montreal is lucky to have him here.
Excellent Doctor, prompted, attentional, meticulous, knowledgeable, confident. Merci pour vos soins et suivis, je me sens pleinement en confiance. :-)
Not good with older people, judgemental, and does not follow through.
I have had a very good experience with Dr Hady, very professional and courteous.

I had a great experience with Dr Saheb. My ophthalmologist who was treating my glaucoma for many years recommended that I see him when I needed cataract surgery. I had combined cataract and glaucoma surgery in both eyes, and my vision is so much better than it was before surgery. Dr Saheb explained the various lens options and the advantages of combining cataract and glaucoma surgery, and I had close follow up after surgery to make sure I healed well. I am so grateful to him and his team for their great care, and am so happy that my ophthalmologist referred me to him.

I agree with the negative ratings, He is inflexible, judgemental, and not good with older persons. My wife who came with me could not believe his attitude. I would not trust his for care after surgery.

Dr. Saheb is extremely professional, kind and respectful.

He has my confidence. I have many eye issues and I find that he is up to the challenge.

Dr Saheb gave a prescription to my 90 year old mom without any instructions. The pharmacist has been unable to get any answers from him either by fax nor phone for over 2 weeks. Very unprofessional on his part..If this is how he treats his elderly patients with advanced glaucoma, gives the message that he doesn't care for people unless they pay his private office fees rather than the hospital. I feel he is only there for the money, not care for his patients.

I have severe glaucoma in both eyes and was referred to this eye doctor for surgery. The wait was long, I found this doctor abrupt, rushed, and judgemental, he recommended surgery but with another long wait. I had to start again with someone else. In my opinion, this doctor is an example of what is wrong with the Quebec health care system. It’s not only that he is very busy, I did not like his attitude. I don’t think he would want to be treated that way if he was the patient.
Extremely competent knowledgeable doctor with good bedside manner

I wonder if he asks patients to rate him on this site. He wants to be a top doctor but I did not have a good experience with him, and I find the positive comments very different than what happened to me. No doctor can please everyone, but the unhappy posts were very like my contact with him. I felt that in an emergency he would not be there. I don’t think I would want him doing surgery on my eyes. I went to see someone else who I trust.
Dr. Saheb is a wonderful doctor. He is kind and gentle and wonderful at what he does. We are fortunate to have him in our city.

I dont believe a physician in Floida has directly witnessed the surgical results of this Montreal doctor. I find waiting one year for surgery for severe uncontrolled glaucoma, where vision loss is irreversible, to be suboptimal at best and compared to the US in my view if true this borders on neglect.

When I visited Bascom Palmer Hospital in Miami, Florida, the no1 Eye Institute in North America for an evaluation of my severe glaucoma conditions in both eyes, they mentioned that Dr El-Saheb working in Montreal is an exceptional doctor and they suggested to me as Canadian to be treated by him.

It has been the most beneficial suggestion. Dr El-Saheb operated successfully both eyes for glaucoma and cataract. Fortunately for me, so far after over two years for one eye and over ten months for the second one, my vision is excellent and not using drops anymore. IT WAS A SUCCESS!

I waited over six months to obtain a first consultation with him and over a year to be operated in the first eye, I have no regrets for the wait! It was worthwhile.

I am very grateful to Dr El-Saheb for the excellent treatment, he has provided to me.

I found him to be competent with eyes, but inflexible, lacking in compassion, and showing in my opinion some arguably poor judgement. I waited six months to be seen, my referral apparently fell through the cracks and he needed a reminder from the referral source. During that time I waited patiently and did not call his office. I don't think he would have liked his wife or family to be treated the way he treated my family member. He does not seem to appreciate that elderly patients do not have the physical capabilities of a man his age. These characteristics may not show up on a daily basis with his patients, but in my view they are present and can result in unpredictable issues with this physician, as was our experience more than once.
Dr. Saheb is an amazing doctor. He takes the time to answer questions, is polite and attentive with patients, and is very good at what he does. Would recommend.
He was very knowledgeable, answered all my questions without any attitude nor did he try to rush out. I highly recommend him.
Polite, professional and knowledgeable doctor. Would highly recommend!
All I can say is; he is the perfect version of a doctor to me :)
All I can say is that he is the best, caring, efficient, knowledgeable, up to date with all the new technologies in glaucoma treatment

Que des bons mots à son égard, il s'est occupé de moi comme si j'étais un membre de sa famille j'ai subi une iridotomie sur les deux yeux, et comme je suis un vas spéciale :-) il s'est montré patient avec moi et compréhensif il n'a jamais regardé l'heure . Je me sentais en sécurité et tout s'était très bien passé . Si vous avez des problèmes de glocaume ou autre je vous conseille de voir DR HADY SAHEB

merci encore dr SAHEB pour tout.
A fine young doctor. I have no complaints. He is knowledgeable, courteous, kind and caring.
Extremely competent ophthalmologist. Takes great care of his patients.
This doctor has been arrogant, brusque, callous, and harassing. He did not advise me in advance of serious complications that arose subsequent to my surgery.

He is the best doctor I've ever had. He was the only one who recognized that I had multiple sclerosis after every other doctor of mine pushed me out the door saying that I had nothing for 4 years. The best, can't go wrong with him!
After a 4-hour long wait with an appointment, Dr. Saheb was unapologetic, barely said hi to me and spent less than 3 minutes with the exam. I found him to be rude and unpleasant.

Human, comprehensive, most polite, takes care of your feelings. Your eyes are his priority, no matter what you're planning to do. Cannot speak about his multiple competencies, I have no knowledge in medicine.

My mother has been cared or by Dr Saheb for glaucoma and macular degeneration for many years. He is so caring and supportive; I do not know what she would have done without him. I so appreciate his care.
Wonderful doctor! I recommend him to all my friends and family after he saved my vision.

This exceptional doctor makes having glaucoma much less unpleasant. He explains options very clearly and takes adequate time to answer questions in detail. The other staff are very friendly, kind and helpful. One of the best ophthalmologists around.

I was sent to Dr. Saheb for a second opinion regarding my glaucoma and my increasing pressure. I have been on eye drops for about 10 years. Dr. Saheb explained my options and suggested surgery. Recently I had the surgery on my right eye and my sight is terrific. I do not need glasses , which I used for reading. He follows up closely post op and really cares about his patients. Now I am waiting for the surgery on my left eye. The staff, also, at the Royal Victoria, Montreal General and Lachine are exceptional. His secretary is also very nice. Thank you so much Dr. Saheb,

I am so happy to be a patient of Dr. Saheb. I had glaucoma surgery a month ago and everything has gone perfect. He told me exactly what to expect before the procedure and everything has gone smooth. His approach is cutting edge and he is extremely knowledgeable. Thank you Dr. Saheb!
Great doctor. Dr Saheb is extremely competent and knowledgeable. Very nice to the patients and a great surgeon. Thanks Dr Saheb!
Excellent doctor Dr Chartrand explains the problem very well and gives solution.

He performed Lasik eye surgery on me in June of 2013. First of all he was on his blackberry most of the time. My surgery did not go very well..Stay away from this doctor. I think he was fired from LASIK MD in Pointe Claire.

I do not know Doctor Chartrand very well because I saw him just once for eyes injections so I cannot rate him, but his assistant Natasha is very rude and unprofessional, last week I wanted to speak with Doctor Chartrand about something and made the mistake of calling the clinic instead of her, since I have been there just once I completely forgot that it was her I was suppose to call instead of the clinic, I am 83 years of age and tends to forget about certain things, it's forgivable, thing is Natasha called me right away after I have called the clinic and gave me a sermon on the subject when all she had to do was reminding me to call her instead of the clinic, iI would have understood right away instead of making me feel like a like a total idiot, to add insult to injury she went even as far as telling me that if I didn't like it there to go somewhere else , it was all about the drops that they use at that clinic that freezes just some part of th eyes instead of drops that freezes the eyes completely so that you don't feel the pains when the needle goes into the eye's without experiencing any pains at all, she told me that it has always been like and that it will always be like that, i don't know if she had the order from Doctor Chartrand to cancel my appointment for the 18 of this month August 2022, or if she decided that on her own? I will find out tomorrow when I meet with Doctor Chartrand, why cancel my appointment without even consulting me, I would have went because it's very important to have those needles, it's a matter of keeping my vision healthy, to make a long story short I was treated like rotten fish, I find that appalling coming from a suppose to be health professional......

Les gens sont dure avec le Dr Chartrand . Il est très compétant, gentil, à l’heure même en avance.

C’est l’un des meilleurs médecins que j’ai rencontré.

Le Dr. avait l'air confu. On s'est même demandé si il avait fait un avc. Tout était mélangé, sa façon de parler, aucune explication, pas trop sûre de ce qu'il a observer et il nous a pas vraiment donné d'explication . Demande de passer des tests alors que les test on déjà été fait et il avait les résultats dans son ordi. De plus se moiche à 2 reprise sans se laver les mains et ensuite joue dans les yeux! Et l'infirmière semble très compétente et on se sent en sécurité au moins avec elle mais elle est très hautaine. Très triste car avant on avait un très bon service.
Dr Chartrand was very professional, caring and answered my questions patiently. Very pleased.

Mon opinion est que j'ai bien hâte qu'il prenne sa retraite. Comme plusieurs l'on mentionné, il faut vraiment lui tirer les vers du nez. Il donne très peu d'information. Il est aussi arrogant. Il voulait me revoir à une date précise, mais pour mon travail cette date était déjà prise. Il m'a répondu sur un ton hautain: "c'est comme vous voulez." Sans m'offrir d'autres possibilités. J'ai dû argumenter pour lui faire comprendre que ce n'était pas un caprice, mais qu'a cette date, mon travail m'amenait à être à l'extérieur de la ville. Suite à un autre rendez-vous, j'ai dû lui demander ce que je devais faire après que le premier traitement suggéré soit fini, car mon problème est chronique (cela fait 20 ans que mon problème revient) et que la deuxième médication n'était pas encore fini. C'est là, comme s'il venait de se souvenir qu'il faudrait que je le revois dans 3 mois. Au dernier rendez-vous, j'ai encore du lui poser des questions sur le futur de mon traitement qu'est-ce qui est renouvelable? qui peut le faire? (genre optométriste pour ne pas que j'ai à le revoir) De tous les ophtamol que j'ai consulté, celui-ci est le pire.

La réceptionniste et l'assistance ont été tres cordiales Dr. Chartrand est le genre a ne pas parler pour rien dire mais il est tres compétent enfin un médecin qui aime sa pratique.
Si j'avais été en médecine j'aurais pris le Dr. Chartrand en exemple.
Merci pour la consultation

Ne vous fiez pas au commentaires négatif sur ce site ! Je viens d'un rendez vous avec Dr Chartrand et il était très sympathique et un excellent medecin ! Idem pour son équipe ! Merci à toutes l'équipe

L' adjointe (Natasha) qui nous met les gouttes dans les yeux a un air bête de première classe. Il est évident qu'elle a été formée par le Dr. Chartrand. Ce dernier ne m'a jamais dit bonjour en entrant dans la salle de consultation. Idem lorsqu'il est parti. Je lui ai posé des questions auxquelles il n'a jamais répondu. Il m'a seulement remis un papier jaune sur lequel était inscrit que je devrais passer 3 autres examens dont un coûte 80$. Chartrand ne facture plus pour les gouttes mais il se reprend avec des examens additionnels. Évitez cet individu.

Took my elderly mother there of her eye because the optometriste referred her for more test, possible glucoma. The first appointment was ok, but we waited over an hour to get in. 
He sent my mother for more test so another appointment. Then went back for supposedly more test a third time but this time after waiting for one hour I asked if they had forgotten my mother sitting there and his secretary did not like that too much. When my mother finally went in, he was short with her and just gave her drops, with a prescription for one year.When she asked if she actually had glucoma, he said shortly, it was hard to tell, just use the drops! 
Find him and his staff, arrogant and not overly friendly. To them its normal that people wait for them. They will see you when they are ready and your job is to just sit there and WAIT and God forbid, you should ask them anything! Then YOU have an attitude and they treat you like you are a nuisance to them. Three visits to a specialist to be told ,, its hard to tell! Very ordinary!
I always the first apointment of the day at 8:30. His staff arrive at 9:00, and he shows up at 9:30. I get called at 9:15. So don't be surprised that he is late.

For the first few times when I saw him, he was patient to listen to you and did some good examinations. But, now, He told me i just have to use the eye drops every time when I went to see him with uncomfortable eyes, that's it.

I was so impressed by Dr Chartrand and his staff. I was treated professionally and effectively. Dr. C completed all necessary test and set me up with an appointment for corrective surgery. I COULD NOT BELIEVE IT! I was asked if I wanted it done on THURSDAY. My response was, "Is this the Quebec Provincial Medical system?". An appointment the same week??? I also loved the efficiency and the friendliness of the staff. Dr. C clinic should be used as THE MODEL for all facets of the Quebec Medical system. The staff were all happy and worked together as a "well oiled machine." YOU GUYS ARE THE BEST!!!!
We had been fatshamed by him. He says my diabetes it's because i have bad habits. Lol i am type 1, it'es autoimmune.

I had been going to him for a few years, he was good at first but now all he does is examine you and no time for questions you have to deal with the nurse. WOW... but the nurse has to ask the Dr. the questions then gets back to me, I'm like WTF... I want a doctor I can actually TALK to.

This doctor is arrogant and uncommunicative. He does not give you a diagnosis. At the Pointe-Claire clinic, expect to spend a long time there and expect to pay out of your pocket for unexpected eye tests.

I saw Dr, JP Chartrand for my yearly appointment and have decided to change doctor. 

 First he was an hour late and rushed. He only talked about how large I was! Did I eat too much, did I exercise enough. He then told me he could not believe how big I am and kept repeating this during the examination. I finally asked him how my eyes were and he gave me my results. Basically I was fine and see you next year and then he told me to leave all this lasted about 5 minutes . I was there to have my eyes examined not to be scolded humiliated .

The clinic is like a MacDonalds One after another . I would not recommend this Opthalmogist . The clinic personnel were very professional and helpful

He does not easily volunteer information, you practically have to pull it out of him. Plus, after my latest experience, I am seriously starting to doubt his knowledge. His technicians are great though and very helpful.
Hes the most conscientious doctor I've ever met. He really loves his profession and it shows. I wish all doctors were the same.thank you

Not satisfied of his explanation, not convinced enough.. He told me i just have to use the gel drops whenever i need it, that's it.. i wanted to ask more questions but he said right away "madame did you understand me" ,,, now i keep using this gel but still my eyes is painful, still the bulge in my cornea is there!! the gel doesn't help much

Was there to have my eyes checked due to side effects of meds I take. His staff does most of the work in that clinic (Lakeshore Opthalmology) and they work on multiple patients at the same time. They do a test or two then they run off and see someone else and come back later. Meanwhile you wait and you were already seen late! Chartand almost did not speak to me and did not properly answer my questions. I was not clear on everything but he just told me to come back next year. This clinic has about 10 doctors and they work on volume business. The doctor's website boasts about 20,000 procedures. Reminds me of MacDonalds and their over 5 billion sold signs.

I had my laser surgery with Dr Chartrand 2 weeks ago and it has changed my life. I was very nervous and anxious on the day of my surgery but Dr Chartrand made me feel so comfortable so I forgot all my worries. He is very professional , knowledgeable and reassuring . He treated me like I was his friend or family. Great doctor. The staff of Lasik MD in Pointe-Claire was friendly and very helpful . I am very happy with my vision !

I did my laser surgery last week, and I found that he's very knowledgeable, professional, gentle and patient DR. The stuff was professional , amazing and smiling all the time wich made me very comfortable before the surgery. I never regret that and I wish I've done it before

Dr Chartrand est un ophtalomologiste très compétent et professionnel. J'ai tenu à ce qu'il fasse ma chirurgie car je connaissais sa réputation de par un ami et un collègue de travail. Il a été à la hauteur de mes attentes et il a su me mettre en confiance et calmer ma nervosité le jour de la chirurgie. Même chose pour le personnel avec qui il travaille. Je suis enfin débarassé de mes lunettes, et me dis que j'aurais du le faire plus tôt.
The best, most trusted and knowledgeable eye doctor around - I wouldn't see anyone else - I'm a Montrealer-moved-to-North-Carolina and I come up to see him - all the way from the southern States.

Is polite and nice during my LASIK surgery . The post op evaluation staff is nice but does not seem very knowledgeable. The answer I was always given is "i don't know, you have to wait and see". It makes me wonder if this staffing has a degree in post op LASIK eye care (like a degree in optometry or optician) or was just hired for convincing you all is well when you still can't see clearly. I only had a direct contact with Dr. Chartrand the day of surgery.
Il est très gentil et il parle Francais. Il a pris le temps de nous expliquer le problème.

Je me suis fait opéré au laser KPR la semaine dernière, et j'ai obtenu un très bon résultat. L'opération s'est bien passée et Dr.Chartrand et son équipe sont très professionnels. Je crois que le Dr.Chartrand est un exellent ophalmologiste, un des meilleurs selon moi. De plus, il est très ponctuel.
A most proficient expert in his field, at the very top of the knowlege chart, great personnality, Ct
ce médecin très gentil et poli, je l'ai vu en urgence, je souffrais de dmla... il m'as référer tout suite en urgence à la clinique de rétine il a sauvé mon oeil droit... très compétent..
Vraiment bon, mon mari n'a pas perdu la vue apres son accident. Je suis tres reconnaisante et il a meme telephoner a la maison pour voir si tout ce passait bien. Merci beaucoup.

Diagnosed intra-ocular hypertension and prescribed xalatan. He is very good but has terrible hand writing, if he ever writes a prescription or a referral make sure you can understand what he wrote so you can relay that information to the pharmacist or lab testing technician.
HAd lazer surgery--should have done it 10 years ago!Dr Chartrand and his staff were awesome.

Je me suis fait faire une chirurgie au laser par le Dr. Chartrand. Je suis bien heureuse de l'intervention. Lui et son équipe ont su me mettre à l'aise malgré le fait que j'étais très nerveuse. Ma vision est maintenant parfaite. Le Dr. a répondu à toutes mes questions avant la chirurgie et m'a aussi donné son numéro de tél. personnel en cas de problème. Le seul point négatif est que les rencontres de suivis se déroulent très très rapidement et qu'il ne parle presque pas lors de ces rencontres. Il faut absolument lui poser des questions sinon il n'est pas trop bavard.

J'ai rencontrer le docteur pour savoir si il pouvait m'operer au Laser mais apres son examen il m'a suggerer de continuer avec mes lunettes vu mon age. j'ai ete tres surpris et le remercie de ces conseils.

Very knowledgeable doctor. He knew what I had wheres nobody else wa able to detect problem. Incredible bedside manners; even game me his phone number in case I felt insecure (his phone number is even in the phone book!) The staff were comforting and very nice. I felt I was being taken care of. Thank you!

Je me suis fait faire une chirurgie au laser pour miopie de l'oeil droit en 2003. J'en suis très satisfaite. Dr Chartrand est très réceptif et a su bien répondre à toutes mes questions avant l'opération, je me suis sentie très à l'aise avec lui. Je le recommande fortement.

Didn't refer to a higher specialist in neuro-ophtalmology... didn't diagnose a possible tumor... didn't find the possible cause of my eye problem and made no reference to explore possible tumor by a neuro-ophtalmologist which would have saved my seeing capability. Conclusion: I have lost about 30%-50% of my seeing capability because of a late diagnosis by another ophtalmologist which detected a possible eye tumor.
Very good Dr. Even call at home to see if my husband was ok during the week-end. Thank You
Not a very helpful experience. Offered no solution. Did not care to listen to my medical history leading up to this problem. Ignored my problem. Old age must be getting to him. 5 second exam

I was traumatized after my appointment with Dr. Gans; I went to see him for double vision, and he was unkind and wasn’t helpful. He did a few basic tests and dismissed me, and told me to go to the ER instead. Couldn’t believe how I was treated when I was clearly in a state of distress…

could not help me. and now i paying the price. end up going to the mtl gen, hosp. in emergency

 was seeing double and now am very off balance and dizzy ,no its not vertigo. it is psp, would give him a second chance. but i dont drive anymore, sold my car. cant go therevanymore

Premier rdv à cette clinique et je veux remercier toute l'équipe pour leur accueil chaleureux, leur gentillesse et leur professionnalisme. Je n'ai pas eu à attendre non plus.

Merci au Dr Mark Gans pour son expertise, ses références et sa bonne humeur. Je suis entre bonnes mains pour la suite!

J'aimerais ajouter que cet endroit est accessible car j'y suis allé en fauteuil roulant. Je recommande sans hésitation!

A little rude and not very helpful. Left without understanding why I'm seeing flashing lights in my left eye. While examing my eye he accidentally flipped my eyelid over. No apology, blaimed it on my anxiety and nervousness although I tried to tell him that my eyelid never turned over before.
Excellent doctor. His calm demeanor and straight-forward explanation re-assured me.
Very knowledgeable. Solved strange complaint quickly.
Dr Gans...EXCELLENT!! The staff very good,the time waiting good...thanks !!

Referred to Dr Gans by a very good general ophthamologist who was concerned about some persistent eye symptoms. Dr Gans was cordial, but it was clear that my visual complaints did not pique his interest. While telling my fairly brief history, spanning about 2 minutes, he kept saying "not important" or "not relevant" to the points being said (all with a big smile on his face). His exam consisted of putting a couple of fingers up and asking if I could see them (lasted 20 seconds, max). No other exam was done. Really? He then made a diagnosis and actually went on the internet to read it to me aloud, as if to confirm his opinion. Unfortunately, the symptoms he was quoting to support his diagnosis were nothing like mine. When I politely pointed out that fact; he hesitated for a moment, agreed with my observation and dismissed me without even a tentative diagnosis---all with a smile. All of this occurring within a 10 minute interaction.
I think he is pleasant(a bit phony) and knowledgeable, but, at least in my case, there was little intellectual or physical energy spent in trying to diagnose my problem.

I’ve seen Dr Gans several times at the McGill Eye Centre on Maisonneuve and later at his clinic in Westmount. 

Very kind and polite doctor, doesn’t hesitate to investigate further and order more advanced tests.

What and excellent A TEAM, especially during these difficult times of COVID-19

Thank you all and Dr. Gans for a great experience and care you give , there are no words other than saying FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART THANK VERY MUCH TO ALL and I know I am in the best hands possible , my eyes were delighted to see them and such a clean environment

Merci, Gracias, Grazie, Danke, ,Obrigada,kattar kheldoum and TONS OF THANKS

P.Alibrandi
Very thorough doctor that takes the time to explain. Excellent staff as well.
Excellent, consciencieux et compétent! Le personnel aussi est accueillant et fait toujours leur possible, afin de mieux accomoder les patients.
Appointments time horrible but very brilliant doctor, just a bit rude sometimes.

Dr. Gans and his staff were absolutely fantastic. Very good natured doctor, very patient and thorough! His staff is absolutely delightful. I would absolutely recomend Dr. Gans and his staff, they are all such wonderful people.
Never had any problems with Staff. waiting time could be improved, however, my appointment today was A 100 - right on schedule. Dr Mark Gans is super. GOD BLESS THEM ALL
Super neuro ophtamologiste! Il est consciencieux et n'hésite pas pour investiguer. L'attente est longue, mais il prends le temps nécessaire avec ses patients.
Excellent doctor but the wait time is absolutely ridiculous appointment times don't mean anything
Both Maggie and Dr. Gans are wonderful!!! They are friendly, professional and thorough and I am quite satisfied with all aspects of their work as well as with their communications skills.
Excellent doctor, **unebearably rude staff.** Waiting times are also appalling. Yes, the doctor's busy. So are his patients.
La réceptionniste, Maggie est accueillante, aimable et très patiente. Je suis très satisfaite des soins donnés par Dr Gans
i thot dr gans was great---i had him checked out before i went-----i loved the girl with the crinkly hair at the front----she had spirit------richard cline
Receptionist needs to go - she started yelling about the 'system' very tiredm frustrated individual - she had to go

RUDEST STAFF I EVER MET IN MY LIFE!!!! PEOPLE ARE GOING THROUGH SERIOUS NEURO AND EYE ISSUES AND HIS RECEPTIONIST TELLS ME I'M ONLY BOOKING IN JANUARY IN THE MOST RUDEST TONE...I TOLD HER SHE SHOULD BE MORE POLITE AND SHE TELLS ME "THAT'S HOW I AM, I'M DIRECT" I ASK FOR HER NAME AND SHE HANGS UP ON ME. HORRIBLE PERSON!!!!!
totally positive experience helpful and informative, I recommend him to friends

I suggest that you don't even walk in this clinic. Very rude staff. Specially the person at the front desk. I walked in for the first time not knowing what to do and she just told me to sit. After 45 minutes i asked her if she is going to take my card and with a really rude manner she started telling me that she is tired she is and i have to wait more. I waited for 4 hours!!!!!!! 

Everyone in this clinic knows that with their system they will always have delays and unhappy patients, and when I brought it up with manager he said that they don't care and it's hard to ask employees to change for better. The patients can go to other clinics.

I too think it's the systems fault for rushing, I thought he was charming and very kind. Not being

a Dr. I cannot judge his knowledge.

Both Dr. Gans and his administrative assistant were rude and short. I was scheduled for an appointment first thing in the morning, and still waited for over two hours for my appointment. When I finally saw him, he had poor bedside manner, appeared rushed, and was dismissive. He was completely unhelpful to me. Would not recommend this doctor at all.

Beyond expectations! I'm so thrilled - I can see clearly now! Maggie and Michelle were super and Dr. Gans, what a gentleman. Explained procedure and helped me decide what strength I wanted for my eyes.
Dr Gans is good BUT is staff is the worst and so rude. My son is blind and she kept pushing papers at him and getting impatient BUT he just couldnt see them !

Mon expérience à l'hôpital général de Montréal a été horrible de A à Z.
Premièrement, très difficile à cet hôpital d'avoir une chaise roulante. Il faut en faire la demande par téléphone à l'entrée et là, préparez-vous à attendre... 40 minutes dans mon cas. Ensuite, la course pour faire faire la carte de l'hôpital et me rendre à mon rendez-vous. Alors, bien que je sois arrivée 45 minutes avant l'heure de mon rendez-vous, j'étais en retard de 5 minutes. La secrétaire du Dr Gans a été d'une froideur incroyable, bien que je l'aie appelée de la réception, pour l'aviser de mes déboires. Ensuite, plus de 2 heures d'attente. Dr Gans m'a examinée rapidement, a ensuite rempli le dossier informatique en me disant ce qu'il écrivait, pour ne pas perdre de temps. J'ai posé 2 ou 3 questions; après quoi, il a dit avoir répondu à suffisamment de questions! Quel professionnalisme! Les yeux sont précieux et comme Dr Gans n'était pas certain de son diagnostic, il était normal que j'aie des questions.
Une chose est certaine : la compétence ne justifie pas la grossièreté. Jamais.

Dr. Gans is an excellent surgeon. He listens to his patient and propose options trying to achieve the best treatment. 

My son recently had surgeries with Dr. Gans. As he is a youngster, Dr. Gans used an approach specific for young people, and my son's visions have been improved beyond our expectation!

Thanks to Dr. Gans and his team!

Secretary is a rude, arrogant... I don't know how she keeps her job . the office at the hospital is an atrocity of overbooked patients and the punctuality of a bankrupt airline. This is like speed dating medicine. You get 5-8 minutes.

Dr. Gans is a very nice, gentle doctor victim to a system that has to push patients out like its fast food.

Dr. Gans is very knowledgeable and kind. I have the utmost respect for him and recommend him highly. Unfortunately there is quite a wait for him, but it is worth it. However, his secretary Maggie is another matter. She is rude, not forthcoming with information, can't keep her temper in check. I think the office would run more efficiently if she were either replaced or had a talking to.

Je consulte le Dr Gans depuis plus de 20 ans. Au début, il était au Jewish Hospital. Il est très professionnel, compétent dans sa spécialité et on peut lui faire confiance sur le diagnostic et le traitement. A l'hopital, c'est plus long mais pour ma part pas trop d'attente en clinique. Point de vue humain, il va vite a l'examen et n'est pas la pour jaser...ne semble pas apprécier se faire poser des questions et donner des explications. Peut être un peu impatient. N'est -il pas normal de poser des questions de précision sur quelque chose d'aussi précieux que ses yeux afin de prendre une décision éclairée sur un traitement surtout quand il y a des risques?????? Je le recommande malgré ce petit bémol pour sa grande compétence.
Dr. Gans is very knowledgeable and helpful. He listens to your story very well and offers appropriate options. Very diplomatic and great sense of humour. Would recommend him to anyone.
Très bon médecin. Consciencieux et qui a à coeur ses patients.

Dr. Gans saw me 2 1/2 hours after my scheduled appointment and only after I pointed out to him that he was calling others even though my dossier was next in line. He also kept leaving the office thus making us wait even more. When I finally did see him, it was a hurried examination making me feel that I was taking up his time. The whole experience was horrible and unacceptable. He needs to schedule less patients so as to give everyone the respectful attention and care they deserve. My time is just as valueable as his and I will not return to see him.

Very knowledgable Dr however felt rushed through my appointment ... complained of dizziness/nausea and he brushed it off as nothing ... told me to come back if I had any concerns .... waited 2.5 hours to see him ... (my apt was at 11:30 waited until 2:00) ... and the receptionist was very unfriendly
His receptionist has the personality of a wet Wednesday. Very depressing to go there. He's great though!
for 2 visits - first $100.00 - second $35.00 & I have to go back for another exam before he operates (catarac). I liked him - was very nice to me.

I have seen Dr. Ganz for several years and must say that I was far from being impressed!!!! Spent very little time, explained almost nothing except when he felt helpless and suggested radical treatments!!! I am now being followed by a very humane specialist and am most happy to be out of that office.
Helpful and professional. Takes a few months to get an appointment with him at the hopital, though.
Dr Gans is a very hard working specialist,as seen at least 8 patients in 1 hour,while we waited. He was reassuring and professional in his work.

I found Dr.Gans and especially his nurse to be very knowledgeable and thorough with my eye examination. Both were courteous and polite. I noticed this is a very busy clinic but I didn't feel like I was being pushed through my appointment. I would recommend Dr. Gans without any hesitation.

Dr. Gans is barely polite and very much in a rush. He actually raised his tone to tell me to cooperate more while he was doing a (painful) retinal exam. I am a grown adult and I was doing my best to cooperate, asking for an effort on my part is fine but raising one's voice is inappropriate. Also, I was not warned in advance that I would have a pupil dilation that would blind me for several hours. It should be standard practice to warn patients as some people may drive over and not be able to drive home. This was at his private practice. I have seen Dr. Gans a few times over a period of a few years. I understand that his specialty is very much a rarity and that we are locked in to a few doctors but such consistently cold, impersonal and minimalistic customer service is not acceptable.

I met Dr Muladzanov at Clinique Ophtalmo de MTL and all the staff were very kind and helpful. 

I totally recommend Dr Muladzanov, she was very knowledgeable, kind, professional and patient. I was very happy to meet her and will follow her to her new Clinic.
Doctor Alla Muladzanov is profeccional, kind, friendly doctor . I am happy to be her patient. I Recommend Her as a Doctor to everyone.
Dr. Muladzanov was so kind and took my case very seriously and advocated for me as her patient. So lucky to have her as a doctor!
Excellent experience, she explains the diagnosis in great detail. I recommend!
Marvelous human being, excellent doctors with wonderful bedside manners. Caring and respectful for colleagues. Highly Recommended.
Excellent Dr. Je recommande Dr Singh sans hésiter !
Excellent knowledge, very reassuring and fantastic manner to deal with clients/patients.
Dr. Singh just operated my two cataracts. He has also been treating me for glaucoma. He is patient, competent, and calm. I trust him and recommend him for his knowledge and professionalism.
Dr Singh is a very competent ophthalmologist. I had a very complex eye condition and he was the only one capable of doing my surgery ! Now I can see thanks to him. He is the best.

After 1st operation had follow up appointment with Doctor, we were sent to wrong floor/room waited 2hrs to be told we were all waiting in wrong area!!!!! After waiting for a long time to do 2nd cataract operation found her secretaries were misinformed about pre/operative information. Very frustrating!!!!

You may have to wait a long time at the hospital but Dr. Belair is more than worth the wait. I have been her patient for 15 years, ueveite chronique, and sheis amazing. When I was discouraged because my problem wouldn’t go away she was so encouraging. I count it a privilege to be her patient.
She helped me , listens to the patient, knowledgeable. She's great.
Excellente spécialiste. Très humaine. Elle cherche a comprendre ce qui arrive, pas seulement a traiter le bobo.

Elle m’as opéré pour des cataractes et j’avais une vision -24 et maintenant pour la première fois ddepuis ma vie j’ouvre les yeux et je vois sans lunettes ou verres de contacts. J’ai un grave problème de rétine sensible au déchirure et décollement et tout c’est bien passé. Un énorme merci au docteur Belair !!!
Always late and all patients are schedule at same time. 2 to 4 hours waiting time at office and 6 hrs at the hospital. Does not make sence...
Excellente. Elle a opéré mes deux yeux pour cataractes et ma vision est parfaite. je suis très reconnaissante. Merci beaucoup!

Bonjour, j'ai 21 ans et Dr. Bélair me suis depuis 3 ans pour des uvéites chroniques. Elle n'a toujours pas trouvé la maladie exacte, mais elle a su traiter le probl`me avec un immunosupresseur. Elle est gentille et tient vraiment à ses pateient. On sent qu'elle est présente pour nous malgré sa timidité. Elle semble être très active en recherche ce qui est rassurant, car elle doit se tenir au courant des nouvelles technologies. Je reocmmande vivement ce docteur.

Dr. Belair knows what she is talking about. Takes the time to explain problem. She takes care of any and all problems that we bring to her attention. The staff that registers us talk amongst themselves too much. We end up having to wait sometimes 45 minutes just to register. Then we wait anywhere between 3 to 5 hours to see Dr. Belair. This is an unreasonable amount of time to wait!!!!

Mon mari et moi avons été opérés par le Dr. Bélair pour nos cataractes. Nous avons été bien servis. Elle a pris le temps de bien nous expliquer la chirurgie et des risques possibles. Nous avons été opérés pour les deux yeux et nous sommes très satisfaits. Aucune complication et le suivi a été efficace. Nous sommes très reconnaissants.

Dame opérée pour cataractes aux 2 yeux et problème avec yeux après les opérations ... Dois retourner à plusieurs reprises à l'hôpital pour RDV = attention et $$$ stationnement ...Doit être rendu à plus de 100$ pour stationner !!! Dans la salle d'attente les patients présents on presque tous des problèmes après opération ... Docteure très froide et sans conversation ... a l'impression de déranger ... Mal chanceuse peut-être ... !!! ??? A vous de juger ...
Dr.Bélair, ne cherchez pas ailleurs... c'est la meilleure. Une personne sérieuse et dévouée avec ses patients.

Quoique l'on attende longtemps à l'hôpital, Dr Bélair est très compétente et disponible. Dans son bureau, elle est totalement dévouée à son patient. Ce que j'apprécie aussi c'est qu'elle n'hésite pas à faire appel à ses collègues au moindre doute, contrairement à d'autres médecins qui se prennent pour des Joes Connaissants. Elle m'a opéré et me suit pour un oeil gravement malade. Je la recommande fortement.
Très consciencieuse, très à l'écoute de ses patients, cherche toujours à rassurer et explique bien les gestes qu'elle pose. Merci
Bon medecin tres consciencieuse. Elle a opere mon epoux pour une cataracte et il attends pour l'operation du prochain. Tres douce. A recommander.

Petite dame tres douce. A opere mon epoux a un oeil pour cataracte. Tres competente. Reprendra la meme personne pour deuxieme oeil.Tres satisfait. Par contre l'attente est longue a l'hopital mais quand meme.

Dommage quelle soit parti travaille dans un autre province sont professionaliste nous manque au québec.Elle a su avec ma fille faire de sa vision une excellence . Quel écoute quelle générosité elle prenait le temps pour tout
Super douce avec les enfants. Elle est fantastique.

We had truly met my son's guardian angel with this Doctor. If not for her, he would have been without sight in one eye. She gave us the hope, patience and courage to live with his condition. She spoke of him at several conferences, as his is a rare case, and always kept us informed of any progress in the medical field. She has now left Montreal and truly took a part of our hearts away with her. A true humanitarian and friend.

Elle m'a opéré en 2003 et m'a donné beaucoup d'informations sur la procédure et le déroulement de l'opération afin de me donner confiance. Elle a été là pour répondre à mes questions. Très attentive, elle tient à ce qu'on soit bien dès l'instant où l'on pose le pied à l'hôpital. Que de bons mots!

J'ai subi une opération pour les yeux vers 1996 par le Dr Aroichane. Très professionnelle pour informer ses patients, autant sur l'opération que sur les risques qui peuvent être encourrus. Elle semble connaitre son travail, même si mon opération n'a pas entièrement réussi (j'avais une déviation de l'oeil gauche et il n'a pas pu être redressi complètement) mais elle m'avait prévenu que ca pouvait arriver, vu que c'était ma 2ème opération (la première vers 1980). La seule chose négative que je peux dire, c'est qu'à un certain moment elle a perdu patience quand je lui ai demandé de me laisser 2 minutes pour me calmer (elle tirait sur les fils reliés à mes yeux)... Mais je comprends qu'elle était fatiguée, c'était la fin de la journée et elle avait eu plusieurs opération à faire dans la journée... Je pense tout de même que c'est un bon médecin, elle tout de même humaine après tout.

I had cataract surgery. done recently by Dr. Chen. I have always been incredibly anxious in ANY medical setting, but especially when I am to have any procedure done. Dr. Chen was very sensitive to that and he totally put me at ease. And he did a 

great job. He has turned very blurry vision in my left eye into INCREDIBLE clarity of vision. Soon I will have my right eye done. Thank you SO much Dr. Chen!

I’m hard of hearing, yet he was kind and the most thoughtful doctor I’ve ever met. 

Thanks.
Dr Chen is excellent. Knowledgeable, friendly, and extremely competent. Thank you.

J’ai vu dr chen à 3 reprises. JAMAIS a l’heure! L’équipe qui l’accompagne à l’hôpital était très désagréable. Lui était moqueur et pas d’explication malgré mes demandes. J’ai de manque qu’il m’explique un consentement qu’il m’avait fait signer préalablement (sans explication) et j’ai pas plus eu de réponse. J’étais alors en attente pour une opération sans explication. Ses explications quant au suivi en général sont peu claires, précises et cohérentes. J’ai décidé de changer d’ophtalmologue et j’ai bien fais. J’ai alors eu un suivi régulier et une vrai prise en charge. Plus d’un an plus tard je n’ai et n’aurais pas besoin d’être opéré comme dr Chen avait dit.. il suffit d’être bon! Après de longue recherche sur dr Chen j’ai su que je n’étais pas la seule patiente qu’il a négligée. Faites attention à ce docteur, il fait plusieurs erreurs de suivi médical!!

Very nice and helpful staff. Punctual. Doctor was quick & to the point, Study was 120 paid only cash. I was informed by phone in advance when appointment was made, but some other patients were not ready to pay and were ask to go to the ATM to get the cash. Please be prepared or ask before you go. Now need to see if my insurance will pay.
Excellent doctor, staff exceptional. Had all tests done quickly and professionally.
Excellent Doctor I will recommend Him anytime. He Had Done my eye surgery.

My first encounter with Dr. Chen was quite disappointing.....no patient skills, dismissive, aloof. Furthermore, he did not take the time to read my medical record before seeing me---he just asked why I was there to see him! He did not check my eyes; he only showed me my eye problem on the screen, mentioned the risks and left it up to me to decide what I should do. He did not offer any information on resources that might be helpful in the future or any offer for a follow- up to see the progression of the condition. I do not recommend this doctor.

Dr. Chen is a busy Doctor & knows his "stuff extremely" well. He is quick & to the point, like a business man, nothing wrong with that Only problem I have with the Retina Institute at Westmount Sq., is the fact that they did not do laser on my eye, sent me to the McGill Faculty, which takes more time. Still nurses are extremely nice and polite. Their staff has a healthy turnaround all the time, as I have been going for many many years. I recommend Dr. Chen

I accompanied my father there for a visit recently. It went well but this doctor is all about the money. He charges you $120 to do a scan and you have to pay in cash. I have death with another ophthalmologist for my mother quite known and he does not charge for these X-rays. Also my father was asked to do another X-ray where he had to buy a dye from the pharmacy that is conveniently across his office. It cost hold on to your hatS $94!!! Even though he is a pensioner. So first appointment and we’re up to $210. And the annoying thing is they didn’t use the whole bottle of dye! They never gave it back.

This doctor seems to know what he’s doing but he is very much about the money. He asks you do an eye scan and charges you $120 which you have to pay in cash only. I accompanied my father and he made him do a scan and another X-ray where a dye was needed. It was bought from the pharmacy that is conveniently across the office for hold on to your hats $94!!! Even though my father is a pensioner there was no difference in price compared to a non pensioner. I have death with another quite known Ophtholmologist and never has he charged for X-rays. You need $210 just for your first visit with this doctor. And the worst part, they never gave back the unused dye bottle!!

Minor surgery performed by this doctor resulted in diminished vision and lower quality of life. High volume practice in Westmount Square has the feel a checkout counter at the supermarket. Not recommended.

Condamné à trois mois de radiation en 2014, un ophtalmologiste montréalais a une fois de plus été sanctionné par le Conseil discipline du Collège des médecins, le 5 juin. Cette fois, le Dr John Chanchiang Chen a reçu une amende exemplaire de 62 500 $ par le Conseil de discipline du Collège des médecins pour avoir facturé des frais accessoires à ses patients. Il s’agit de la plus forte pénalité que cette instance puisse imposer. 

Le Conseil reproche à l’ophtalmologiste d’avoir réclamé à ses patients des montants de 40$ pour des gouttes ophtalmiques (Mydriacyl 1%, Mydfrin 2.5% et Flurox) au cours de la période du 1er avril 2016 au mois de décembre 2016. Ce 40$ avait été appliqué sur 1 267 factures produites en huit mois. C’est donc plus de 50 000$ qu’il avait chargé aux patients.

Comme il avait maintenu ces frais malgré les avertissements et rappels du CMQ, une plainte avait finalement été déposée contre lui par le Conseil de discipline.

Je reçois des traitements pour la dégénérescence maculaire par le Dr Chen depuis 15 ans. Le Dr Chen est très compétent, un expert reconnu dans son domaine. À chaque visite il analyse l’évolution de la maladie au moyen d’un scan (tomographie) et il recommande toujours les traitements qui permettront de protéger ma vision, avec beaucoup de succès jusqu’à date. 
Le Dr Chen est courtois, attentionné et a une personnalité très agréable. Il ne faut cependant pas s’attendre à de longues discussions car il doit traiter de nombreux patients à tous les jours.
Je le recommande sans hésitation à tous et toutes. Ronald Lalonde, Pierrefonds
Terrible doctor. Arrogant. Rude. Zero compassion. See another specialist!

I am Dr J.Chen's patient for the last 20y. He operated my cataracts 10y ago. I never have any problem since then. Dr Chen is competent, cares about his patients and always treats them
with respect and attention. I would recommand him to my friends who are having problems with their eyes. Thank you so much Dr Chen. Mme Tam Hanh Hoang Tran

FYI: He was convicted of Illegal Resale of Drugs, was removed from his professional order for three months.
https://www.tvanouvelles.ca/2013/03/04/un-ophtalmologiste-reconnu-coupable
https://www.tvanouvelles.ca/2014/01/28/un-ophtalmologiste-radie-pendant-trois-mois

Approximately 18 years ago Dr. Chen closed a macular hole in my left eye, thus stabilizing the sight in that eye and enabling me to continue working
 as a proofreader. I'm grateful for his skill, knowledge and judgment.
Was honest and straight forward with my treatments. Knows what he is doing.

Dr. Chen explained carefully my eye problems. He was caring before and after a successful surgery. I recommend him highly. Yes, the wait in his office can sbea bit long, but I was happy to stay longer than planned in order to undergo all the necessary tests before my surgery.

Awfully long waiting time. Has about as much bedside manner as a teaspoon. Diagnosed my mother with an incurable disease and basically just didn't give a darn about that fact. No information on resources that might be helpfull in the future or any offer to follow up to see the progression of the condition. Wouldn't recommend.
Dr. John Chen is very knowledgeable, meticulous and thorough. He also is caring and personable. On top of it, he has a good sense of humour...

Le docteur Chen et son équipe de résidents son vraiments bons! Merci à dr Vincent Sun et à dr Chen pour le service professionnel et courtois. Nous avons été traités En priorité. Tout le personnel sont parfaitement bilingues et courtois. Merci Dr. Chen!!

J'ai été reféré au Docteur Chen par un ophtalmologiste pour une maculopathie cellophane, et après avoir effectué des recherches j'ai appris que ce docteur a déjà été radié pour 3 mois pour fraude. Alors j'ai changé de médecin car je ne peux pas avoir confiance en ce genre de personne et je comprends les commentaires mentionnant que ce médecin est à l'argent.

Dr Chen performed 2 photo coagulation treatments on both eyes. My retinas were on the verge of detachment due to holes in both retinas. He diagnosed me with retinopathy of prematurity. He operated the same day but still needed two more treatments to stabilize the condition. Great doctor! Needs to improve his wait times. I spent three hours in his waiting room on my second appointment,

Dr J. Chen has been my doctor for 25 years. I am a juvenile diabetic and was referred to Dr Chen because another doctor did not do his job, I was in need of a vitrectomy due to a major bleed in my left eye, which was causing blindness. Although I never did regain my sight in my left eye, Dr. Chen took such good care of me by keeping a close watch on my right eye and making sure I received the proper laser treatments. He never took a chance with overdoing treatments since that could have also caused further bleeds. Dr Chen has always done a great job, he has an incredible talent for his job - he is a real expert. He gave me peace of mind and took away my fear of going completely blind and you cannot buy that in a store. Dr Chen office was always open to me in case anything went wrong, such as more internal eye bleeds. He never told me I had to wait to be seen or to go elsewhere. He was always there for me. For any of you reading this, please understand that for the other patients who wrote that Dr Chen is arrogant or rude or cold, that is not the case at all. It is simply that Dr Chen is very overworked and has so many patients to see and he wants to bring his very best attention to everyone's eye problems. You need to see past the facial exterior. His job is a complex one and he has many people to deal with everyday. One man, too many patients, he is trying.
