His job is helping people, everyone needs to remember that when they start getting impatient. I will never forget what he did for me and keeps doing for me - Priceless! --KE

Dr Chen was arrogant, rude and dismissive. The whole experience of waiting in his office, interacting with his staff and finally seeing him was very unpleasant. And to top it off, he charges an extra fee over and above the provincial health plan. If you have the option of going to another doctor, take it.
I had a good experience with Dr Chen. Long wait, but worth it. Very friendly and helpful staff.
Simply the best eye doctor. He takes care of other doctors' mistakes and complications and make them right again. He is caring and dedicated.

Dr Chen ne communique pas. Vous n'aurez pas l'heure juste. Clinique exécrable. Attente interminable. Ils sont beaucoup à l'argent. On vous chargera pour des goûtes occulaire que vous n'aurez même pas besoin. $$$$$$$$ Personnel désagréable. J'ai détesté l'expérience, même si j'ai dû y aller plusieurs fois. La pire place selon moi.

If you want to be treated like cattle or numbers this is the right doctor for you. He seems completly at ease to make patients wait for hours and has an haughty and unpleasant attitude. This doctors seems to care more about the money than about the patients.
Dr. Chen has been my eye doctor for over 10 years. He is the best

I had both of my eyes operated by Dr Chen. One was a severe trauma with eye rupture and bleeding and retinal detachment. The other eye had a wrinkle with scar on the retina. Both went so well I now have almost perfect vision. Dr Chen was helpful, friendly, and the best. He even came in at night and on weekends to take care of me. I am so lucky.

I was diagnosed by Dr. Lederer with a macula off retinal detachment on September 25, 2012 and referred to Dr. Chen (with a second referral from Dr. Burnier). I saw Dr. Chen at 9am the following morning and had a very thorough examination during which Dr. Chen presented me with my surgical options. Dr. Chen immediately placed me on the emergency surgical list at the Royal Victoria Hospital. I was operated on the morning of September 27th and had a vitrectomy as well as lense replacement, a two hour operation. I have had three follow up visits with Dr. Chen since. In all cases Dr. Chen has been very thorough and professional and sensitive to my concerns. I would strongly recommend Dr. Chen and have been very pleased to have him as my retinal surgeon.

The waits can be long. According to Dr.Chen the operation was a success. Some improvement am hoping to eventually be able to read from that eye.He tells it as is--gives the impresion of aloofness but that is not all true.he is a busy doctor. A good surgeon. Yes.for us it is scary and not something we do every day.

I have to agree with the other comments. I had a horrible experience with dr chen. I lost vision in my right eye, he was almost amused by the problem. When i asked if there was any hope, he said, well hope is the best medecine and grinned. This is an extremely traumatizing experience, and to have someone feel like it is not even worth a serious explanation and prognosis is not acceptable. I went to him at least 6 times several times and i never got my questions answered or felt that anyone was taking my problem seriously. i felt like an interesting "lab experiment". how horrible that he is an example for other students to learn from.

What an arrogant doctor. So full of himself. I saw him since I am loosing vision in my left eye. Although lots of tests were performed, still no clue on what's going on. When I saw him, I was asked if I could see out of my other eye. When I said yes, this clown told me to cover the eye I can't see out and use my good one...I should then have no problems anymore. I then got dismissed. I still have another test to go to, but I have seeked a second opinion. And that second opinion actually found something that could make me loose my eye...They do not understand how come this bouffon did not see the problem. They will have to move quick so I can save my eye but they assured me they would do everything they can. As for Dr. Chen, well, dear doctor, be prepared because a law suit is going your way and I'll make sure that College des Medecins looks into your files and prevents you from practicing again.

Dr Chen seems knowledgeable but the wait times at the clinic are unforgivable. When I asked why it was that we had waited 90 minutes to see him, he said simply, "We are not very efficient here." I regret very much that a physician with so little respect for his patients is allowed to practice.

Dr. Chen is a busy physician who saved my sight. If you see him, go in prepared and expect short answers. This is typical of all specialists. I think his team is fantastic and thanks to him, he save the sight in my left eye. This is not a personality contest! I would pick a competent physician over a friendly one any day! He is one of the in Canada and anyone who is his patient, is lucky! Thank you Dr. Chen!!!

receptionists are friendly and helpful but Dr. Chen not only keeps you waiting for hours, both he and his residents blow off your concerns. Their social skills are nil. I was totally manhandled by one of his residents and they do not seem to believe in talking to their patients nor giving them any kind of information or followup information. In fact, they do not want to see you unless there is a problem. However, when you go to them with many symptoms,unless it is emergency serious, they blow it off. They cared more about moving the patients along so they could leave, when the patients have waited hours to get some help and get some answers!

I have never met a more arrogant physician. His medical competence is fine but the apalling neglicence of his staff have caused my mother to go blind in one eye. A simple apology would have calmed things. That wasn't his style.Now, sadly the court route. This is a money making machine. One Notes that comments show that service has deteriorated with the years. He is no different from any other person who puts money above all else. Medical factories are just that.

Money is his primary concern - he is clearly running a booming business rather than putting his patients first. He has zero social skills and actually laughed when I told him my eye was not frozen while he was cutting it. Would never go back to this doctor

Walked into the clinic at 10:05 for my 10:15 AM appointment. 1st time there. Approx 50 people in the waiting room. Asked the receptionist if they were all waiting for Dr. Chen, YES. I was told I could wait till 2:30 PM. Goodbye. I left!! Give me a break.

This doctor knows his medicine very well. However, is he cold and does not believe in preventative medicine. He told me not to come back unless there is a problem when I presenting with many symptoms.
Dr. Chen is the best ophtamologist in Canada!His staff is wonderful. Although the waiting time is long, it is completely worth it!
Dr. Chen did a superb job of closing a macular hole in my left eye. Another ophthalmologist who examined this eye told me his work was "spectacular." I am deeply indebted to Dr. Chen.

Je vois ce médecin à la Clinique de la Rétine de Mtl... je l'ai vu a 2 reprises et a chaque fois j'ai passé 3h après l'heure de mon rendez-vous. BEAUCOUP d'attente. Il est froid mais semble compétent!!

Après quelques 5 ou 6 visites chez ce docteur, une chose est constante; entre deux et trois heures d'attente, même sur rendez-vous. Après lui en avoir parlé, il considère que c'est normal. Côté professionnel, difficile à dire s'iil est bon ou mauvais, car rien ne s'est amélioré, sauf que notre portefeuille a été soulagé de quelques centaines de dollars.Si vous n'être pas patient, à éviter.
Great doctor. He's very knowledgeable and knows what he's doing. Has helpful staff for post-op follow up.

Très compétent, il est au top de sa profession. Semble débordé, donc le suivi du patient n'est pas toujours excellent. Prend le temps de répondre aux questions, ne bouscule pas le patient, mais sans plus. Froid et distant.

As a patient who has had a major retina detachment that was unforeseen which eventually led to blindness in the eye, I have nothing positive to say about Dr. Chen. With further chronic uveitis which could lead to further complications, he has repeatedly told me not to see him unless a new problem arises. Am I not supposed to be continuously monitored given my conditions? Give me a break.
Great doctor but waiting room time is ridiculous. He should learn time management and not let his patients wait for hours.

Dr Chen cured me of retinopathy of prematurity. This condition could have led to my going blind bilaterally. I was fortunate that the condition was diagnosed when it was, 30 years after my birth. He used three separate treatments of photocoagulation to cure me. I am extremely grateful to him.

Dr. Chen was the surgeon who successfully closed a macular hole in my left eye. I recently saw another ophthalmologist who looked at this eye and said about Chen's work: "That is spectacular!" With glasses I now have 20/20 eyesight in the eye that was operated on.

He spent like 2 minutes without explaining nothing,just to go his other clinic with 975$cash or check for the cataract surgery !!!didn t tell me if is an umergency or not,is appear that only the amount of money was important!

He examined my husbands eyes and then gave him a card for measurements $230.00. BUT a he said cataract surgery is useless? Husband has macular degeneration in both eyes. Went to Iris in Laval and was told one wet and one dry. Did Dr.Nguyen miss something?

my wife and I are with him for many many years. He is fantastic.
no one else would touch our eyes.
My grandfather had an appointment with Dr. Nyugen for the first time and was unhelpful in every way possible. The adjective I'd use to describe this Dr. would be arrogant, rude and lacked empathy.

Take a better cataract surgeon if you don't want to be blind:

My mother had cataract surgeries with Dr. Nam Nguyen.
One side is OK but she was blind for 2 weeks on her other eye with a permanent damage for the rest of her life! It was unclear why he took 1h20 minutes for her second cataract surgery with so much bleedings while he tried to deposit the lens.

Dr Nguyen is not the most communicative. Also, when I went to his office on Allard, for pre-op tests, his office refused to give me a receipt in English. It is not against the law to include English, it is their office policy.
I waited over an hour for my appointment, I was told it’s like a hospital you have to wait your turn.

My dad did a cataract surgery with Dr. Nguyen, and is very happy with the results and the doctor. His eyesight improved considerably that he doesn’t even need glasses anymore. He asked me to write this review on his behalf. Thanks Dr. Nguyen!

Saw him twice. He is cold, silent, and sends you off with as little information as possible. I had to ask how to proceed with the follow-up two times which seemed to annoy him. I hope he's as good as he is disinterested. Rudeness is not a sign of superiority Doc, in case they forgot to teach you that in Med school.
Dr. Nguyen is a very good doctor. I saw him before, and I am going to see him tomorrow again.

Dr.TUONG NAM NGUYEN. have no bedside manners.very rude.no patients. I would try my best

Not to see him again. Nice staff.

J’ai vue Dr Nguyen deux fois pour un zona à l’oeil Gauche, tout était correct avec les tests internes mais n’a jamais regardée mon œil de l’extérieur. Si il avait allumer une lumière dans son bureau il aurait probablement vue que ma pupille était dilaté au maximum. Malgré le fait que je lui disait avoir de la difficulté à voir, à conduire et surtout regarder quand il fait soleil, je n’ai pas l’impression Qu’il m’écoutait. Les deux rendez-vous était de 2 minutes chaque, résultat j’ai une mydrias de l’oeil Gauche et risque de perdre la vue si un nerf est atteint. Je ne suis pas impressionnée et j’aimerais que nos docteurs prennent soin de leur patient en écoutant d’avantage svp.

I recently had cataract surgery & I am thrilled with the results. Dr Nguyen is an excellent surgeon & is very professional . He clearly explained everything that I needed to know about the surgery & provides excellent post operative care. In my opinion he is the best opthamologist that I have ever had. 
George Roberts Pointe-Claire

I took my mom, Mrs. Thi Tuan Can, to see Dr. Tuong Nam Nguyen. He is a fine and excellent Doctor, regardless of his professional seriousness that makes us afraid to ask questions. But, that musts be his professionalism manner (He cannot be all smiley when his patients are suffering from the near blind problem). Just ask relevant questions. He knows what he is doing. If you cannot see clearly or blind, then you might as well opt for the eye surgery without questions asked. However, my mom does not want the surgery because she still can see. Dr. Tuong Nam suggested an OCT macula, and we did not ask what the test was about. We need to ask him about this!!!... The waiting time to see Dr. Tuong Nam was about 1-2 hrs, which was still acceptable, since we cannot expect to come and get to see him right away. We find his office was a bit dark, but I guess that is his working environment to not having to adjust the eyes to the brightness and darkness. The staffs were friendly... We were pleased after the appointment....Thank you Dr. Tuong Nam Nguyen!!!!! From: Rebecca Thi Thu Giang Nguyen.
Excellent surgical skills. Got both eyes done and vision significantly improved. Can function without glasses most of the time. Thrilled about the results.

My mother had 2 cataract operations (left and right side) with Dr. Tuong-Nam Nguyen.

Her right cataract operation turn so badly that she was 100% blind for 15 days and her right vision is permanently dammaged! We can't trust him!
Terrible bedside manner. He got angry when I asked question about my surgery. If I had to do it again, would not go to him.

Hi Dr. T.N. Nguyen... I would like to ask if you know what is happening to me: I am 48 & have myopia. The optometrist said that I need glasses to read. However, I tried the bifocal contact lenses and still cannot read. But, I can read without my glasses or contact lenses; I just need to read at an appropriate distance... Can you help me if you know why?... Thank you very much. Rebecca Thi Thu Giang Nguyen. My phone #514-545-4327.

Excellent chirurgien. Professionnel et très attentionné. Lors de la chirurgie de mes cataractes, Dr Nguyen a été très doux ce qui a largement contribué à me sentir rassurée. Mon conjoint en fera l'expérience sous peu. Votre patiente Paulette Proulx . Merci infiniment. xx
I have a very advanced cataract and poor vision for several years, Dr.nguyen gave back my sight with a flawless surgery, I got my vision from 20 years ago and am so happy with the result.

Took my elderly father to see him. He was Impatient with the slowness of his movements, and inability to respond quickly to requests. Explained to me his adult daughter that my father would be unable to comply with post-op instructions thus not a good candidate for cataract surgery. Chastised me saying I should have taken him for surgery long ago - yet I just learned that he had cataracts one month ago! very poor bedside manner. Never had a health professional talk to me like that - and I am a health professional. Long wait to be seen also difficult for elderly persons. If you are over 65 avoid this fellow!

Very good doctor but i wish he'd listen and take more time explaining things. Average time spent in his office must be 2 minutes! You feel you bother him asking him things. His Attitude is not what it should be. If that doesnt bother you, well then he's a fine doctor

Words cannot adequately express the thinking and sensation of gratitude which I feel for Dr. Tuong-Nam Nguyen, ophthalmologist from Lakeshore Ophthalmology centre in Pointe-Claire. He is very kind, helpful and caring for his patients. In my case, he was off one day but his office approached him with my eye problem, he took the matter in his hands and contacted the pharmacist Tatiana at Jean Coutu located on Gouin Blvd. in Cartierville. He prescribed the medication for me and instructed his office to call me and explain all what he has done and he gave me the appointment to see me in two weeks’ time. For the last few weeks I had been calling to see him and I was always able to see him on the same day. This shows how much he cares for his patients.

I have been a patient of Dr.Nguyen for the last 10 years. He has treated my glaucoma with dedication and skill. I was also impressed by his surgical skill, I was given back my sight when other doctors told my cataract surgery would be too risky. Over the years, I have referred to him friends and close family members who have all been satisfied

Went to see this doctor. Spent all of 2 minutes with me, did not ask what problem was, and just told me I had normal age related macular changes. Did not even tell me which eye. I have been having vision problems for a few months and this was not addressed at all. Don't waste your time. I called back the clinic to ask some questions about the results of my test and was told he would not even answer my questions unless I made another appointment. I am a nurse, and this is definately not the way to treat patients!!!
excellent results in my mother's cataract surgery.

Etant une personne tres difficile a operer La peur me rend incontrolable. Suite a la particularite de mon cas le Dr Nguyen et moi avons survecu: le resultat est plus qu,excellent. Merci merci mille fois merci Mme Paradis
He sees his patients as if he is doing them a favor.
good doctor. helpful. great result with cataract surgery
Dr. Nguyen is a very fine doctor, and gave me a great deal of confidence both in the procedure (cataract operation), as well as his competence. I am a very satisfied patient.

Si Je pouvais mettre -5/5 je l'aurais fait!

Peut-être est-il bon chirurgien, mais aucunement humain, aucun respect, traite le patient comme une merde, aucune écoute, ne rassure pas le patient anxieux et inquiet. Se prend pour un autre. Vraiment choquée par l'approche de ce personnage. Le sarrau blanc lui a monté à la tête... Il mérite une plainte au collège des médecins pour son attitude inacceptable!
Je n’ai jamais eu une si bonne vision. Un excellent chirurgien.

Très respectueux de nos émotions devant nos inquiétudes. Explique et donne en détails La chronologie et la procédure de la chirurgie et les suivis nécessaires. Il est un médecin ophtalmologiste avec une spécialité son temps est important . C’est à nous comme patient de comprendre ce bout là.

Parfois beaucoup de délais à sa clinique mais excellent chirurgien. Il peut sembler rigide au début mais prends le temps de s'intéresser à ses patients lorsqu'il a plus de jeu dans son horaire. Il prend le temps d'expliquer et de répondre aux questions.
Saved my eye. Extremely comptetent. Very good support team. Polite, empathic etc. Helpfull.

EXCELLENT MEDECIN HUMAIN PREND LE TEMPS D ECOUTER NOS PREOCCUPATIONS IL M A OPERE ET M A REDONNE UNE 2E VIE CAR JE NE VOYAIS PRESQUE PLUS RIEN IL ME REVOIS REGULIEREMENT,TRES BON SUIVI MERCI DR DUVAL L GUERIN

Très humain, compréhensif, prends le temps d'expliquer. Il suit ma fille pour la maladie de Stargardt, une dégénérescence maculaire juvénile et est disponible pour suivi. C'est rassurant de se sentir soutenu.
My father suffered complications after this dr. did his glaucoma surgery. terrible dr.
successful Cataract surgery and follow up appointment

Reading the reviews below make no sense. Dr. Kasner doesn't seem very knowledgeable and doesn't seem to know what he is doing. The worst is that he doesn't explain anything to the patients. Dr Oscar Kasner m'a opéré des cataractes aux deux yeux. Ce chirurgien est très compétent et on se sent en très bonnes mains pour l'opération. La décision d'opérer est le produit d'une bonne communication entre le médecin et le patient; on ne se sent jamais forcé à quoi que ce soit et Dr Kasner prend le temps nécessaire pour faire en sort que le patient assume pleinement son choix. Il prête une attention adéquate aux détails et l'organisation des visites et des interventions est accompagné par une logistique impeccable. Les opérations ont eu lieu à l'Hôpital général Juif de Montréal, un établissement universitaire de premier rang. Le personnel du service de chirurgie est très compétent et l’attention au patient est remarquable. Il faut faire une mention spéciale de la compétence de la secrétaire de Dr Kasner, Anne, une personne qui organise à la perfection l'opération et le suivi. Le bras droit de Dr Kasner, Monsieur Marc Renaud, est une personne qui connait très bien son travail, d'une grande courtoisie et qui permet au patient de se voir apprécié et confiant. Je recommande sans aucune hésitation Dr Oscar Kasner comme un ophtalmologiste et chirurgien très compétent et comme une personne de grande qualité, et cette recommandation est extensive, comme je l'ai déjà indiqué, à l'hôpital et à l'équipe de Dr Kasner.

a doctor Oscar Kasner( Montreal, Jewish hospital) who can not be trusted.If you have a problem with eyes try to find a professional If you do not want to lose yours eyesight. this doctor is very bad and will lie to your face that all is well. it happened to me.

Dr Kasner is an amazing doctor, very competent, very human, nice.. I don't know what more I could say as I think a world of him. I have been his glaucoma patient for 11 years. Would not find anyone like him and I am happy to be his patient. GOD BLESSED HIM!

The best ophthalmologist. I had a iridotomy for both eyes ( a laser procedure for narrow angles) at the JGH. Everything went very well. Dr. Fichman was very kind and efficient. The whole procedur took about a minute without any pain! I highly recommend this doctor.

Je ne crois pas que plusieurs médecin travaille encore avec autant de compassion envers ses patients.

Je n'ai que de bon commentaire pour la rapiditite a laquelle mon pere a ete traite. Lorsque mon optometriste a remarque que je devais voir un specialiste de la retine ( un samedi) tres rapidement il a ete capable de rejoindre Dr.Cordahi qui est venu me rencontrer en urgence. Medecin tres disponible pour nous expliquer et me prendre en charge. Par la suite le suivi a ete fait a sa clinique et doit remercier son personnel qui ma permis d'avoir des soins avec du personnel agreable et qui prend le temps de s'assurer que mes questions et inquietudes ont toutes ete repondu.

Mon père (très nerveux et sensible en ce qui a trait aux yeux) avait besoin de rencontrer un spécialiste pour régler un problème qui sévissait depuis longtemps. Il a rapidement été pris en charge par le Dr. Cordahi et son adjointe qui se faisaient tout deux très rassurant. La demande de mon père a été traité avec professionnalisme, civisme et respect. Son problème a enfin été régler et il voit maintenant la vie du ''bon oeil'' . Je n'ai que des bons mots pour le Dr. et son équipe. Merci.

I was treated by Dr. Cordahi for a retina detachment. He explained well what was involved for the operation and what I would need to do afterwards to help avoid a re-occurrence. Friendly, fully bilingual.

"LE SYSTÈME - LE SYSTÈME" me direz-vous! Pour des personnes entre 70 et 90 ans attendre 5 à 6 heures pour une injection de 2 minutes et ce malgré un RDV? Traitement si souvent déficient, hygiène, anesthésie locale et prévention des infections négligées car trop de patients???? Le docteur a l'opportunité de travailler avec un androïde féminin, aucune empathie, aucune notion de service à la clientèle, difficile d'approche et je crois qu'elle n'a pas été programmé pour parler? Dr Cordahi's, svp n'ajusté rien, car dans vos connaissances Universitaire et votre expérience de vie, les notions "JUGEMENTS- DISCERNEMENTS-ACTIONS étaient facultatifs? Je vous pardonne, c'est le SYSTÈME. Je ne doute pas de vos compétences mais vous devenez comme votre assistante "un androïde" qui marche au volume et considère les gens comme des NUMÉROS? Vous me faite pitié, vous êtes l'image de la SANTÉ, désolant pour mes petits enfants.
Dr Cordahi's, j'ose écrire ces quelques phrases si souvent entendues dans la salle d'attente mais que les gens n'osent pas vous dire de peur d'être rejetés.
Alice.

A l'age de 13 ans j'ai subit une opération par anasthesie generale, pour une dechirure a la retine. J'ai par la suite ete suivi annuellement aupres du dr Cordahi. Lors de ma derniere visite, en Janvier 2014, j'ai rencontrer le Dr Duval, collegue du dr cordahi puisque celui-ci avait accumuler trop de retard! On m'annonce que j'ai des kystes au centre la vue qui obstru ma vision. Dr Cordhai aurai documenté le debut de cette apparitions en 2009 mais je n'ai JAMAIS ete mise au courant. J'ai 23 ans et je risque de perdre la vue a tout moment a cause de son TOTAL manque de professionalisme. Les kystes en questions ont cicatrisé, nous ne pouvons rien faire. Ce medecin n'a aucun jugement!
Dr Cordahi is a knowledgeable and competent ophthalmologist, who is caring, helpful, always ready to listen, and to explain.
a part du temps d'attente qui est tres long, pour cause de son implication d'urgentogue a sre-justine et son nombre élevé de patients, il est connaissant et chirurgien tres efficace

Selon moi, le Dr Cordahi est un chirurgien ophtalmo remarquable tant par ses connaissances techniques que par sa grande disponibilité. L'énormité de sa clientèle en fait foi. Il m'a opéré pour une cataracte bien ordinaire par voie d'anesthésie locale. Toutefois, du fait que je souffre d'asthme et d'emphysème il a fallu que je porte, durant l'intervention, un masque de CPAP afin d'éviter que je tousse ce qui aurait pu causer d'autres problèmes. Le masque recouvrait mon nez ce qui lui laissait peu de place pour effectuer son intervention. Étant plus préoccupé par mon confort que par la facilité de ses mouvements, il a accepté volontiers de procéder avec ce masque fort dérangeant pour lui. L'opération s'est finalement bien déroulée et fut un succès. Je le recommande très fortement.

I would like to comment on all four aspects. As for the staff they are helhful doing the best they can do given the stress and the big number of patients they have to handle per day. As for his puctuality doctors should be excused because i know that sometimes they have to attend to some urgent matters beyond their control, on the other hand he does not leave the hospital before he attends to all patients waiting to see him. We should not forget as well the procedure of preparing the patient before consultancy that is eyedrops and the time it takes the eye to be ready before the doctor can see you. He is very helful and he explains all what the patient needs to know. In the field of detachement I think he is very knowledgeable and one of the best if not the best in Montreal. He goes out of way to treat and help his patients, he operated on me on a sunday and he had to return from Ottawa to do this. I think the hospital should get a bit more organized and this is waht I felt each visit.

mon chum a eu affaire avec dr.cordahi.Oui la pemiere fois ca bien été il a été opéré pour un décollement de rétine ce fut un succes.Ensuite encore probleme de yeux il retourne voir le médecin la,il y avait probleme de collement de rétine.Suite a ca il a perdu son oeil pcq.sa rétine de l'oeil a été déchiré et il a laisser plein de résidus.quand il s'est apercu de son erreur il l'a transférer a un autre médecin.Mais il était trop tard.Moi malheureusement je n'ai pas pu suivre les problemes de mon chum car,j'étais atteinte de cancer des 2 seins et,j'étais tres faible.Tout ca pour vous dire qu'il a jouer a la balle avec mon chum et,aujourd'hui il a perdu son oeil et est entrain de perdre l'autre!!!Imaginez vous ce que je pense de cordahi????????????

Je suis entré d'urgence le 5 aout 2010 a 7h30 le matin a l'hôpital Maisonneuve-Rosemont, une heure plus tard j'étais en clinique d'ophtalmologie. Le Dr Cordahi m'a opéré d'urgence en après-midi pour un décollement de la rétine (laser et injection de gaz dans l'œil). Je suis ressorti de l'hôpital a 16h30. Deux jours après le samedi matin son collègue (Dr ???) a constaté le recollement de la rétine et a pu effectuer un autre traitement au laser. J'ai été très bien soigné par tous incluant internes et assistants. J'attends maintenant la guérison complète de mon œil. Pour ce qui est de la personne qui a refusé de prendre le petit comprimé blanc pour relaxer, elle devrait aller se faire soigner en Afrique peut être qu'ils opèrent à froid à Mogadiscio !

This Dr. operated my daughter for an emergency detachment of the retina. 2:00 am in the morning was the only time he could get an operating room. But he was there. Great Dr. Nice and patient person. Took the time to explain and answer our questions. Thank you Dr.
Its true that the waiting lines are long but he`s confident in his diagnosis and is completely bilingual. But be warned to wait at least 4 hours.
Excellent médecin malgré 4h d'attente avec rv. Donne de bonnes explications et garde un bon suivi.

Je me suis présentée à la clinique d'urgence ophtalmologique tôt le matin. Il a pris tout son temps pour m'examiner malgré que plusieurs personnes attendaient pour leur rendez-vous. J'étais en train de perdre la vision à mon oeil gauche et il a diagnostiqué un décollement de la rétine. Il m'a dit qu'il pouvait m'opérer maintenant ou au moment de mon choix, sous anesthésie générale. Il a vraiment tout fait en son possible pour m'accomoder parce que j'allaitais un nouveau-né. Il m'a expliqué patiemment comment il allait faire malgré ma nervosité. L'opération fut un succès. Merci !

Il est un excellent médecin. J'ai eu un problème de dégénéressence maculaire liè â l'âge à l'oeil droit. j'avais perdu la moitié de mon champs de vision. Grâce à 2 opérations au laser et à une infiltration de cortison, j'ai retrouvé pleinement la vue. Pas besoin de vous dire la reconnaissance que j'ai pour lui. Il est vraiment un médecin compétent, humain. Il est vrai que le temps d'attente est horrible, (au moins 4 heures avec un rendez-vous), mais j'ai trouvé que cela valait la peine pour retrouver la vue. Je pense que la direction de l'hôpital est responsable du mauvais service, mais ce n'est certes pas la faute des médecins.

He is one of the best specialists in his field. The waiting time is long because he takes the time necessary to treat you. The first time that I saw him, he proposed a treatment which could avoid surgery. When I asked him when he would do it, he replied right now. I saw him in a follow-up on Saturday when the clinic is closed. I saw three specialists before him and all three stated that they wanted him to see me. He is respected by all his colleagues and they seek his opinion on difficult cases. He was very polite and clear in his instructions and took all the time that was needed for my case. I have only the best opinion of him.

je suis d'accord que l'attente est longue, mais il m'a traite sur le champ alors que j'avais un decollement de retine. cela lui a pris 1h30 environ mais comment j'etait content lorsque je suis sorti de son bureau et desole pour les patients qui ont du attendre parce qu'il s'occupait de moi.la prochaine fois je vais me rappeler cela lorsque je vais attendre.

Je suis très satisfaite du Dr Cordahi .C'est vrai que le temps d'attente est long mais il a beaucoup de patients.Cependant quand nous le rencontrons il est attentif à nos besoins et sa bonne humeur est réconfortante.Ma chirurgie fut une réussite. Mille mercis et continuez votre bon travail.
après 7 1/2 heures d'attente, le 22 novembre 2007 le temps de la consultation a durée 2 minutes. Suite à cette mauvaise expérience, je ne serai définitivement plus un (PATIENT)

Après 6 heures d'attente,lors d'un R.V. planifié, j'ai eu droit à une approche générale arrogante de sa part, ainsi que d'un examen que je pourrais qualifier de brutal et expéditif. En fait, je suis sortie du bureau complètement sonnée,ayant patienté tout ce temps pour recevoir le traitement professionnel auquel je m'attendais, qui s'est avéré ne pas être au rendez-vous ce jour-là.

Très bon médecin.Il a sauvé les yeux de ma fille. Toujours de bonne humeur.Il répond à toutes nos questions.Même s'il est très occupé,il prend tout le temps nécessaire afin de nous rassurés.Merci Docteur Cordahi.Vous êtes le meilleur.

Dr Annick Mwilambwe as fait une chirurgie a mon oeil PTÉREGION ce médecin est d’une gentillesse et délicstesse qui ma donner confiance

Merci nous avons de très bon médecin qu Québec.

Simply the best doctor on Earth. She has a great heart, amazing humor (and is really pretty!!) 
I recovered my vision. Throughout the whole process, she was patient, loving and caring!
J'ai été opérée des paupières par le Dr Annick. La procédure s'est bien passé, le staff était attentif. Je recommanderai le Dr Annick sans hésiter.

J'ai été opéré dernièrement par Dr Mwilambwe pour la chirurgie des paupières. Le résultat était bon, je n'ai eu aucune douleur. Je la rémercie sincèrement elle a été vraiment professionnelle, je ne l'oublierais jamais. J'ai rajeuni de 10 ans!!

Docteure Mwilambwe m’a soigné pour une chalazion qui s’etait aggravée. J’avais très peur, je pleurais avant la chirurgie et elle m’a réconforté. J’ai trouvé le docteur très professionnelle et humaine. Elle a pris le temps de s’assurer que j’étais confortable. Avec le nombre de patients qu’elle a, je trouve impressionnant qu’elle se montre compatissante. Son équipe aussi était parfaite et a su bien me parler! Je recommande Dre Mwilambwe a tout le monde!!!
Really helpful. Spends a lot time explaining to me, which caused a delay to other patients. Would definitely recommend
Elle ne devrait pas être médecin. Aucun respect ne prend pas le temps . Elle m a blessé à un oeil pendant son examen. Un conseil fuyez surtout si vous êtes un peu âgé

Aucune humanité et super brutal elle respect pas ses patients J avais rendez pour operation le 3 oct 2017 depuis 10 am que j étais la toute prête petite pilule et en plus catetere a 4h elle a canceller operation .Remis au 12 oct le 12 oct 2017 elle m opéré pour ma cataracte .Elle égratigner mon iris beaucoup de mal de tête et vue super brouiller je suis aller la voir 3 fois en urgence que sa allait pas Elle étais super arrogante me disait aller voir votre médecin ou bien aller a l hopital que mes mal de tête venait d ailleurs sans jamais me dire qu elle avait égratigner mon iris .je lui disait je fonctionne plus pas capable de écouter télévision et sortir en auto et faire de l ordinateur que sa me donnait des super mal de tête la lumière .elle me répond porter vos lunette de soleil dans la maison .au bout de 1 semaine après mon operation je suis aller chez mon médecin de famille qui a confirmer iris égratigner Je sui retourner a la clinique en urgence changer de médecin ophtalmologiste il ma confirmer iris égratigner que sa va guérir d ici 3mois a 4 mois Toute une professionnel cette Annick elle aurai pus me dire son erreur Je vais changer de clinique je crois que a cette clinique l’es médecins se tienne je vais aller en priver pour savoir quoi faire avec mon oeil bonne chance si vous la consulte

Aucune humanité. Manque de respect. Brutale. N'aime pas qu'on lui pose des questions.

Je n'ai jamais vue de ma vie un docteur aussi impoli.

J'avais rendez-vous ce matin avec elle pour la première fois et je l'ai trouve formidable. Elle était de bonne humeur et très intentionnée. Elle a pris le temps qu'il fallait pour écouter et répondre à mes questions. Je pense que les commentaires négatifs que j'ai lu la concernant, ne sont tout simplement pas tolérables, car j'ai vraiment été surprise de la voir si différente de ce que je pensait au départ. J'ai même hâte de la revoir pour la suite des choses.

Monique Michaud

Horrible!

Sans respect et n'écoute pas! A déjà sa recette de traitement préparée à l'avance. Elle ne veut surtout pas que vous la questionner ça la dérange!

Ce genre de personne ne devrait pas être MD ... 

C Désolant 

Retard de 1h45!!!!!!!

Aucune considération pour ses patients. Manque de respect le plus simple. Ne se présente pas bouscule les gens. Elle est impatiente. Et...te propose de d aller dans une clinique privée bien sûr la sienne.

Dr Mwilambwe a pris en charge d'urgence notre fille entre ses patients alors qu'elle ne traite pas les enfants normalement! Tout au long du traitement ses secrétaires ont toujours pu la joindre et nous faire de la place peu importe la clinique ou l'hôpital où elle se trouvait!

Elle est excessivement compétente en son domaine. Pour ceux qui se plaignent de son attitude parce qu'ils ont remis en question son opinion, faudrait peut-être vous remettre en question vous-même...

Des gens de mon entourage travaillent dans le domaine de la santé et n'avaient que de bons mots pour elle lorsqu'ils ont su qu'elle prenait en charge notre fille.

Si j'ai un conseil à vous donner: faites-lui confiance et ça ira très bien!

Le Dr Annick a des doigts de fée 

Gentille agréable et très professionnelle 

opération de mon second oeil sous peu '' ptérygion"

Comme a toutes les cliniques l'attente est longue pour la première visite , mais pour l'opération aucune attente

Merci a toutes son équipe et surtout au Dr Annick 

Élisabeth Boyle

Le medecin bien sauf le staff se cherche beaucoup ont sens qui a pas d équipe et la secrétaire est pourri et elle a pas d aide ont sens que les medecin se fou de leur staff il se rend pas conte que sans eux y son zéro organiser
She was unimaginably rude, unkind and unpatient. I would not recommend her
Une hostie d'folle! J'ai eu le malheur d'être en désaccord avec son diagnostic à la con!
Excellente chirurgienne, ma vue est comme à vingt ans. Merci beaucoup.

J'ai été pour une conjonctivite et elle à bien vérifié mes yeux et mes paupières puis elle m'a donné plusieurs renseignement et m'a remis plusieurs échantillons pour me soigner...Malgré le temps d'attente de 2h30 avec rendez-vous j'ai apprécié son service

TOTALEMENT PROFESSIONNELLE!! trés gentile, as pris le temps de tout m'expliquer même si je n'étais pas sa patiente, j'y suis aller en urgence & j'étais sa dernière patiente très tard. Oui il y a un délai mais on m'avais aviser alors je m'y attendais & ca valais la peine de patienter. 
Je la recommande" les yeux fermer" :-)
She was really good and really patient, extremely helpful and gave me thorough explanation of my condition. I'd recommend her to anybody!

J ai vu Dr Mwilambwe à 3 reprises pour un suivi de glaucome potentiel. À chacune des rencontres, elle présentait un délai de plus de 2 h30... Je semblais la déranger à chaque fois. Elle entre dans la salle de traitement sans nous saluer, s installe devant son ordinateur sans nous adresser un regard et peut demeurer ainsi pendant près de 3-4 minutes en toute ignorance!!! Pour qui se prend elle? ( Des diplômes universitaires, j en possède 2 et jamais je n oserais traiter mes patients de la sorte!!! ) Elle conseille ensuite un traitement de 300$ par 2 mois non couvert par la RAMQ et ne remplie aucun papier pouvant nous aider à être rembourser (ce que le pharmacien m explique plus tard au comptoir). Ce médecin semble se regarder marcher et nullement intéressée par autrui... Cherchez ailleurs svp

Je ne sais pas si cette médecin a trop de travail ou quoi mais chaque fois que je suis allée la voir elle était de très mauvaise humour, même impolie! Depuis 4 RDV avec elle ma condition c'est nullement amélioré.. Chaque fois mes prescription etaient changées et de plus en plus chers...Maintenant (a la demande de mon médecin de famille ) j'attends de voir une autre oftalmo...Je suis restée très amère face a cette femme médecin, je suis une personne très polie et avec beaucoup de patience et c'est la première fois de ma vie que j'ai trouve un médecin si "sauvage".
Excellent service, elle etait bien attentive, elle m'a expliqué ma condition, ce qui m'a beaucoup aidé à comprendre le processus par lequel j'allais passer pour mes yeux. Je l'a conseille à tous !
Moi elle m'a opérer pour mon œil et elle a été très très patiente avec moi. Elle a bien répondu a mes questions. C est vrai que l'heure des rdv n'est pas respecter mais elle est très occuper.

This ophthalmologist is not good , doesn’t listen to you , I’ve waited 3 hours and I had a appointment ,she diagnose me with a problem that I didn’t have after looking in my eyes for only 3 seconds, she prescribe eyes drops that gave me serious headache I ended up at the ER

Médecin très attentionnée qui prend le temps de bien examiner. Elle est une des rares ophtalmologistes qui prend le temps d'examiner les paupières et est très rassurante. Certes l'heure des rendez-vous n'est pas toujours respectée, mais cela est dû notamment au fait qu'elle prend le temps pour ses patients. Personnellement, je préfère attendre un peu plus pour la consulter, car elle a notre santé à coeur.
I am 75 years old and I have recovered my 20 year old vision !! What else is there to say !!
Très mauvaise gestion du temps. Les RV sont donnés aux 15 min. Ils durent au plus 15-20 min. Et j'ai attendu 3 heures avant de passer:( Aucune impression que le service médical est adéquat.
Very attentive and knowledgeable. Member of Maisonneuve Rosemont hospital churgical team

J'ai consulté plusieurs medecins (dans le public comme dans le privé), personne ne semblait trouver une solution a mon probleme, jusqu'au jour ou mon opto m'a referé a cette dame dont il n'entendait que de bons commentaires. Aujourd'hui, après qq visites au Dre Annick je suis aux anges; c'est un tres bon medecin, tres humain (normal que l'attente soit longue puisqu'elle prend le temps d'expliquer a chacun son probleme). Au premier rendez-vous, javoue avoir ete un peu hesitant puisque mon opto m'avait dit qu'elle venait de finir sa medecine (je me suis dit qu'est ce que cette jeune femme va trouver que des "anciens" n'ont pas pu trouver), son assistante m'a rassuré qu'elle pratiquait depuis tres longtemps en Afrique, mais venait de finir son equivalence du Canada. Avoir fait l'ophtalomologie 2fois, normal qu'elle s'y connaisse. Je la recommande a tous et je n'ai que de bons mots pour elle.

Elle est très occupée, donc le retard est compréhensible. Elle a quand même pris le temps de bien m'expliquer mon problème (Ptérygion)et la procédure pour l'opération. Très rassurante et humaine, toujours souriante. L'infirmière qui l'assistait lors de l'opération lui a demandé de l'assister à chaque fois car elle aimait sa méthode de travail!
Wow! She found my problem and have me a surgery at a time. She saved my eyes!

J'ai eu une chirurgie de l'oeil dans son cabinet. L'opération n'a pas été réussie, ce qu'on devait enlever ne l'a jamais été complètement. Je devais rester l'oeil rouge 5 à 6 semaines, et presque un an après, il l'est toujours. J'ai vu un autre ophtalmologiste qui m'a dit qu'on devait opérer de nouveau. Il m'a aussi dit que ce genre d'opération se faisait dans un environnement hospitalier et non en cabinet. Lorsque je lui ai dit ce que j'avais payé, il m'a regardé et m'a dit: je ne ferai pas de commentaire.Je suis resté très amer face à cette expérience. Mes visites post-opératoires avec elles ne m'ont pas rassuré et m'ont plutôt poussé à aller voir ailleurs.
Dr.Mwilambwe a pris le temps nécessaire pour bien faire l'examen et de m'expliquer en détail. Elle a été d'un professionnaliste exemplaire.

Very nice women. I have a small growth on my eyelid and she explained the procedure that i was to have in deatail. Took time to reassure me as I mentionned i was very scared to have the procedure done. Would recommend her to friends and family

I went to this clinic bellevue, first they ask $200 for the eye exam and in the same time you have to give to them your medical card my god how they stole money and has to be cash, very careful, and the last this doctor is very cold, doesn't like to do any explanation, just to do money money, she choose the wrong proffession, no good at all, maybe need more experience and be kind

I was in a wheelchair at the time of the appointment with her. She did not care about my situation at all and did not help me. Her staff did not assist me. She dealt with me like if I was a file only. Poor consideration for patients
Great Doctor! Sees my three boys. Had only great experiences with him.

The most unprofessional staff. The nurse told my son as soon as she saw him that he would not get his chalizon drained. That we were lucky to have gotten an appointment and usually it’s a year waiting time. She then said she would talk to the Dr and tell him what she thought. He is a minor I was not allowed to go in the room with him as per Dr request he saw him for less than a minute sent us home with NO explanation and a prescription for a cream. AVOID him at all cost him and especially his nurse.

Honestly I don't understand the bad reviews... We had an appointment in september 2023 for my 7 year old daughter who speaks mostly french. The patient rooms are small so we were asked by staff to stand near the door. It's an understandable request. Dr Koenekoop was on time, kind, helpful, didn't seem like he was rushing us out of the room and he and answered all our questions. We are bilingual but he switched to french to communicate with her without a problem. A+++ Thank you!

I cannot comment on Dr. Koenekoop’s knowledge in his field. Based on his credentials, he is very qualified. However, my experience with him was not good. I had to correct him 3 times when he referred to my daughter as a boy (her name is also clearly female). I would have to say his awareness during the visit made me question if he was actually focused at all in examining my child. I also did not like how his assistant (the lady who puts the drops in the eyes) was asked to pin down my baby while this Dr examined her. The manner in which she handled my baby was rather rough. At the end, the doctor said he was happy with my daughters eyes, but to come back in 6 months and that she will likely need eye glasses to treat a condition. I didn’t quite understand the diagnosis as he rushed out and actually admitted to his assistant that he was losing it. I asked to speak to the assistant after to clarify the diagnosis and to point out that the appointment was completely disorganized. She was rude and defiant, telling me the doctor is a specialist and I should “enjoy my baby”. It’s a bit scary to rely on what you think are highly qualified professionals to take care of your child when this is the experience you have.
Dr. Koenekoop has been seeing my son since he has been ten months and has provided the best possible knowledge and service. He has helped my son's eye sigh tremendously and we are so so grateful.

On vient juste d'avoir une consultation avec Dr Koenekoop, très bon médecin, compétent, sympathique et efficient. L'examen n'a pas duré longtemps, rapide et efficace. La clinique est très propre, c'est rassurant dans cette période de virus.

After years of being sent to another institution without getting answers to our child’s eye issue, Dr Koenekoop took the time to thoroughly explain her situation. It is the first team in 4 years someone examined her properly. Dr Koenekoop took the time needed and set us at ease. He is kind and compassionate, and his assistant was fantastic with our daughter who is petrified of eye drops. So happy and relieved we were finally referred to the right team. Highly recommend.

Had a great experience with Dr. Koenekoop and his team. We had an appointment for our son and came out with our minds at ease. He took the time to explain what was happening and answer all of our questions. Would definitely recommend.
I have been seeing Dr. Koenekoop since I was a child, he performed surgery on my lazy eye. I am 30 now. It is always a pleasure seeing him - highly recommend!

I was referred to this Doctor by my Optometrist and I can honestly say that I had never experienced such a poor interaction with a physician before. Although the physician was punctual and the assisting nurse was phenomenal, the Doctor was unpleasant and would not address me directly nor answer my questions about the issue troubling my son. When I attempted to raise a question, the doctor said that he would not fight with me on the matter and walked away. He later gave my son a referral form for a second opinion (evidently, I was asked not to be present for that exchanged). The assisting nurse even apologized for his behavior. If I have to google medical terms and try to understand the issue at hand, I am not quite sure why Doctors are necessary nor paid for that matter. Very unfortunate.

Don't believe any of the negative commentary you read on here - he's an incredible doctor. Operated on my 3 month year old on Christmas Eve because it was urgent. He's been nothing but kind and professional to us for 12 years now. If you want someone who knows what they are doing, see him. He's world renowned and still takes the time to see kids 5 days a week.

His assistant was horrible, my daughter said “i don’t like her she’s rude and sarcastic.

I don’t know why she has to perform eye examination totally unprofessional, we really missed our previous opthamologist who had retired. 😔

My child never kept her glasses prescribed by the other ophthalmologists during 2 years. We finally have called to see Dr Konekoop. Yes, he was really in rush. Yes he doesn't explain much! Yes he examined my daughter's eyes less than 1 minute, but... guess what! My daughter is so comfortable with her new glasses prescribed by him that she sleeps with! I can't believe that and I 'm so grateful to meet this doctor! Very knowledgeable, he knows his job perfectly!

Awful doctor. Brough daughter (little ball on eyelid) with a requisition indicating to visit the ophthalmology and his answer was: I'm an eye doctor, not a stye. Secretary and assistant SHOULD NOT be seeing Kids. Lack of empathy and 0 effort to make my kid comfortable. Horrible experience on February 17th. 2022
He's been following my daughter for the past 8 years. Always amazing and extremely knowledgeable and helpful!

Horrible experience, his assistant was so rude, yelling at parents and children. Never care of patient. He exam my son's eyes in 1 minute and gave a 300 degree eye glasses prescription. After checking with other optometrist with 30 minutes, it came out only 150 degree. Must avoid this doctor
Terrible dr so rude and impatient don’t work with children...Learn some bedside manners and don’t be so condescending!
Terrible experience . Misdiagnosed my daughter twice. Terrible approach. Working at a children’s hospital he should have some idea of how to deal with kids. Late and rude to parents as well.

Won't be patient enough to properly examine my 1 year old kid. Extremely awkward doctor with absolutely no bedside manners for patient and parent. Will ask question but not listen to your answer, will not let you ask questions. It is very frustrating to see that this terrible public servant is working and gets paid with our taxes. He is also not fluent in French at all. In the end, he just left the examination room without saying a word and did not want to come out of his office when I asked the front staff to see him. He also judges your situation with no knowledge of your kid's life history. His technician is also horrible with kids, not gentle at all. Do not loose your time with him.
Most amazing eye doctor ever!! He operated on my baby girl twice to correct her crocked eye. He has completely fixed the problem and no longer requires glasses. Many thanks to this miracle worker!
Always late or, more recently, simply doesn’t contact you for schedule virtual appointments. Worst doctor with zero to no regard for his patients and/or their families.

Il a vu ma fille en ophtalmologie une fois. Il ne nous a jamais adressé la parole sauf pour nous dire quelques mots en anglais comme "sit down" "don't move"(ma fille ne parle pas anglais...) l'examen a duré 45 secondes et il m'a dit que ma fille n'avait rien. Résultat? 2mois plus tard ma fille est paralysée et est hospitalisée pour une grosse tumeur au cerveau et dois faire de la chimiothérapie pendant 1an et demi. Et c'est cette tumeur qui causait le problème qu'elle avait a l'oeil. Heureusement j'ai demandé une autre opinion. Dire que cet idiot est le chef du département d'ophyalmologie...

His ego this is so big it prevents him from doing a proper diagnosis. His exams are rushed, he ignores patients questions. I got a 2nd opinion which confirmed my son’s diagnosis, which Dr Koenekoop missed. Avoid at all cost, they guy is a joke.

Dr Koenekoop a suivi mes 2 filles pendant leur 5 premières années. C est un médecin exceptionnel; à la fois très professionnel et humain. Il a pris le temps de m expliquer tous les risques / probabilité de développement de la maladie ( et en français) et malgré le fait que ceux-ci étaient très minimes a continué à voir mes enfants tous les ans jusqu’à leur 5 ans respectifs. Mes enfants l ont également beaucoup apprécié. Je me suis sentie chanceuse qu il s occupe de leur suivi ophtalmologique. Je le recommande sans hésitation.

Je comprends pas comment avec autant de commentaires négatifs sur ce soi disant docteur il est tjr dans son poste c'est parmi les pire et ces infirmières ne sont pas meilleurs mon fils a des sérieux problèmes de vue qui influence sur son développement et a chaque fois qu'on a un RDV avec lui il ne répond pas a nos questions et il nous traite comme des beau a rien on ce sent avec lui humiliés et on repart chaque fois très triste et déçu SVP il faut trouver une solution pour ce médecin

My children have been patients for over 12 years. We have a multitude of eye problems and he has been so wonderful at recognizing the obscure genetic issues that other doctors have overlooked. A very kind, caring and gentle doctor who helped us avoid surgery with at least 2 of out children. When one of our daughters needed to get in with a neurologist immediately he helped make it happen and she received the urgent care necessary for her medical condition. Without his ability to recognize her genetic disorders I am not sure she would have been able to get the prompt treatment she needed. I am forever grateful. His expertise is highly valuable and many patients with highly specific needs come to see him. I would not recommend him for a child who simply needs a routine eye check, this is a doctor who is best with children who need highly specialized medical training. The wait is long (average 4 hours for most of our visits), but when you have the unusual medical issues like our family has we know he is worth the wait!!!

My daughter Evah has been his patient for seven years. We have gone from wearing an eye patch all day/everyday to finally bring out of glasses. 

He has always taken the time to explain everything in detail and answer our questions. He has been absolutely wonderful with Evah.

Tanya Bensimon
Malhonnete j n ai j amais rencontré et j aimé pas rencontré un médecin sans valeurs comme lui

He is completely professional, knowledgeable,gentle and kind. He helped me with horrible inflammation and brought my eyes back to health. I am forever grateful for his help. His staff are sweet and prompt. I could never say a bad word about someone who saved me from going blind.
He does a diagnosis in than two minutes, the consequence a bad prescription. He also suggested to buy glasses in a unprofessional store as Dubuc. Be careful !!

Nous avons reçu Dr. Koenekoop à 3 reprises. Il est très expéditif et traite ses patients comme des numéros. Même quand vous lui posez des questions à propos des yeux de votre enfants, il ne prend pas la peine de vous expliquer. Quand il le fait, il te répond succinctement en anglais et avant de terminer, il demande à son assistante de faire rentrer un autre patient. 
Je comprends que ça pourrait arriver une fois, mais à 3 reprises. C'est frustrant !

In January 2018 he prescribed +3 glasses for my 5 month old son. In June 2018 he said that my son needs -3 glasses and he also said probably this would have been the wright diagnose from the beginning. (?!?!?) I went to see an optometrist and than another ophtalmologist for 2nd opinion, my son doesn't even need glasses!!! And -3???? Totally off! I know doctors are humans and they make mistakes, but this one is just not ignorable! My son is going to have also a surgery but not with him... not going back, not recommending.

This is one of the nastiest doctors I have ever met...Impatient aggressive and when we tried to ask him questions he humiliated us in front of his inters. Telling his interns 'look cant they see I am writing and they are asking me questions do you see what I need to go through'... If its too difficult for you retire! What are these types of doctors doing dealing with children and they have zero patience...Simply a horrible experience...

This doctor might have knowledge but I don’t understand how he can work with children. We had an appointment with my 2 year old. He was agressive and very impatient. He was complaining. Never going back. Maybe he was good years ago but we truly had a horrible experience.

J'ai rencontré ce médecin pour un problème génétique. J'étais très enthousiasmé par ses recherches pour "guérir" ma maladie. Je suis parti du Saguenay, me suis trouvé un transport pour aller à Montréal (je ne conduis pas vu ma condition), j'ai dormi près de l'hôpital. Mon rendez-vous était très tôt. Finalement, j'ai rencontré des résidents, très gentils, qui ont fait le résumé de ma situation et les examens... dans l'après-midi! Point de vue ponctualité, on repassera, mais bon les hôpitaux, on sait ce que c'est... Finalement, je l'ai rencontré avec toute une panoplie de médecins et il nous fait un beau discours sur son optimiste à trouver un "remède". J'étais fou de joie et ses collègues l'admirait! Il m'a remis de la documentation avec des vitamines à prendre et je suis reparti au Saguenay. Je l'ai vu en tout 5 minutes. Je vais à la pharmacie chercher les vitamines, le dosage écrit ne correspondait pas à ce genre de médicament. J'ai été à toutes les chaînes de pharmacie possibles et toujours la même réponse. À chaque fois la pharmacie a télécopié une demande pour préciser le dosage, jamais de réponse! J'ai tenté de communiquer avec lui par téléphone, par écrit, et mon médecin de famille aussi, rien à faire. Je suis vraiment déçu. Ça fait maintenant trois ans que j'attends des nouvelles, il m'avait parlé d'un an. J'ai parlé avec des connaissances qui l'ont déjà vu et le même discours revient : des belles promesses suivies de grandes déceptions.

Dr Koenekoop is a good Doctor he has been my Doctor since I'm little he has a lot of Knowledge about his field of Ophthalmology he diagnosed me when I was young with a terrible eye disorder he sees me every 6 months and we work together to make my eye stronger. He is not a Dismissive Doctor I complain of itchy eyes he looks and prescribes drops, He always is there to help. I'm grateful to have him as a Doctor. However His staff are Horrible They are rude and obnoxious and they seem they have nothing better to do and text and be on there cell phone on the job. I've complained to the Manager, However she dismissed me and was very rude. 
Overall I Strongly suggest this Doctor.
Very good appointment at the children with my son. I feel like we had all the information we needed and that Dr Koenekoop was very helpful and nice with us.

I read reviews here all the time but have never written one. That's how infuriating this appointment was! He arrived an hour late and then had a meeting (I believe with his students) for about 45 minutes which his staff seemed to know nothing about. And then he finally came out and called us in, announcing that he was expecting an urgent call so he would make our appointment as quick as possible; and he wasn't kidding! He didn't listen to anything I had to say regarding the fact that our issue was new and intermittent, barely looked at my child, and was very dismissive of the referral we had been given by a resident the day prior saying "no, you didn't see a doctor, you saw a resident" before walking off. Unfortunately, he is the head of Opthamology in this clinic so I couldn't even complain about him to anyone but himself. If you don't have time for patients, don't see patients! We will be seeing another doctor within the month, not to the surprise of his own secretary (who is fantastic by the way)

this doctor lays about everything in concern with your kid's eye health.

didn't let me enter with my kid. gave a presription for eye allergy and appointement in 1 year!

i said i didn't bring my kid for allergy, and this drops i still have a renewal of 1 year also.

to punish me he let me wait and i was the last one to be seen in the clinic as a revenge.

Drôle de lire autant de mauvais commentaires sur ce médecin et très peu de bons. Ça prouve que les gens insatisfaits écrivent plus que les satisfaits. C'est le sport National après tout. Mon fils est suivi par Dr Koenekoop depuis 14 ans. Nous avons toujours été bien servi autant par les infirmières que par le médecin lui même. Nos réponses ont toujours bien été répondus. Peut importe le médecin, je prépare mes questions d'avance le plus possible. En ce qui concerne le respect de l'horaire...comment arriver à respecter un horaire quand il faut se plier au petits caprices de chacun...les crises entre autre. Soit un médecin est patient / humain comme certains le mentionnent et qu'aucun rendez-vous n'est respecter et de loin. Voir les attentes d'au moins 2 heures après le l'heure du rendez-vous ou il est plus direct et moins volubile si le besoin n'y est pas et il arrive à récupérer un peu de temps. L'attente pour voir un Ophtalmologiste pour les enfants dépasses largement 6 mois d'attente. Pauvres patients qui sont sur la liste d'attente. En ce qui concerne les gens qui proviennent de Saskatoon. J'aurais appelé avant même de me déplacer. On dirait que les gens oublient le gros bon sens.

A terrible doctor, if he can call himself a doctor at all. Apparently, there is not enough knowledge for a doctor when prescribing the wrong medicines. His attitude towards children and adults is disgusting, lacking any respect. The same is true of his medical nurse, who has to put a drop in the eyes of the children and behaves terribly roughly with them. As a doctor, he should listen to patients, and he does not even give the right to the patients to say or ask something although you as a patient have been waiting for this appointment long time because you want to explain about your eye problems. He treats the patient as they are "the next number", not a human being. Apparently, his knowledge and abilities are very limited as an ophthalmologist , so he is careful nobody to say him something or ask him a question where he is obviously not competent. At this doctor, you can get a service to go to a regular technician for the eyes in every place where they sell and prescribe glasses to tell you how much your diopter needed but garnished with a terrible attitude.

I waited 2 hours before being seen. Some patients that arrived after me were being called before me. I went to the desk three times, and was told every time to go back to the waiting room. The last time, I said I had to leave in 15 minutes, because I would be late to pick up my oldest son, and would it be possible to schedule another meeting? The staff told me to wait and go back to the waiting area and she would come back and see me. She didn't. I was under the impression that they forgot about me. Finally, Dr. Koenekoop came personnaly to see me, and told me that he was told I was not there. He was kind, and saw my child, in a very quick and expeditious clinical review. He told it was a computer glitch, but I believe it was a very human error from the support staff. My mother is a nurse in a children eurology clinic at CHEO, and the support staff are essential for a good experience. I was dissapointed that after 3 times, none of the support staff ever came back to me, or ever said sorry for the mix up. It is just basic human courtesy. My pediatrician has high praise for Dr. Koenekoop.
When to see Dr with my 10 years old son. He was very nice and knowledgeable. Spoke to my son and myself. Don't see why so many negative comments.

Un docteur vicieux malheureusement, l'ordre des ophtalmologues doit faire quelque chose c'est inacceptable de traiter les patients avec tels comportements, il faut voir s'il a des problèmes psychologiques parceque son comportement n'est pas digne d'un docteur pour enfants

This is the worst eye specialist we have ever seen. We flew all the way from Saskatoon sk. As our eye specialist said they do research for a lazy eye and was a great candidate for it. When they first took us in. The lady working for him checking our daughters our was also awful. She kept coming and leaving to help other people. When we finally got to see the doctor. He asked us y we were there. I told him. He said the research is over. I said there no way she can try get into it as we flew all that way. He said no but we could google it to see when it is available. I said you know how far we flew. He said u should have email me. I said the eye specialist did. He said do you know how many emails I get a day. Do not see this doctor he was awful. There has to be better options then him in Montreal then him. Me and my husband were so angry cause we flew all that way and he could have cared less.

HORRRRRRRRRRRRRRRIBLES !!!! J'aurai du lire les horribles commentaires sur ce médecin (qui ne mérite pas cette appellation ) avant de me laisser avoir, ce médecin n'a rien d'humain, aucun respect envers les enfants et les parents, je me demande pourquoi il exerce ce métier noble, mon premier RDV mon enfant de 2 ans avait toussé et lui s'est éloigné en panique en me disant je n'ai pas envie d'attraper une maladie, je lui avait expliquer que mon enfants est asthmatique est il tousse souvent, c'était blessant de traiter mon fils comme s'il avait la peste mais j'ai laissé passer. Aujourdhui je me suis présenté pour un RDV que j'ai attendu si longtemps avec mon fils, malheureusement la pluie et l'orage nous a ralentie on est arrivé 10min après notre RDV, l’infirmière est allée le voir pour lui dire si 10min ne dérange pas, quand elle est sortie avec un ton très agressif me dit a haute voix le médecin ne veux plus vous voir... je rêve ou quoi ce n'est que 10min regardez on est complètement mouillé de la tête au pied pour arriver ici, soyez tolérant, c'est un rdv pour un petit enfant vous savez comment il est difficile de s'absenter de son travail aller le chercher à garderie et venir en transport en commun ... c'est 1h30 de déplacement, regarder juste notre état je disais à la pauvre secrétaire qui ne savait plus quoi dire... je me suis senti impuissante, humiliée, triste.... j’espère que les gens prendrons compte des commentaires car ce médecin je ne lui confierai même pas un chat

C'est le pire médecin que j'ai vu de toute ma vie. Il est bête, irrespectueux, suffisant et arrogant. Les assistantes qui nous reçoivent avant lui ne sont vraiment pas mieux. Ça fait 4 suivis que j'ai avec ce docteur. J'en suis ressorti les 4 fois en colère. Sauf aujourdhui, seulement puisqu'il m'a recommandé d'aller voir un autre médecin que lui. Vraiment, si vous pouvez voir quelqu'un d'autre, je vous le recommande. Vous perdrez votre temps avec lui puisqu'il ne vous sera d'aucune aide.

I am not questionning this doctor's capability or knowledge, but his delivery is disgusting. After his assistance saw my 2 year old, we waited 30 minutes for the eye drops to work before we saw Dr. Koenekoop. He saw us for a total of 3 minutes, where he threw me a diagnosis; told me to GOOGLE it for more information, and told me there was nothing that I can do to help me 2 year old, and the he would see me in 6 months, and with that he was out the door! What kind of doctor tells you to GOOGLE for more information !?!?!? I have since went to another specialist, and even though the diagnosis is the same, the doctor spent 30 minutes with me and my 2 year old to really see what was going really going on. He gave us the time, and made sure that we knew that my child was going to be ok. 

When you are dealing wih children, it would not be such a bad thing to be a little more compassionate!

The most rude offensive, irresponsible and incompetent doctor I ever met. Went with my 10 years old daughter to evaluate a problem in her vision that started 40 days ago, after a traumatic brain injury. He prevented me from get in to his office, and closed the door with my daughter (10 years old) when he was examining her. After consultation he REFUSED to talk to me and when I told him I had only one question, he told me I DON’T CARE. My daughter sad he didn’t know what TCC (traumatic brain injury in French) was, it was written in her family doctor prescription... Also, the secretary told he is not even able to speak French, and it looks like his clinic charges illegal fees. After all this, the women working at the reception told me to ‘go way’ and that I could make the complaint I wanted because this doctor was the ‘department chef’ from CUSM. THIS DOCTOR SHOULDN’T PRACTICE; HE CAN REALLY DAMAGE OUR KIDS. FYI I’m complaining through Collège des médecins du Québec, Collège des médecins du Canada, CUSM and Commissaires aux plaints. Besides, since he refused to talk to me and I need to know why my daughter started to present a big grade of myopia after the accident, I’ll need to go to another ophthalmologist. So, I repeat the same commentary in this time line ‘I feel like I wasted my referral on him’, as well time and money. P.s.: it’s really strange to find someone today that decided to write something good here about that doctor, probably something coming from him since after all this, before get out, I was really loud saying I would complaint everywhere. DON’T GO THERE.

Went with my 6 mth old. Dr. Koenekoop was great with him, answered our questions and was on time. Some people claim him to be rude but I didn't get that feeling at all from him. He is very knowledgeable. The staff was very friendly and clinic is very nice and clean. Definitely will go back to him for his annual follow ups.

I had to pay for drops as soon as we got to the office, after waiting a few minutes an assistant took me and my 7month old in, insisting I leave our carriage/car seat etc out in the waiting room full of people. She waved a flashlight around and then said the eyes look normal but that she'll put drops to dilate the pupils so the doc could see the optic nerve. (We were there because of her seriously noticible lazy eye, as recommended by our pediatrician, to be referred for surgery or be given strengthening exercises.) I asked if it was likely there was anything wrong with her vision or if it's usually just a muscle coordination issue. She said the doctor would see us in 30 minutes and that the drops would burn my daughters eyes. We were sent back to the waiting room for a while then called to some semi-smaller waiting area in the hall near he doctors office. He called in another patient into his office then directed another one into the room next door. He saw both patients and then left only us in the hall for another 30 mins (maybe 90 mins since the drops) while he presumably sat in his office alone. By this time they'd lined up another 2 patients with drops and then into the hall with us. He came out and directed us into his office and another patient into he room next door. He told me he would see the other patient first as it would be quick. My baby had now been waiting 2 hours and was hungry and tired and cranky. He came back and quickly held up a tool to his eye and looked at my daughter (on my lap) from 3 ft away, and asked why I was seeing him. I said 'for her lazy eye'... he stood up and walked out, without saying anything. He directed the other people in The hall to the other room next door and presumably saw them. He came back in speaking with his assistant about another patient who'd called, and said to us 'oh you're still here?' he told his assistant 'she's autistic and legally blind in one eye, I explained this to her already, don't return the phone call' as he crumpled up the postit she was holding. He joked to me that we shouldn't call him because he won't return the call. He held up a popsicle stick with a sticker on the end and waved it infront of my kids face twice, and then said 'her eyes are straight, she's perfect' I said that I had some pictures where I've caught insanely drastic different directions in her eyes, as I held up my phone to show him. Literally one eye will be looking straight and the other is a tiny crescent in her nose, it's like a joke. He said 'her eyes are straight'. As he was walking out. We followed him out and he handed me a card and said 'it's very important that you see me next year, have a good day' and turned into another office and closed the door. I feel like I wasted my referral on him.

C'est le pire médecin que j'ai vu de ma vie. Aucun respect pour les parents. Parle seulement à son staff. Si on lui pose des questions il nous fait signe d'arrêter de parler. Lors de mes 2 rdv il n'a pas parlé à ma fille. Côté relationnel est nul. Il semble au-dessus de ses affaires

this doctor was not thorough at all. He didn't even check my children's eyes properly and forgot to give me a written prescription for one of my kids who wears glasses. I was wondering if he was even a qualified doctor! I definitely will not be going back to see him again.

Cannot believe the disregard for patient's time, left my wife with 3 kids waiting in his waiting room while he went to lunch, then came back and went into a meeting. All while she and the kids waited for hours after the scheduled appointment time. Unbelievable.

Brilliant and kind doctor. We have been so worried about our daughter's eyes and after a terrible experience with a misinformed optometrist, we are so thankful to have his knowledge and expertise! Thank you Dr. Koenekoop!

My experience was amazing with Dr.Koenekoop.I was giving the run around at the children's by 2 doctors prior Dr Koenekoop..When I had my 1St appt.for my daughter that is 7.He took the time answered my questions.He performed the surgery on both eyes of my daughters.And after surgery he did came to see me with a big smile and even joking that she has her beautiful lashes intact(Her lashes are very long and almost look fake)But he explained that surgery was a success and to be careful with her not doing exercice for the next 3 weeks.So for those parents that are commenting I wonder maybe if you were 

arrogant with him he responds the same way .I was nice and I received nice.and I saw him many times.always nice and compassionate with my child and I.

This doctor has horrible beside manner. My four year old was treated by him at the Children's. My son had his eye probed for over two days, evebtually he had enough and started to cry (so much so that he began to cough). The doctor asked me if he was sick. I answered "no, he's just so upset that it's causing him to cough". He then looked at his support team and said "his coughing is starting to upset me". Excuse me?! He's a terrified four year old!!! He should not be working with Children. He didn't explain anything to me, I had left feeling frustrated with still do many questions, but was basically booted out!

Went there for our 1-month baby and had a lot of concerns. We had an appointment at 9 a.m and finally were done at 12 p.m after 2 five-minute sessions with him. Thank god our baby's view turned out to be alright but the Dr. would not give us any details. Our questions remained unanswered and we wondered if he was a foreigner unable to speak French or English. Beside, since he was so late on his schedule, the patients were lining up (as asked by nurses) in front of the examination room, with the door open. No privacy at all. And quite scary for young patients to hear other patients screaming their lungs out (as did our baby when he forced his eyes open).

Last of all, we were told to come back next year in the practice they were opening even though everything was correct with our baby's eyes. I don't see myself going through that painful and time-wasting experience again. But he may be a very knowledgeable Dr...

When my son was seen by this doctor three or four times during 5/10 minutes after his assistants. The last times, he was only seen by his assistants. Everything was supposed to be perfect according to them. IT was not! strong motor skills problems appeared and frustations. I do not know what happened but they did not evaluate All the problems in its whole (convergence insufficiency, astigmatism, hyperopia...). No advice concerning the frames which must be large for him. After we left Montreal... One day, one doctor took more time to analyze the situation and we finally found the gravity of the visual problem and evaluated it in its whole. It was a miracle, my son started to live again; motor skills improved in a few days, writing... Something has not been done properly in this place because probably of the lack of time.
Very nice and good specialist. It was a pleasure to meet him to our first control for our 1 year baby.

The technicians that treat you before the actual doctor are fantastic, everyone else, including the actual doctor and the staff at the reception, are arrogant and unhelpful. This doctor is never on time. You will always wait at least 30 minutes.

Perhaps the research lab is where this Doctor should stay as he lacks the ability to properly explain and communicate with his patients. My 1 year old came to see him for a gray spot in his eye.I had simply asked questions about whether or not the eye drops were necessary. The nurse said I had a choice. Since, I was not there to test his vision, i felt it unnecessary for drops. Dr.K rudely entered the room and told me, I had no choice. He refused to answer any of my questions and dismissed me by totally leaving the room angry. He came back and told me to sign a paper, stating he would see my son but not be able to get a full examination. After signing the paper he took off telling me to leave. I went to the hospital and he didn't even check my son as he told me he would. I couldn't believe his attitude and his unprofessional manner in leaving me without being seen. I would never recommend this Doc as it should be mandatory that a Doctor be helpful and care regardless of his knowledge.

I accompanied one of my clients who has been followed by Dr. K. I was struch by his arrogance, inability to give helpful answers, and general dismissiveness in his attitude towards the patient. I am unable to comment on his competence but I assume he is well qualified, given his position however he certainly didn't get there because of his bedside manner or communication skills!

Right away they want 30 dollars. They circle a "din" number for drops on the bill BEFORE my child was even seen...drops never went in my childs eyes! I was rushed once we were in the office and all my son did was read a few letters on the wall, that is what I paid 30 dollars for? I was not impressed, he might be good at his surgeries, but to do regular check=ups, I rather go to an OPTOMETRIST! At least when they take your money, they give you the time of day!!!!!
