My 2 year old just had a surgery this morning for strabimus. Operating room staff was just amazing and human including Dr. Koenekoop. Very knowledgeable doctor and caring. The only reason a rate the staff at 4 relates to staff in the recovery room. My son was traumatized of not waking up with me at his side, hence making him feel insecure in an unknown environment. He had a trantrum for the remaining time in the recovery room and nurses (not all) did not show compassion. In the contrary, they accused us of being unfit parents because we couldn't calm him down. I strongly recommend, if possible, to call up the parents as soon as the surgery ends, specially for little ones. He is now secured at home and sleeping like a baby! Thank you to Dr. Koenekoop's team, for your dedication and professionalism.

He doesn't have time for his patients, does not answer questions. He might be good at what he dies however as a parent you need a DR who not only diognize but also explain your child's condition, answer questions & accommodate your concerns & answer them. If he would have answered my questions, I would have trusted his abilities more. Very dissapointed because I hear he is very good but that isn't enough to make me comfortable. He definitely has an attitude.

Interesting, after reading all the "rave" reviews of this doctor, I was kind of second guessing my opinion. I had brought all three of my children to see him at the MCH several years back and my impression was that he was quite arrogant and not overly interested in answering questions. He wanted us to follow at his private office. Heard there loooong waits to get an appointment, so took my children elsewhere. I suppose he knows his business though, but how would I know, I'm not an opthalmologist.

I have been seeing Dr. Koenekoop for my daughter's amblyopia for years. Even though I truly believe he knows his stuff very well, it is very hard to get past his rudeness and harshness. He does not take the time to answer my questions, he told me to "ask next time I come" which was supposed to be 6 months later, now we were supposed to see him in October and they told us to call to make the appointment in August for October. I called and now they are waiting for his February schudule, so to call back next month to book an appointment in February. It was my last straw. I do not reccomend this doctor to anyone.

First of all, I must be one of a few adult patient that need to consult Dr. Koenekoop. for double vision and strabism and pressure in my right eye. Well, I think he is very professionnal, very knowlegeable, he is very human, his year experiences speak for him, no waste of time in his office, he is cool, very handsome (well!!! I just had to say it) very friendly and pleasant... when you think that it is not your main focus of the visit but it makes your visit a lot more pleasant and memorable...hey Robert your ae awesome...Anne....
This doctor is amazing.. he takes the time to explain, and spends the time performing all possible examinations. Very polite and great with kids.

Experienced doctor. Needs more appreciation than is given. I was absolutely satisfied and relieved after having his second opinion on my daughter's sight. Funny guy. Everybody is allowed to have a bad day-even first-class super-specialized ophthalmologists.
Ce médecin est le meilleur que je connaisse. Il est très empathique et aidant.Je ne pouvais demander mieux!Merci Dr Koenekoop.

Dr koenekoop est parmis les plus compétants médecins que j'ai pu recontrer. il a opéré mon fils de 3 ans il y a un mois pour strabisme. il a été tres confiant et rassurant avant l'opération . et effectivement les yeux sont bien axés Dieu merci.j'ai un grand respect pour ce docteur qui apu epargner mon fils des moquerie des autres

Knowledgable gentleman however very rude and not interested in what you need. What he says goes and you have no opinion. Too bad really, assistant can be confused and forgetful. Not a great experience.

My 2 year old has a strabismus...I was told early intervention is the best. So after the tedious work of obtaining consults etc and waiting 1.5 months...I was turned away on the day of our appt only because I didn't have the $20 available to pay the initial fee. Now we have to wait another month for a reschedule. When did $20 become more important than a 2 year olds eyesight?

What an incredible doctor and human being! We are very lucky to have the privilege of being his patients. When we received an extremely serious diagnosis (delivered badly by someone else - sigh) for one of our children he was called in for a second opinion. We never looked back. This fine practitioner has ALWAYS been there for our real emergencies, and has consistently treated the whole family with respect and kindness. He works very hard, many long hours and I hope that his patients are properly appreciative of this man's dedication and skill.
Dr. K is treating the uveitis in my 3yo daughter which means seeing him about every two months. With each visit he is patient and gentle with her so she is happy to hear about going back to see him.
It can't be easy managing a screaming baby and a fearful mother. He is strict but with purpose and does what he needs to do.

Excellent médecin! Très bien entouré aussi.Son équipe est d'une patience d'Or avec les enfants. Ma fille de 3 ans et demi s'est fait opérée pour un strabisme il y a quelques mois. L'opération s'est déroulée comme un charme. Les yeux de ma fille sont parfaitement enlignés aujourd'hui. Je vous le recommande sans hésiter !

Mon garcon de 3ans et demis la rencontrer pour la premier fois quand il a eu 2ans et demi. il a ete tres gentil et surtout tres doux avec mon fils. Il le suit maintenant pour son strabisme. Malgre le peu dexplication (facilement trouvable sur le net) ca ete une belle rencontre a chaque fois. Le seul HIC cest que loperation devait avoir lieu 6 mois plus tard et que nous en somme maintenant a 9 mois dattente
has a problem with running on time / still though he is a great doctor but needs to care a little more

Ce médecin est un des meilleurs spécialiste que j'ai rencontré. Je suis atteinte d'une maladie hériditaire, la rétinite pigmentaire. Je l'ai appris du docteur ophtalmologiste Jocelyne Brochu qui m'avait suggéré de me faire à l'idée car elle ne pouvait rien pour moi. Elle avait été d'un tel professionalisme que c'est la technicienne qui m'a avisé du diagnostique. Par contre, le Dr Koernekoopm'a regardé dans les yeux et m'a dit qu'il me comprenait, que la science avancait à grand pas et que d'ici trois ans un médicamment serait disponible, pour freiner l'évolution de la maladie. Après vérification internet, j'ai constaté que, le nt-501, est en étude et que le docteur Koernekoop est un des chercheur les plus connu à travers le monde de la recherche. Merci de me donner l'espoir.

Excellent opthalmologiste qui est à l'écoute des patients et qui diagnostique réellement les problèmes. En ce qui me concerne, c'est la sommité dans cette discipline. Cependant, la liste d'attente est longue mais ça vaut la peine d'attendre.
Médecin très compétent, un des meilleurs médecin que j'ai vu. A donné des très bons conseils.

The worst experience ever. He was rude, did not listen to what we had to say, did not want to spend the time to explain. He was especially unfriendly with the child. I will never recommend this doctor to anyone.

Complètement d'accord avec l'évaluation précédente. Approche très humaine et optimiste. Seul médecin québécois s'intéressant à la rétinite pigmentaire, maladie génétique commune au Québec. Approche positive, incite l'espoir de percées curatives, à court terme, pour les patients atteints de cécité.
Il est très à l'écoute, prend le temps de bien expliquer et porte une attention attentive à ce que l'on dit. Ce médecin à le coeur à la bonne place et ca se ressent. Très compétent.
a donné les renseignements pour opération; répond aux questions
Bonne expérience à très bien vulgarisé l’intervention calme et posé
À bien expliqué la pathologie et le traitement. M’a vu après sa journée de travail en urgence et a été ponctuel et très efficace. Très professionnel .

This is a seriously flawed individual who, besides being completely disorganized, is an aggressive and hostile person who takes her anger out on her patients. After waiting all morning at her private clinic ( that’s right I paid for this), she told me that she hadn’t read my referral and didn’t have the equipment on hand to examine my condition. She gave me an appointment at her office at the MUHC and then didnt show up and never gave a reason. Stay away. She needs a sabbatical or perhaps should do the right thing and retire.
Chaos reigns. This is my worst medical experience.

I have been seeing Dr. Wein since 2017, after losing my left eye vision to a meningioma. She is one of the most caring, empathetic, knowledgeable doctors that I had the pleasure to meet. Thank you Dr Wein for taking such good care of me.
Dr Wein was always polite to me and always made feel at ease I am proud to have a doctor like her

La pire neuro ophtalmo que j'ai vue je crois pas que son opinion en vaut la peine elle n'écoute pas ne vous laisse aucunement parler ou même expliquer ce qui vous arrive. En us de vous faire attendre 5hrs pour vous recevoir 25min

Vraiment je n'en reviens pas que cette docteure pratique encore vraiment aller consulter ailleurs

Vous serez moins déçu.

D'une patiente très déçu et qui ne retournera jamais la voir.

She is very knowledgeable, but not very social.

Wait times are ridiculous…. 4 hours on a good day.

Awful when the patient is special needs.

The best was when she didn’t even show up for appointment!

Dr Wein conducted exaustive testing on my wife as she was losing her vision. That evening we were called at 8:30pm and told to go to the ER to have a spinal tap done the next morning. It has all been pre arranged. Once spinal tap completed she had brain surgery scheduled 2 days later to reduce brain pressure which was at 30 normal brain pressure is 10 to 12 which saved her life. Thank you to Dr Wein and her team at the Jewish General for their thoroughness . To Dr Petrecca and the team at the Neuro who performed the surgery Job well done.

Dr. Wein is misunderstood - but has been one of the best physicians I have had the pleasure of meeting. She took incredible care of my grandmother during an acute episode for an eye issue. 

Yes, you may wait a while to see her. That’s because she’s a residency attending and constantly has new residents with her. She’s taking time out of her day to teach the future ophthalmologists the tricks of the trade. 

Yes, she is direct and to the point. But that is what you want in a doctor. 

She probably won’t coddle you, but she is as empathetic as anyone, you can tell by the way she takes the time to explain to patients and residents. 

We all have bad days, she is human too.
5 hrs late, appointment was for 10, was only seen at 3 pm! Wish Dr Wein was calmer, had more empathy and time to treat her patients with patience & care!!!!
Can't get through - line busy always - very mixed up - going elsewhere do not recommend

I had the same negative experience years ago.

Why don’t you all write your negative experiences

and submit them for review to the hospital, as I did

many years ago.

After reading so many negative comments, I was pleasantly surprised at my appointment today. I found Dr. Wein to be very knowledgeable and professional. She apologized for making me wait and seemed genuinely concerned overall. So I have nothing but good things to say about this doctor.

Dr. wein has been treating me for 2 years for my IIH and honestly I’ve had only great experiences with her. She is extremely professional and knowledgeable. She regularly follows up with me and is so encouraging. Her secretary is lovely as well!

The first time I saw her, she was lovely. She made a mistake with the application of my drops but it did not harm me so all ended well. She was kind and accommodating - as was I. I had to return to repeat the exercise. She was kind the second time also.

 I think she may have been a good doctor at one time. How else could she be in her position? Maybe the terrible conditions that all doctors are forced to work in, in Quebec, has worn her down. She forgets things, used the wrong drops in my eye more than once, always seems super anxious, and very very angry without provocation. My condition cannot be managed by a regular ophthalmologist so I must return. The third time I saw her, I wanted to run out of her office . It was a horrible and disparaging experience. I am dreading getting yelled at again, spoken to like I am really stupid, and snapped at out of the blue. I waited 5 hours last time and said nothing. I was exhausted but still tried to smile. I was in a lot of pain from another injury. She looked at me right in my eyes and snapped , “If you are angry just tell me what is on your mind and get it over with” I told her I was in a lot of pain. This bought me only a few minutes of neutral communication. Later she was extremely sarcastic about my honest but polite response about how I was responding to my medication. I was so confused when I left. A surreal situation with a very tired and unhappy and very angry woman. All this after having to call multiple times (while my condition worsened) to get an appointment. Obviously everyone involved is overworked but the patients are not anyone’s personal punching bags. I would not allow this woman to operate on me while I am out cold.

Dr. Wein was very professional. Even though I got to see and talk to her just for a few minutes between the multiple tests that she had appointed for me, she was even able to do one of the tests which required to be booked in advance, on the spot. She was nice, very attentive, friendly and helpful and I felt she was very dedicated to my situation. It was not easy as she was running between her patients and consulting her two residents at the same time. I am really grateful of having Dr. Wein consult me. The whole staff was very friendly and helpful! I do not support the previous reviews and confirm that Dr.Wein is real professional and great doctor!

She is one of the rudest doctors I've ever had the displeasure of seeing. I will never go back to her again. Speaks rudely to you, as if you are a terrible child, misbehaving on purpose just to bug her. Unbelievable. And for that, I went for a 9:30 appointment. A mere follow-up. Guess when I left? 1:45 pm!!!!! 99% of that time was sitting on my bottom in the waiting area. Ugh!!!! DO NOT GO SEE HER.

She may know her stuff but she must have missed the 'bedside manner course'. She is rude, curt, flits from room to room, makes the patient a nervous wreck and you have to be ready to wait and wait and wait. Not professional and not impressed.
Dr. Wein was very thorough and patient with me. I did wait to see her but the clinic is extremely busy.

She’s really awful. Rude, cold and although apologetic for mistakenly not having the correct lens she was supposed put in for me, she ended with “but I have a lot of patients “. We had to reschedule even after I had been there for hours. Unfortunately I have to see her again for the actual operation followed by the follow up appointment

Extremely rude, she looks at you with angers. She doesn’t come back to you. I had to go 3 times as she didn’t have time for my vision. I cannot see from on eye…and a test that was important she said, I don’t have time…come back in 3 weeks. Waited 5 hours one time and she talked for 15 seconds and left the office.

Avoid , avoid avoid……

Dr Wein yelled at me for taking a sip of water so I could swallow my medication. She claimed that no liquids were allowed in her office yet a giant Starbucks iced cap sat gingerly in the edge of the shelf. Nasty, incompetent, terrible staff as well. Go elsewhere.
If you go see her, don't talk!, don't breath! and DON"T look at her, all of the above will set her off! RUN! DON'T WALK OUT OF HER OFFICE!

D'accord avec la plupart des commentaires négatifs, personne très irritable, problème entre les deux oreilles.

Doc à éviter.
Excellent team and excellent care. Would recommend. 100%

Dr.Francine Wein treated me like a bottle of wine. Despite her attempt to age me into the classic Duckhorn Vineyards 1999 Napa Valley Merlot in her waiting room, I sadly remained unattended to. You would think I was indeed a farm animal roaming around the vineyard with the way she treated me with such inhumane disregard. In fact it was not I who was blind, it was her, because I was in fact a human being seeking help from a medical professional seemingly running a pyramid scheme race of who could book the most patients while providing the least helpful service.
2 1/2 house late. I sat besides someone who had 8:30 appointment, I had one for 8:40. After the 8:30 left she said there were 3 more ahead of me. How can that be possible.
all negative comments i have read abaut her is true . she should be out of work , have rest and seek help look like she have mental problems to work on .

Après 2 heures d'attente, je l'ai vu 3 mns, très désagréable, ne prend pas le temps de réponde no d'expliquer. Semble se chercher, me refait la pression de l'œil, alors qu'elle venait d'être prise pas son assistante. très mauvaise expérience, je ne voudrai plus la revoir.
very very rude , umprofessional uncompetent she should go to a psychatrist because has serious issues with dealing with patients

This doctor has some serious anger issues. She should be put on sick leave. I answered her first question but because it didn't fit in with what she wanted to hear she started yelling at me and belittling me, I tried to explain my situation but she was too busy venting that she wasn't hearing what I was saying. She barely answered 1 question I asked, then filled some papers and passed me on to her secretary. I left the office traumatized.

The most rude doctor you would ever see!!! She does not answer your question, she will belittle you. I would never waste my time to go see her again. Her secretary won't answer any of your calls or respond to your messages. Do your self a favor and find a doctor and a staff who act humane and would care about you.
Never met doctor like her very rude, not punctual on time . After waiting 4 hours I came back home without seeing her.

Very unprofessional doctor. So rude. Always have no answers to whatever questions asked. She misbehaves and have no patience to listen to a patient. Never in my life I had seen such doctor. She calls herself a doctor. Well I tell you, she needs some therapy. She looks mentally ill. And besides that her secretary will never return your call.

I never met a worst doctor in my life 

Waited a month for an appointment then 2:30 hours at the hospital to be told that I was old and to get use to it 

This person should not practice
Overbooked, rude,dismissive, impatient...borderline negligent

Rude and rushed. I have double vision and she yelled at me to look straight ahead. Impossible for me to do this.

Given the positive reviews she receives sometimes,

perhaps she suffers from some mental imbalance

and should seek help.
Never again will I waste my time to go see such an unprofessional doctor.

Seems a lack of empathy, lack of urgency and most of all the absence of sufficient time for care. Referrals not submitted, months of waiting for follow-up, endless waiting for in-person appointments and messages not returned. Where do we turn for help and medical care? Decency is the path, not Covid as an excuse.

So her in office .... wait time was an issue otherwise service was excellent. Takes the time to ask questions although sometimes abrupt.

Also had a phone appointment .. quick and to the point.
SO RUDE! Never again will I waste my time to go see such an unprofessional doctor.
She is a good doctor who knows her stuff but that’s it, she is rude, cuts you off when you talk, talks down to you. Never on time but that’s not all her fault I know.
she is very sufficient, with her work, I am very happy to have her

Saw her for the first time 6 years ago and been having follow ups every 6 months. Diagnosed a drusen and has been very thorough with exams and follow-ups and reassuring. Takes time to answer all my questions at every visit. Would highly recommand.

Went to see her in Laval today. Very polite and excellent doctor. Explained everything thoroughly and knows her stuff. She even asked if we had any questions. Awesome doctor and took her time with tests.
Fantastic experience with Dr. Wein. Extremely knowledgeable and great people skills. Wait times are long but out of her control so go for the earliest appointments.

Dre.Wein is always Late; no matter what. And to make matters worse the parking around 5252 De Maisonneuve, is a max of 2h. I realise that its not her prob. but when ur appointment is at 10h20am and she sees u at 1h30pm, it becomes a problem. 
She is also not the kindest person, her people skills r questionable... However, she knows her stuff. She is professional in her own way.
Do I think she is Helpful? I hope she will be but so far not so much. But its not like she's not investigating/running tests. 
So overall I give her a: 3/5

Complete lack of professionalism and respect for her patients. I waited 2 month for my first visit, to be called by her secretary the day before the first visit to be told the following: "Sorry, but the doctor cannot have you as a patient anymore and she is not taking patients anymore". I am willing to look for another doctor even if this is so hard these days, but to make me wait 2 months for no reason is just disrespectful.
Be prepared to wait, appointment time is just a suggestion
Have received care that is complete and thorough -- could not possibly be better.
Unprofessional. Incompetent. Does not return phone calls. Ghosts her patients. Why is she even practicing?

Wait times in hospital clinics, no matter which one, are always a marathon. 

Dr Wein is professional, thorough and knowledgable. Lucky to have found her.

She’s really helpful and nice. 

I admit the scheduling is off but she’s also called at a moments notice to perform emergency surgeries. 

Been seeing her for a few years and I’ve never had a bad experience.

Based on the negative-ish reviews I read here I must say I went to my appointment with Dr. Wein for a glaucoma screening rather a bit afraid and with fingers crossed. But on the contrary I found a very polite and helpful doctor. My whole experience was very smooth and professional. It was at the Laval clinic. Maybe in a hospital setting and with many patients to see, her schedule might become very hectic but if you are calm and take your time to ask your questions she will definitely take the time to answer them. I truly recommend her.
Rude, arrogant, always late, doesn't care much. At least the staff at the hospital is good.

Spent at total of 16 hours over 3 days waiting and taking tests at the McGill Opthamology Clinic. There is no food there, they have you arrive in the am, but won't see you until past 2 pm. Dr Wein was completely unhelpful, and even horrid. Avoid this doctor. Her solution for someone suffering vision loss after brain cancer was dollar store reading glasses and strong light (as if we had not thought of doing these ourselves months before booking in to see her).
Every time I had an appointment she was late and today I've waited 3h15min to finally left. Having over 3 hr late at 10h30am it is ridiculess

I saw her once and told me she would do a cleaning job the next week with laser on my lens installed following a cataract operation. She was O.K. and seem competent. A month later, nothing had been done and she was out of reach. I left numerous messages at her office at the Jewish hospital and her secretary never bothered to return my call. Pretty bad experience and a waste of time. Looks like indifference to her patients. J. Demers 29/11/17

I was referred to Dr Wein for diplopia (double vision). First of all the wait time every time I saw her - even first thing in the morning, exceeded an hour, and twice, 2 hours. The first time I saw her she was interested in my case, took the time to verify through testing the misalignment of my eyes when I looked to one side. She ordered tests. After two more visits she was impatient and acted exasperated with me because she could not figure out the cause of my problem, so the passed the buck and sent me to her brother, a neurologist, who sent me for tests she should have - namely an MRI and a couple of others. He was arrogant and rude at first, but last time I saw him, he told me he was determined to get to the bottom of this. He wanted me to see his sister again, because she had referred me to him and wanted her to assess the results of his tests. When I had this appointment, once again, rude, exasperated and acted like I was making up the symptoms. She basically told me to pursue this with her brother as she could not (would not) spend any more time. Just said rudely "I don't know what's going on and I can't do any more for you". She hadn't done much - only ordered a CT scan and looked at the alignment. Turns out through her brother's persistence and his referring me to a couple of other doctors, it was found that I have an autoimmune disease that can affect muscles in many parts of the body, including eyes. Dr Wein seems only interested in easy and quick to diagnose patients. There are better doctors you can see that don't make you wait for hours to see them. The staff were nice to deal with.

The wait time was an absolute insult. 2hrs... And I had an appointment... I would be fired if I was doing something like this at my job. 

Was it worth the wait? No...
Horrible woman. She screwed up my eyes. Period.

Worst physician I have ever been to! After a barrage of testing she literally told me "I'm at my wits end". Extremely rude, arrogant, cold. She gave a ridiculous diagnosis and couldnt waited for me to leave. I had literally watched her search medical journals on the computer so she could just write down a few drugs with question marks. I saw another neuro-opto instead...surprise surprise her diagnosis was wrong!!! Avoid at all costs, she's a nightmare.

I was assigned to Dr. Wein after a brain stroke @ JewishHospital. Concerned, she helped me getting through the process of losing 20% of vision. She spotted my low heart-rate (marathon-runner) and opted for different eye drops.

I saw Dr. Wein a while ago. I have no opinion about her knowledge, so I assume and hope is excellent. However, Dr. Wein needs to brush up her manners with patients. She gives the impression she thinks she is above the rest of the world and I do not mean in medicine. The way she talks to patients can certainly be improved. Doctors MUST understand that patients are in a vulnerable position for many reasons: Not knowing what they do know, and going to see them due to a problem. Treating patients in a harsh way says a lot about the level of mechanical behavior from a doctor and the lack of basic caring that is expected from someone in their profession. Hopefully she will realize that humility is one great virtue that goes hand in hand with knowledge. It is not the patient's fault if she had or is having a bad day. After all, we are what we give.

I went to see dr Wein 4 months ago. Long wait, but this was not a problem. Was examined by an intern then she came and talked to the intern and almost ignoring me. Didn't tell me anything about her findings, I assumed it was because there was nothing to do? 

I needed her consultation report. I did request to the hospital archives three weeks after the appointment. A couple of weeks later they told me that it was not yet in my medical file and to communicate with her secretary. Her secretary was very hard to reach. I finally reached her and received the report 2 months after the consult.

I see doctors about a dozen times a year. I cannot judge of doctor Wein's competency. I'm sure she's very knowledgeable. But the interaction with patients and the staff should be improved. I think that part of the problem might be the hospital (Jewish General ) or department with overbooking as I haven't experienced at other hospitals.

I can never thank Dr. Wein enough for saving my daughters eyes, brain and life. I know if it was not for her, my child would not be with us. I have seen Dr. Wein run from one patient to the next many times and I have watched how some get so angry having to wait. I apologize that my daughter sometimes caused a couple of delays because of the urgency of her condition. If you need a good Doctor who cares about your eyes, she is the one. As for bedside manner she was perfect for my daughter, my husband and I. She saved my daughter !

Dr. Wein is an amazing doctor. She saved my vision and my life. I could never thank her enough for her compassion. She even called me from her home to make sure I was okay. Wish all my doctors were a little bit more like Dr. Wein.
expert testing and advice with scheduled follow-up
I think Dr. Wein is really great everytime I go see her, I always get great service and she is very curtious.
She is a wonderful witty Dr with a huge heart and always takes great care of me 😄
The only doctor I know that takes the time to explain in details what is going on and to book additional tests if she has any doubts. I'm happy to be her patient!
love her! She's the best doctor and helped me come to terms with my ms greatly. Fine, you have to wait a long time, but she is worth the wait!

Arrogant, condesending, terrible bedside manners. After having waited to see her for over 2 hours she rushes the appointment as if you were bothering her and wasting her time. Her approach is the opposite of comprehensive; she only addresses very narrow specific aspects of the problem while ignoring other symptoms (which may as well be related) - thus missing the big picture. Neglectful of her patients: Refers you to other specialists but does not even bother to followup. Avoid at all cost.

Dr. We in is an amazing doctor! Without her I really don't know where I would be today. I was rapidly losing my vision and because of her amazing care I am able to see again! Out of all the doctors at the royal Vic and the mtl neuro she was my favourite and I'll be forever grateful for everything she has done for me!
She is the best eye doctor you could have do not listen to the other reveiws
Not caring about patients at all,waste of time,almost ran in and out telling me nothing's wrong
very professional knows, what she is doing and is very nice.

J'ai eu un rendez-vous ce matin. Après une courte attente, j'ai vu Dr Wein. Elle était poli, professionnelle et patiente. Même si elle était très occupée, elle a pris le temps d'expliquer toutes mes questions. Tout le personnel de ce département était excellent.

A éviter a tout prix. Jamais vue un medecin aussi RUDE et ARROGANTE. Elle prend des patients pour des idiots. Apres 3 h d attente et juste pour me faire insulter . Elle a vraiment pas une place a l hôpital.Ne perdez pas votre temps svp! Connaissance zéro! respect de patients zéro!Vous allez juste sortir de son cabinet triste et frustré comme tous les autre patients!
She is an excellent doctor; she is brilliant and compassionate. She has a very prudent approach and handles elderly patients surprisingly well.

Dr.Wein over books patients therefore causing long unnessary waiting periods in her office. Appointments for a certain time are usually 2 hours later by the time she gets around to seeing you. Runs her office like a production line a money making production line!

Wy wife saw Dr. Wein for the first time, today. I was with her. My wife has many medical issues and we have met with lot of health professionnels and seen all types. Only a handful of these can be qualified as very good in terms of professionnalism and know how. Dr. Wein is at the top of those few. Very professionnal, clearly caring about her patient, she is one of the very best.
Not a friendly doctor. Do not have an office to discuss issues with her. Does not listen to her patient.

Apres avoir attendu 1h30, ce qui presque normal de nos jours, elle m'a vu maximum 12 minutes et semblait très pressée. En entrant dans la salle d'examen, m'a dit qu'elle devait quitter dans 10 minutes. Je ne peux commenter sa compétence simplement son attitude car mon problème était résolu avant ma visite. Je ne retournerai pas la voir.

My mom and I (acting as a translator since my mom's English is not that good) went to see Dr. Wein today. She is just a wonderful doctor and a John's Hopkins University med school graduate. In addition, she is also licensed in the US. You cannot get any better than Dr. Wein. I am sure she is the top in Canada.

I agree with most of the comments. Dr. Wein was rude both times I have seen her. Not helpfull and extremely arrogant. She appears to hate dealing with the public and does not like what she is doing. F.Y.I. she was wrong with diagnosis.....what a surprise when you really don't care!
Dr. Wein was so wonderful. I brought my mother to rvh for tests and we had great service. She was so encouraging, smiling, polite. I highly recommend this dodtor. Also her secretary Sandra is super.

Dr Wein m a été référé par mon Neurologue a cause de mon ACV j ai une vision double. Je l ai trouvé bete et insensible. Elle m a dit tu vois mieux avec un oeil met toi un cache oeil Wow pas tres professionnelle et en plus elle était en retard de 2 heures. En tout cas ca été fini pour moi.

I cannot comment on her skills as she left. I was sent there for an emergency, told I would be seen immediately as there was a strong concern I would be blind in a few hours, and I am young and healthy. I waited 12 hours. When I checked at the 4 hour mark, a resident took me in and started but she came in and blasted him for seeing me, and flipped me off like I was a pest."She can just wait, we have other pts" Then when I was finally taken she said she had to leave. A new resident took her time and tried to explain. I am to return in a few weeks but I will try to find someone else. I am sure she doesn't care.

Les réceptionnistes du bureau principal sont peu sympathiques. Impossible de parler à quelqu'un au téléphone; on doit se déplacer. Par contre, la secrétaire du Dr.Wein est très gentille; et les assistants aussi. Dr. Wein est sympathique, mais très débordée. Le temps d'attente est long (2h de retard); mais ce n'est pas de sa faute. Elle s'excuse souvent des problèmes administratifs qui gênent sa pratique. Dit qu'elle aimerait mieux retourner en Ontario ou aux États-Unis... Dans les rdv, elle souriante, mais est souvent distraite. Après trois ans, je repasse toujours les mêmes tests, sans comprendre pourquoi. Je ne sais toujours pas ce que j'ai... et elle non plus. Elle m'explique peu ses impressions cliniques; mais est directe sur les maladies qu'elle écarte. Alors, statut quo.

Quick, efficient and to the point. Not very communicative, but if you're looking for a social call, go to your local pub. With the current shortage of doctors (not to mention specialists) I appreciate her efficiency. Dr. Wein was also apologetic for the delay (construction vacation, she was covering for other doctors as well), which is the first time I've heard a doctor do that(apologize, not cover). She was very helpful in getting the required tests done in the same day (WOW!). She did not provide much information, but then again, why should she? Most of her patients wouldn't understand half of it... With the info she provided, I was able to do my own research without wasting her time, giving her the opportunity to see another patient quicker. All in all, a visit at the Dr.Wein's office was a pleasant surprise (visit, CT scan and blood tests done in under 3hrs) considering the usual waiting times when seeing a specialist. I wish more doctors were this efficient.
I am surprised by the negative reviews I read. I found Dr. Wein to be efficient, caring and professional and I am looking forward to my next appointment.
Not great bedside manner. Very thorough for the testing. Considering the shortage of Opthalmologists you're lucky just to get an appointment.
Incompétente et pas professionnel du tout. Elle semble toujours prête à quitter le bureau, prend le téléphone en consultation et ne semble pas du tout à l'écoute de ce qu'on lui dit.
Dr Wein is completely irresponsible in ignoring her patients needs and follow-ups when treating her patients, especially after surgery. Not at all communicative and very stand-offish.
Extremely thorough and I am eternally graterful. Made a diagnosis that had been missed by 3 other opthalmologist.

I had a great experience with Dr.Wein very helpful and a great attitude and seems very knowledgeable. If I had to wait a little, I blame that on the Hospital and not the Doctor. Although I have a vision problem that most doctors I have seen in the past don't know about, she has been the most thorough in trying to find the diagnosis. I'm happy we have doctors like this still in this province.

Overall I felt she was quite knowledgeable and I trusted her for knowing the scientific part of her job, as she seemed to be rather 'quick' when thinking about my symptoms & all. Nevertheless, her inquiry was kind of superficial I believe. ALSO: she was rather RUDE. I saw her a few times. Each time she had her purse on, her keys in her hands, as if she had already left her office. I was always left with the feeling that she thought she was volunteering or something! Also, she did nothing to explain anything, and left me totally by myself, for months, with a rather distressing & concerning symptom that indicated a potential tumor. Awful! So I would not recommend her, based on my experience anyway. Too me, her behavior was just unprofessional, period. And, for the record, I'm not the kind who complains, but that's just unacceptable. I've always been surrounded by many physicians so I know a thing or two about professional manners and she seemed to lack them, or at least some of them...

Was extremely disappointed with the poor quality of professionalism. Having to wait up to two hours for consultation did not help matters. When I was finally seen by her, she was frustrated by her inability to get a reading of my IOP and she would start screaming at me.
Very unhelpful. Extremely rude and arrogant, she doesn't listen to her patients at all. Total lack of empathy and understanding. Impatient, direspectful, condescending... A nightmare.

Thanks to his care I can still see. Yes the organisation may be a bit hectic but it’s what all hospital clinics are like. It was far worse when he was in the old Royal Victoria hospital.

He took the time to explain everything, yes, you see a resident first but how else do you expect the to learn. I also have bifocal lens after a cataract opération and he always ask my permission to let his residents see what it was like.

Followed me for many years..at the start every 4 months then as my condition improved he’d put longer time between visits..but if things were not improving to his satisfaction he’s follow me well.
Made wrong diagnosis, arrogant , dismissive, judgmental and rude . Stay away !!
No respect for others. Don't expect much humility or compaction from him. In his eyes, you are simply another number in a list of patients.
Compétent professionnel et rassurant, excellent praticien

Dr. Deschenes may be an excellent surgeon but has very poor doctor-patient relationship skills. He barely spent 5 minutes with me in pre- or post-op visits. His answers and instructions were short and abrupt. I am experiencing distorted vision in that eye and he has refused to see me, claiming that he had already told me about the distortion. How can he justify dismissing a patient who has difficulty with clarity limiting reading ability and depth perception. He obviously does not care beyond the procedure.

In the time of Covid, Dr Deschênes was outstanding and even managed to complete my two cataract surgeries in a period of two weeks with excellent results. I found him knowledgeable and understanding. He answered all of my questions.

je suis suivi par le docteur Deschenes et aucun probleme avec lui...personne tres tranquille.
il est tres occupe, sauf qu'il connait son metier. Son staff est super!

Il est prétentieux et ne répond que si on dit oui oui.. J’ai demandé d’avoir accès à mon dossier. Ièll a refusé et ensuite Ièll n’a plus voulu que je reste sa patiente. C’est un peu beaucoup se croire au dessus de tout. Je ne l’ai jamais revu ensuite.

I was a patient of Dr. Deschenes for 14 years and he was excellent, helpful, compassionate and extremely knowledgeable. For the past four years I have been in Ottawa trying to find someone as helpful as he was. I now fully realize how lucky I was to stumble upon him and the Royal Vic clinic, the two doctors I have seen here knew of him and one called him the guru of opthamology and in my books he is! I am searching for a third doctor now and am seriously thinking of simply seeing him again as he instilled confident that he knew what he was doing unlike others. As far as being busy, they al are but at least with him you can rest assured that he is competent. HE is the best and widely know as the best.

Ce médecin n'au aucune considération pour ses patients. J'ai voulu avoir accès à mon dossier pour mon permis de conduire. Il a refusé! et suite à ma demande il n'a plus voulu me voir comme patient. Très difficile d'avoir des informations de sa part!
This is an academic clinic. You will be seen by a resident first. Request a copy of your chart at the medical records in the Glen (RVH) or MGH to get the details. Great doctor - worth the wait.
Excellent pseciallist in difficult diseases of the eye.
Very nice person and very knowledgeable. Would recommend.

I get more information from searching the internet than I do visiting Dr. Deschenes. I had to do research and ask him if that was what I had. He does not share any information, what to expect, or even ask questions about how I am managing. I'm trying to get second opinions.

Unfortunately Dr. Deschaines is not very helpful at giving details, or information. He is a kind man, but rushed, and I have been very much kept in the dark (no pun intended) about my condition, which can make everything a bit scary. I've heard he is the best, so I hope he's worth it.

I was referred to this doctor after two specific specialists saw what my problem was. The waiting room experience is rather particular , using an expert doctor like him to distribute the patients into the exam room seems awaste of precious time. But, once you understand the system, you arrive early then your appointment and you usually are out before the time of your appointment. This doctor took the time to bring me to see the films of the various exams he had me pass, explained the results to me and elaborated on the treatment required. Oneof the medications he prescribed diminuishes my immunity, so he took the time to explain what he had to do before I could have the bone grafts needed for my dental implants. If I ask a question he does not hesitate to answer. The only disappointing part is the first doctor who comes in to examin you before Dr Deschenes sees you. Instead of reading your file, he asks all the questions over and over. Yes, I recommend Dr Deschesne.

I was also very scared of the comments found in here. In my case he was a very good doctor and I got examined by two doctors, so it made me feel confident. Yes there is a lot of people, and the waiting may be long but as someone pointed out, it is the system, not the Doctor. Yes he is always in a rush, but I didn't feel he missed anything on my checkup.
I agree with the other negative comments. Ignores patient's concerns and missed important observations.

I was mortified reading some comments posted, and if you are in trouble with a vision problem, see this Dr. I met him over 12 years ago as a blind woman with a white cane and a slew of problems. Today I have excellent vision (20/20) and am healthy and independent. His knowledge of immunology, pharmacology and many other areas of medicine literally and figuratively saved my life. I met him after seeing another doctor from another hospital going nowhere. I also tried seeing a doctor in Boston (disaster). Dr Deschenes is a brillant, kind physician who was always available (3 times a week when necessary).NO, he is not on time (we wait), but that is the medical system, not him. I was a very complicated case, and he ALWAYS did his best to find a solution to my myriad of problems. Go see him if you are in trouble.

The main issue that I encountered was a poor patient-physician relationship. He did not listen to my concerns and the symptoms of my eye problem. He did not seem to have time to answer any of my questions. Any answers he gave me were only a few words. He also misdiagnosed my condition which led to blindness in my one eye. I saw another ophthalmologist who detected the disease soon thereafter. After his misdiagnosis, he continued to offer treatments that were advised against by other ophthalmologists. I would never want anyone else to experience what I went through with Dr. Deschenes. You deserve a doctor that communicates with you about your condition and whom you trust.
Excellent physician and uveitis specialist, he is hightly recommended.

Excellent sub-specialist in ocular immunology. Found the cause of my problem wich was not found by 5 others specialists. Good team of two other ophthalmologist working with him. Excellent surgeon, he did cataract surgery in both my eyes with outstanding result. Highly recommended.

I am saddened to say that this doctor does not have very nice bed side manner, is always rushed, and rushes you and the appointment. He doesn't always look at your chart before he examines you. He even looked at the wrong eye more than once! He is unaware of different approaches and treatments to uveitis if you go elsewhere, doesn't listen or care about your questions and concerns, and ignores and dismissing your symptoms. In more than ten years, he not once ordered any testing to try to find the cause of the uveitis. I am actually afraid for all patients and future doctors under his wing. :( Go elsewhere and get out as fast as you can. No matter what it takes, its well worth it once you see what's out there and proper care you can receive.

Très gentil, rassurant,connaissant. Je le recommande. Tellement important les yeux il faut avoir confiance en notre médecin. Il a écrit sur le sujet de la dégénérescence maculaient,donc on sent entre bonne mains avec lui.

Dr Labelle est un médecin qui prend le temps d'expliquer, très empathique et sympathique, il a reçu le Prix de carrière en ophtalmologie avec raison. Plusieurs années d'expérience et de recherche derrière lui.

MEDECIN A FEMME DURER DU RENDEZ-VOUS POUR LES FEMME 20 A 25 MINUTES MAIS AVEC DU BLA BLA BLA AVEC LA PORTE OUVERTE DU CABINET. LES HOMMES LUI TAPPE SUR LES NERFS ET IL VOUS PITCH LA TETE A GAUCHE ET A DROITE DE MANIERE TRES RAIDE AUCUNE COMPASSION POUR HOMMES QUI PEUVENT PERDRE LA VUE ,J'AI TROUVER AVEC LE TEMPS UN BON MEDECIN QUI LUI PREND UN BON 5MINUTE PAR OEIL .L'HOPITAL M-R EST PATHETIQUE POUR LES RENDEZ-VOUS BIDONS A TOUTES LES FOIS PLUS DE GENS RESORTAIENT EN MAUDIT PARCE QUE ILS ONT MANQUER UNE JOURNER DE TRAVAILLE POUR MA PART 20 RENDEZ-VOUS INUTILE PIF ,
Il m'a tout simplement sauvee la vue. A deux reprises. Je lui en serai eternellement reconnaissante. Dr Labelle est le meilleur medecein qu'il me fut donne de rencontrer. Merci Doc Labelle!
Il m'a opéré avec un succès mitigé pour un décollement de rétine. Je l'ai revu plusieurs années plus tard. Bête comme ses pieds et impatient. Définitivement pas à revoir.

J'ai été référé à ce médecin par un autre opthalmologiste pour me faire opérer. Le Dr. Labelle m'a fait une vitrectimie qu'il a réussi avec un grand succès. J'ai énormément confiance en lui. Il est très simpathique aussi. Je le recommande fortement à tous ceux qui ont des problèmes avec les yeux.
A été incapable de me traiter correctement que j'y ai perdu un oeil.Incapable de traiter avec priorité ses patiens. HMR le pire des hopital pour le suivi et les rendez-vous.

jai ete operer pour un decollement de la retine en urgence tres bon specialiste le temps d attente a l hopital est ressonnable pour voir des specialistes. a tout ceux que je connais je le recommande comme specialiste

J'ai rencontré le Dr Pierre Labelle le 15 mai dernier et je dois être opérée le 6 juin pour la membrane épirétienne maculaire. Je l'ai trouvé bien sympathique et empathique et j'ai bien confiance en lui.

On attends des heures et il te passe vraiment vite. C'est super long avant d'avoir un rendez-vous peut-e^tre 6 mois et il est super impatient. Pas recommancé mais v que c'est un des seul au QC on a comme pas trop le choix...
Terrible experience overall. Long waiting times, poor communication and lack of expertise. Stay away!

Doctor Mydlarski is great laser surgery . His warm and caring doctor. You might have to wait little longer because he has a lot of patients. I was operated by Doctor Mydlarski for both eyes. My left eye was blurred and weak now it is impeccable. I had cataract in both eyes and glaucoma in both eyes. Doctor Mydlarski is a great doctor. I would like to thank him and his staff for all the kindness and caring they showed me.
I feel confident in Dr. Mydlarsky. Starting with laser surgery followed by cataract removal all with success . His ongoing caring and follow up has helped me tremendously.

A few months ago, I was operated by Doctor Marc Mydlarski for cataracts and glaucoma in both eyes. My eyesight, which was once weak and blurred, is now impeccable. Je m’amuse à dire que j’ai des yeux bioniques, grâce à ce talentueux magicien. Le Docteur Mydlarski est un ophtalmologiste consciencieux, perfectionniste, rigoureux et doué qui a entièrement à coeur le bien-être de chacun de ses patients. Ce fut un privilège d’être opérée par lui. Many thanks to a top-notch professional and a beautiful human being. 

 Charmian Paerewick
Doesn't respect appointment times. Expect to wait 4 hours min to see him.
Patient, warn, caring. Answers all your questions. One of the nicest Dr I have ever met

We see him at 5252 de Maisonneuve. A very good doctor and very knowledgeable. However due to the number of patients seen at this clinic, the waiting time can be long after you get there. Like I said a very good doctor but he can seem to be abrupt and to the point.
Nice Doctor ,gentle and always smiling. He able to explain with simple words
Wonderful experience with a true professional. I would have no hesitation to offering a positive referral.

Air bête pas à peu près. il a l'air de se foutre complètement du patient. Il n'explique pas les raisons pour lesquelles il n'y semble pas avoir d'amélioration. As l'air de dire qu'on le dérange pour rien.

Malheureusement Dr. Louis A. Corriveau n’est pas à la hauteur pour que vous vous permettiez de laisser la vision d’un membre de votre famille entre ses mains. Très incompétent, très impatient et j’en passe.

bad experience. my father has been seeing him for now 2 years for retina detachment and still no improvement after MANY surgeries. no explanation, tells him to stop some drops for the pressure and yet he almost had glaucoma. Do not recommend.

This doctor’s professionalism and communication have been very disappointing. After prescribing medication for my dad, he condescendingly suggests stopping them during follow-up appointments without providing explanations or addressing concerns. The 4-hour wait for a brief 15-minute evaluation at the hospital only added to the frustration. I strongly dont recommend this doctor.

Overall terrible experiences, 8th surgery in 2 years and nothing is getting better.

I have had 3 detached retinas and 2 cataract surgeries performed by Dr. Corriveau. He doesn't talk that much, but takes the time to examine thoroughly and explains all very well . I trust his experience and expertise totally. My wife is now going to him for a second procedure.

Super compétent et le plus important il a un grand coeur. Tu sens qu il travaille vraiment pour aider les gens pas pour se faire une fortune. Que Dieu le protège et lui donne la bonne santé et une longue vie pleine de bonheur

Un spécialiste de la rétine super compétent et consciencieux. Vous aurez l’heure juste avec lui. Il a une très grosse liste de patients et à sa retraite il sera difficile de lui trouver un remplaçant.

Dr Corriveau n'a pas envie de vous entendre. Ne lui posez pas de questions, il n'a pas envie de répondre. Il n'a aucune empathie et aucun talent pour la communication. Dr Corriveau does not want to listen to you. So don't ask questions, he does not want to answer. No empathy or communication skills.

Il a été mon sauveur. Je le vois depuis 20 ans pour la rhétinopathie. Il m’a réglé un oeil qui voyait très embrouillé et par la suite le problème était réglé. Dans mes visites, il m’a toujours donné un petit sourire et on parlait un peu de voyage. Très peu de mot, mais moi, c’est la compétence et le résultat qui compte. Je continu de le voir. Sa secrétaire, Linda est très accomodante.
Très mauvaise expérience avec Dr Corriveau. Il n'explique rien, n'est pas à l'écoute des patient et très impatient!
He’s probably one of the very few specialists in the field. I would recommend him anytime. He doesn’t talk much and doesn’t have to. I saw other specialists that did talk and it was a disaster.
One of the best retinologue in Montreal. My doctor for the last 15 years. Thank you doctor.
Best ophthalmology specialist in Montreal. He always takes the time a patient needs.

Je suis très heureuse de connaître le Dr Corriveau c’est un spécialiste très consciencieux il me traite pour une dégénérescence maculaire. Il répond à toutes mes questions et prend le temps. Je ne me sens pas comme un numéro il faut pas se fier aux commentaires qui sont désagréables. Pour moi c’est un Spécialiste qui mérite un premier choix. Bravo et merci Dr Corriveau. Monique Lemoine Ste-Adèle

We were assigned this doctor for an emergency. He is incredibly rude, racist and he has no patience. I say racist because he interacted very nicely with white patients and the second he entered our room, he gave us the opposite treatment. He barely said anything and could care less about us. I would not recommend him at all.

Dr Corriveau me suit depuis 16 ans pour une dégénérescence maculaire de l'œil droit, il a stabilisé mon œil il y a 16 ans et depuis tout est stable, dernièrement je croyais que la vision de mon œil s'était détérioré du côté du macula, négatif il m'a fait passé un scan la même journée, pour confirmer que ç'était un cataracte, ç'était en mai 2019, j'ai été opéré ce 9 août et miracle je vois mieux de mon œil après seulement 2 jrs il surpasse la vision de mon œil gauche malgré la dégénérescence, après l'opération pour la cataracte de mon œil gauche ce sera pour moi le bonheur total..Oui il est de peu de mot mais ç'est une sommité dans son domaine et je ne jure que par lui. J'ai été très bénie de l'avoir sur ma route à l'âge de 57 ans pour une dégénérescence maculaire humide..mon œil gauche n'est pas atteint et je fais tout à la lettre pour que ça demeure ainsi. Aux détracteurs du Dr Corriveau je me demande si tout est dit dans vos commentaires..
Un homme de peut de mots. tres efficace et connaissant.un grand rétinologue. le meilleur au Quebec. Un grand formateur. Un cerveau de la medecine ophtalmoligue.

Médecin horrible. Ma mère a eu 2 vitrectomie, et ensuite un plissement scérale (donc 3 opérations en 3 mois pour décollement de la rétine). Elle ne voit toujours pas. Médecin ne répond pas aux questions; il reste silencieux. Lorsqu'on lui a demandé s'il avait déjà vue des cas similaires, et quel était le taux de réussite, il a rit, et c'est tout. Un être bête, suffisant. On ne sait pas à quoi s'attendre, et surtout, SURTOUT, ma mère ne voit toujours rien. Donc nous sommes finalement retourné à l'institue de la rétine de Montréal pour voir un autre médecin. Corriveau peut ben aller se faire foutre. Traiter le monde comme des animaux. On se sent stupide. Il est prétentieux et blasé. Il n'a aucun sens de la compatie. Il n'explique absolument rien au patient. Les gens sont inquiet, et ca lui passe 100 pieds par dessus la tête. Si au moins les interventions avaient fonctionnées, mais non. À ÉVITER À TOUT PRIX !!!!!

Quand on porte des lunettes pour lire depuis 15 ans, c'est inacceptable de se faire opérer et qu'on nous donne un peu de vision de près et un peu de vision de loin. Ce qu'on voulait c'était de la vision de loin.
Avare de commentaire et d’explication il ne semble pas intéresser et n’est pas à l’écoute de son patient il nous donne des réponses en apparence moqueuse.

Excellente consultation médicale suite à un problème de vision trouble à mon œil gauche. Explication fort satisfaisante sur le suivi ainsi que les recommandations en cas de problèmes ! Merci Dr. Corriveau pour votre disponibilité malgré votre horaire chargé. 2018-06-22
Expérience terriblement décevante. Aucune explication de la part du médecin. J’ai perdu 2 heures de mon temps.
Does not give the patient any information. Doesn t explain what he will do to you and what to expect for a surgery. No bedside maners or helpfull words.
Médecin expéditif. Des heures d’attentes pour une consultation de 5 minutes. De la médecine à la chaîne qui profite de l’inquiétude de ses patients pour leur imposer des conditions inacceptables.

Dr Corriveau is an older Dr, but he’s got a lot of experience and is in very good shape. I had a very successful cataract operation, he does not spend his time by doing laser correction like a large group of ophtalmos.
À éviter, j'aurais préféré n'avoir jamais fait affaire avec lui.
NO 1 au Canada, avec expérience aussi de mes amis, je le recommande
Saved my left eye, promp and timely when situation was urgent, less so afterwards, what more can I say.

À éviter . Le pire médecin qui m'a été donné de voir. Aucune empathie,aucun bonjour,très froid. 

Ne répond pas à nos questions.

Expérience traumatisante à accompagner mon conjoint à ses rendez-vous à l'hôpital Notre-Dame, Des heures d'attente pour un rendez-vous bâclé le plus vite possible. Aucune explication sur la pathologie, Vite on passe à un autre patient. De la vraie médecine de guerre...

This guy should not be practicing. Within about 2 minutes in his office he immediately wanted to go to Vitrectomy. That would have meant Cataracts within a year. He's old school, old methods, poor bedside, not especially innovative or bright as far as doctors go. I'd would not recommend him to anyone. Avoid Avoid Avoid. Go with Galic or Chen at the Royal Vic, or to a lesser extent, Gravel for prelims at Lachine.

Ce medecin est très incompétent. Il est de la vielle école. Vielles méthodes de boucher, traitements causant plus de mal. Il est représentatif d'un malaise d'incompétence dans le Chum en général. Évitez, Évitez. Allez plutôt voir Galic ou Chen au Royal Vic, ou bien Gravel à Lachine. Plus à jour dans leurs méthodes.

Dr. Corriveau sees over 100 patients per duty day. On November 20, 2014 the number was more like 150 patients for a 12 hour day (5 minutes per patient). His workload does not appear that is going to improve. He is an outstanding professional and very patient given the situation Quebec hospitals are facing.

According to my Optometrist I needed immediate attention with both my eyes and therefore referred me to Dr. Louis A. Corriveau. Dr. Louis A. Corriveau has been following me for the last two years and everytime I have asked him to explain to me my condition he has walked away from the room after a 5 minutes visit. But the worst incident on my last follow-up visit is that when I asked him, what do I have? Why are you stalling in taking action...I see everything blured in front of me. His response was use a Magifying Lens so that you can see. This turned me off completly hearing a response of such nature coming from a highly recommended specialist. I opted to go get a second opion from another ophthalmologist to find out that I have Retinal Diabetes were my new Dr. response was that Dr. Corriveau should have taken immediate action over 6 months ago. That being said what do I think of Dr. Corriveau, I would not recommend him not even to my worst enemy.

mon mari ses fait opperer par le docteur corriveau pour la retine decollement total le dr.corriveau lui a sauver l oeuil mon mari a ete tres satisfait etant donner qu il a perdu l oeuil gauche il peut-etre pas souriant mais tres competant il a fait une difference dans notre vie il a des mains de fee le docteur ses fait rassurant avec mon mari meme sur la table doperation
take to many patients he has make mistake when operate my cataracte i have big problems since that i did not have before

Doctor did not administer a relaxant to keep my father, age 94, relaxed during the operation. My father experienced a panic attack and operation had to be rushed. In the follow up visit he had no time to explain what the condition was of his operated eye and was asking us to leave even though we tried to understand the cause of his pain and pressure increase in his operated eye. On the eighth day following the operation the pain persists. We have been in the emergency at Notre-Dame where medication was given. Dr Corriveau is very aloof and always in a rush to finish with the appointment. If I had to do this operation again this doctor would not be my choice

Dr. Corriveau operated on my right eye after I had suffered a traumatic eye injury in which my eye was virtually destroyed. After the initial restoration of the eyeball itself he installed a "buckle" or "gasket" to keep my retina from collapsing. Although I did not regain complete vision in this eye, I still consider the operations a full success, considering the extend of damage my eye had sustained. Now 18 years later, my retina is still holding up and I enjoy the remaining vision in my eye. Without the skill and expertise of Dr. Corriveau I would have surely lost my right eye. I cannot thank him enough.

Docteur Corriveau est mon médecin l’âge de 18 ans. J’en ai maintenant 25. C’est vrai qu’il est très froid, direct et il a même déjà poussé ma mère hors de son bureau en disant, merci à la prochaine! C’est vrai que ce n’est pas très habituel comme manière de faire, surtout venant d’un médecin! Par contre, il est très professionnel et il m’a opéré à plusieurs reprises, toujours un succès. On doit dire que lorsque nous avons un médecin compétant au Québec, on le garde! Malgré son manque de sourire, il est très efficace! Pour l’attente, à moins d’être cédulé à 8h le matin, quel médecin n’a pas de retard dans ses rendez-vous… l’important c’est de se faire guérir correctement, à mon avis. Pour les urgences, il trouve toujours de la place pour ses patients. Je le conseil fortement.
Très grande compétance Et une équipe très gentille et affable.

beaucoup de gens dans sa clinique de montreal. sur de lui et probablement tres competent, ses consultations ne durent jamais plus que quelques minutes malgre le fait que le patient ait attendu plusieurs minutes sinon quelques heures dans sa clinique...

C'est le pire médecin que j'ai jamais rencontré et j'ai préféré aller en voir un autre plutôt que de me faire opérer par lui.Il m'a fait très mal et n'a même pas été capable de me donner un papier-mouchoir sans que je ne lui demande malgré que je pleurais à chaudes larmes.Il ne m'a rien expliqué non plus se contentant de me dire qu'il devait m'opérer.

détient le record d'attente, tres froid, ne répond pas aux questions, peur qu'un sourire lui décroche la mâchoire tres antipathique, supposé être un excellent chirurgien, réputation surfaite ? je ne crois pas

Je me suis fait opéré par le docteur Corririveau, pour ce qui est de l'opération,rien n'a dire tout étais parfait. Mais, pour le reste un gros zéro, aucun entre-gens, bête, pas intéressé de répondre à nos questions, que je juge très importante, car nous sommes dans l'inconnue total, la seul réponse est: prend un prochain rendez-vous. Je viens de me faire opéré, je le vois le lendemain et mon prochain rendez-vous est dans 5 semaines et il me dit ne conduit pas et pas d'examen de la vue avant notre prochain rendez-vous. Je vois très mal,car mes deux yeux ne sont plus égale. Je suis très très déçu du suivie qu'il peut donner. Il nous parle, mais ne nous regarde pas, donc aucun respect pour nous. On se sent ridicule en sa présence.

This doctor has performed 11 interventions ranging from laser to 6hr. in operating room in an attempt to re-attach my right retina. He is professional and knowledgeable but does not display a friendly compassionate attitude. His patients feel they are in an assembly line, and be ready to wait hours. BUT he sees patients in at least two hospitals (maybe more) plus his clinic and as well teaches at the UofM, therefore time is a luxary.

Il est l'as du retard, on attend parfois tout l'àprès-midi. Et que dire de son approche froide et inhumaine. Il ne dit pas bonjour et au revoir. C'est du travail à la châine et ne se préoccupe pas de ton inquiétude (c'est ta vision après-tout et une erreur peut te priver de ta vue). Il ne répond pas aux questions et il te fait sentir niaiseux. Un petit cours de savoir vivre serait bénéfique. Il semble compétent mais ne connaIt pas grand chose aux médicament vs la condition générale du patient.

Ce médecin est un vraie imbécile pas humain pas de façon avec ses patients aucune délicatesse.Il est vraie de dire qu'il est bon médecin mais il serais préférable pour lui de suivre une formation comment être plus humain avec ses patients. J'espère qu'un jour cette énergumène goutera à sa propre médecine et qu'on le traitera comme un morceau de viande comme lui si bien le fait

Le docteur corriveau est un grand rétinologue reconnu à travers la province du Québec, il est très professionnel et a donné sa vie à l’ophtalmologie. Il soigne ses patients avec beaucoup de compassion. Il est très disponible pour les urgences et est à l’écoute, il encourage les patients, il est bien et a un grand coeur. Il est très perfectionniste ce qui le rend exigeant. Il a une tendresse insoupconnée. Je remercie le Dr Panicet de l’avoir mis sur ma route.

Il n'est pas sociable ni ponctuel, mais il n'a pas le temps de l'être. Il voit une centaine de patients par jour. Il travaille dans 3 hôpitaux et il donne des cours à l'U de M en plus de sa clinique. C'est le plus grand spécialiste de la rétine à Montréal. C'est un excellent médecin et excellent chirurgien. Il a vu un décollement de rétine qu'un autre ophthalmo n'avait pas vu.
Never on time (2 à 3 hours waiting even with an appointment)- inhuman attitude and unable to recognize his fault in case of wrong diagnose.

My husband and I loved Dr. Corriveau. He operated on my husband's eyes and we credit him with literally giving my husband back the gift of sight. Without him, I believe my husband may have been totally blind today. He's very quiet and lowkey but he's also very compassionate and knowledgeable and we both have great confidence in him and his surgical ability. Thanks again Dr. Corriveau. Dean and Darlene Snow

Ce Dr n'a aucune empathie. Il m'a fait très mal et me disait de ne pas bouger d'un ton fort méprisant. D'autre ophtalmo m'ont fait les mêmes traitements au lazer et m'ont fait 90% moins mal. N'est pas professionnel dans ses belles gogounes. Ici l'habit fait le moine.
Mauvais diagnostic m'a pas vu un décollement de rétine que mon optométriste avait vu.
Du travail à la chaine et ceci en clinique privée. il n'aime pas son patient. mauvais suivi. sa compétence reste à prouver.
Que dire, il est dur, dur. La tolerance n'est pas son fort. Il est toutefois un super chirurgien. Il a un bon fond! Un fond parfois creu, mais bon! J'en ai connu des pires.
Excellent doctor, very thorough and ran many exams. Very professional. Very good, kind, and pays attention to details.
Dr. Sheila Huang is a very qualified eye Doctor. She is compassionate and patient.

Waited over 2 months for my appointment, I was suffering from an acute-onset eye issue that was really affecting my quality of life. Dr. Huang barely gave me the time of day. Didn't address any of my questions and concerns which I came prepared with, simply took a quick look at my eyes and prescribed me unaffordable eye drops and told me my condition was lifelong and to learn to live with it. I have since found other doctors who offered me more solutions and hope for my issue, as well as answered all of my questions. She was also on the phone most of our short appointment. No empathy, a cocky doctor who just wants to operate
I had an appointment in the morning so no waiting time. The staff was friendly and efficient. Dr. Huang is very professional, she listen and takes time to explain problems and procedures.

Dr, Huang was very professional and friendly. I had a few questions and she took the time to answer them so that I understood what would be happening, she did not rush through the answers.

As for the clinic itself, I can't complain. My appointment was at 8:30 AM. I was told there could be up to a 2 hour wait before I saw the doctor. I got to the clinic at 7:45, but it wasn't open. The doors opened at 8:00, and I was the first patient inside (there were two others behind me). The receptionist was vey polite and helpful. I did not have to wait anywhere near 2 hours, I got in to see Dr. Huang at 8:40.
The Doctor is very patient and checking with all the detail, but the reception is awful!
The doctor is indeed competent and friendly. The receptionists and organization are awful. L-o-n-g, unfair wait times. Patient files left on a table where all patients can look at them - not ok.

Dr Sheila Huang seems like a very good doctor: she is competent, friendly and solicitous, and she takes the time to listen to her patients and to treat the individual. She can be hard to get an appointment with, however, and the wait times are ridiculous (easily three hours). And the clinic itself, the Institut de la rétine de Montréal, is an organizational nightmare. The receptionists are beyond incompetent, misscheduling and double-booking appointments, calling two or three times for the same appointment, mixing up patients, contradicting each other and even themselves...

Dr Thompson is helpful, knowledgeable and very patient. Although the wait can be quit long it is worth the wait. If it was not for Dr. Thompson I would have lost my eye, I had an emergency corneal transplant. I have to say amazing and Thank you to Dr. Paul Thompson.

I have been very satisfied with my consultations with Dr. Thomson. He cautioned me against laser surgery given the particular characteristics of my myopia, reminding me that perfect vision with glasses is preferable to halo effects and scarring without glasses. In the light of recent reviews of laser surgery results, I am grateful for his conservative approach!

Je suis patiente du docteur Thompson depuis plusieurs années, pour un problème de keratocone (déformation congénitale de la cornée). J'ai attendu 5 ans une greffe de cornée mais ça valait la peine. L'opération s'est très bien déroulée malgré quelques petits imprévus très bien maîtrisés. L'équipe a été merveilleusement efficace. Le Dr. Thompson a exécuté un travail remarquable avec art, doigté et minutie. Je suis très chanceuse d'avoir trouvé un chirurgien des yeux aussi excellent. il fait un travail remarquable. tous les autres praticiens des yeux qui ont vu ma greffe l'ont aussi dit. Mon autre oeil attend son tour avec concupiscence et confiance.
Listened to my concerns and acted upon them to correct the medication. Excellent doctor.
Il est courtois, gentil, beaucoup de gens que je connais ont été opérés par lui et sont très satisfaits. Prend son temps avec son patient
Il est courtois, gentil, beaucoup de gens que je connais ont été opérés par lui et sont très satisfaits. Prend son temps avec son patient
tmedecin très conscencieux il me soigne depuis 15 ans Je le recommande
Ce médecin m'a soigné durant 2 épisodes de 10 ans chacune. Je ne mets pas en doute sa compétence, bien au contraire, mais il pourrait se débarrasser du personnel qui l'entourent. Elles sont minables.
Un très grand médecin, grand de nature, mais très concienceux.
J'ai ce médecin depuis 10 ans et son attitude d'écoute, de conseiller, son professionnalisme est au top de la médecine. Le personnel l'entourant est courtois.
C'est difficile pour moi d'évaluer la compétence du Dr Paquin mais le personnel qui l'emtoure est franchement minable.

Tout simplement horrible ! J’ai dû la consulter en urgence, car j’avais une déchirure de la rétine. Au lieu de me faire du laser comme mon ophtalmologiste habituel, elle a décidé de me traiter avec la cryothérapie. Lorsque je lui dit que j’aimerais avoir des détails sur ce traitement elle m’a dit qu’elle n’a pas de temps pour ça et que si je ne veux pas me faire soigner que je devrais aller ailleur. J’accepte donc le traitement sous la contrainte. Elle me dit que je ne peux pas bouger durant le traitement sinon elle va me mettre des écarteurs dans les yeux. Elle me fait ensuite le traitement… c’était L’ENFER. Je vous invite à aller voir une vidéo sur google et vous mettre à ma place, aucunement sédationnée. Lorsque je l’ui ai dit que j’allais perdre connaissance tellement la douleur était intense, elle a mouillé un essui-tout brun et me la lancé au visage. Je me suis ensuite mise à pleurer puis elle me dit en sortant de la pièce que je devrais aller consulter un psychologue… c’était traumatisant comme expérience et je ne souhaite à personne d’avoir le malheur de se faire soigner par Dre Boucher.
j ai eu une cataracte beaucoup trop attendue sur un œil. l'opération a été réussi avec d'excellent résultat et ce pendant la pandémie, Dre Boucher merci mille fois. Alain Brouillard

Je voie par les commantaires que tout les dr en ophtalmologie ne sont pas jasant,s.v.p.donner un site avec les infos de base sure ce que vous nous faites,je comprends l empleur de votre travail et la minutie que sa exige ,mais en tant que patient sais très angoissant de ce faire jouer dans l oeil sans avoir de détail. Le dentiste et le pharmacien me donne plein de papier a lire pour une extraction de dent donc pour un opération dans les yeux s.v.p. plus de détails, mais quand même merci pour vos bon soin.

Dre Boucher m'a opérée d'urgence pour décollement et déchirure de la rétine en mai 2015. Je l'ai revue plusieurs fois depuis pour le suivi post-opératoire et pour laser préventif dans l'autre œil à risque de décollement aussi. Sur la table d'opération, elle m'annonce qu'elle me remplace le cristallin pour une lentille! J'ai demandé pourquoi et elle m'a répondu de ne pas parler parce que je la dérangeais dans sa délicate chirurgie. Compétente certes, mais aucune empathie, impatiente, manque de compétences interpersonnelles, réponses évasives ou carrément ridicules à mes questions. Elle essaie certainement d'être réconfortante avec des énoncés comme quoi elle est contente du résultat, ça va prendre de 6 mois à un an avant le résultat final, etc. Mais huit mois après la chirurgie, c'est toujours pareil : vision floue, lignes droites déformées, distorsion en coussin des visages, extrême presbytie... J'essaie en vain de changer de rétinologue pour mon dernier RV de suivi le mois prochain. J'ai quelque chose de pas normal avec ma macula et JE VEUX DES RÉPONSES Dre BOUCHER!!!

Aucune empathie. Très peu humaine dans sa relation avec le patient. Toujours pressée, donc impatiente. Ne prend pas le temps de répondre aux questions. Certainement compétente, mais pas chaleureuse ni réconfortante.
Je n'ai pas aimé ma première visite, je dois la revoir prochainement. J'ai demandé à voir un autre spécialiste de la rétine mais on me répond que le Dr Boucher doit donner son approbation. Décue

Mon premier contacte avec Dre Boucher fut en décembre 1999. Elle m'a opéré pour un décollement et un déchirement de la rétine. Elle a exécuté un Buckle scléral et ce fut un succès. Elle est très connaissant et est apaisante. S'il est vrai que Dre Boucher semble a prime abord ''bête" il n'es n'est rien. Elle est simplement débordé..... Est-ce normal de devoir rencontré plus de 40 patients dans une journée ? Certainement pas ! Pourtant elle est toujours fidèle au poste Bravo Dre Boucher. Demain je laisse encore mes yeux a vos bons soins (cette fois pour cataracte) je ne voudrais pas d'un autre ophtalmologiste.

Moi j'ai eu Rdv avec elle cette semaine, il fallait que l'infirmiere me prenne des photos des deux yeux etant diabetique,l'appareil n'a pas fonctionne , je vu le medecin apres,je lui ai demande s'il fallait reprendre les photos cette semaine, elle a dit noo, elle m'a dit que j'avais des trucs dans mon oeil, mais elle me revoit dans 08 mois...je suis inquiete et je ne suis pas satisfaite car si j'avais pris mes photos et qu'elle m'aurait dit rdv dans huit mois, j'aurai compris, mais la...je vais essayer de voir un autre docteur prochainement... Bonne chance a tous....

J’ai attendu de 2:15pm à 6:20pm pour me faire dire que l’infirmière n’avait pas fait les tests nécessaires pour ma rencontre. Donc, je dois retourner et tout recommencer. Elle n’avait aucune empathie et m’a même dit à deux reprises que je « tombais des nuages » si je pensais qu’elle pouvait intervenir et se plaindre contre cette infirmière. À l’hôpital Maisonneuve-Rosemont, « les employés sont syndiqués et ce qui compte, c’est le nombre d’années de service et non la qualité des employés. » Quand j’ai exprimé ma frustration d’avoir perdu ma journée (pcq je viens de l’extérieur loin de Montréal), elle m’a dit qu’elle était là depuis 8h, sa journée n’était pas terminée encore et le système de santé était ainsi; aucune empathie!! C’est sûrement une personne compétente mais je vais aller ailleurs. Elle m’a dit que j’avais le droit à une deuxième opinion (je n’ai même pas eu de première opinion!!!) mais que « ça sera pas mieux ailleurs.»

Elle est bête comme ses pieds et n'a aucune considération pour ses patients. Elle est toujours en retard et toujours débordée, n'a pas le temps de te dire bonjour et tu es assise sur sa chaise 2 minutes seulement pour un contrôle.ex: R"V" 9.oo am et passe à 15.30 hres, est-ce normal ? Cela m'est arrivé plus d'une fois.Lamentable !

Mon premier rendez-vous avec Dr Boucher s'est avéré plaisant et rassurant. Les explications étaient complètes et efficaces. Son calme et sa douceur: rassurants. Je me suis fait enlever une cataracte et, grâce à toutes ses qualités, aucune inquiétude subsistait dans mon esprit. Le rendez-vous pour l'intervention ne se fit pas trop attendre et celle-ci fut une réussite totale sans douleur. Je recommande hautement ce docteur. Pierre Bourgeois

Urgent intervention was needed to correct my retinal detachment. Although the intervention was mildly painful (which is to be expected) I am most satisfied with her treatment and her explanations before & after said treatment. I would recommend her .. blindly.

I believe she is knowleageable. The operation, I had , was for the most part sucessfull. But I required followup operations by other doctors due to the complexity of my situation. From a bed-side matter point of view ( answering to questions, reassuring the patient and providing medications to counteract the pain ), I have to rate her as one on the less helpfull I had to deal with.
