Je suis sous les soib=ns du dr Boucger depuie 15 ans et je suis très satisfait je la trouve très compétente et comprésenhiver hains
Pas très jasante mais très efficace et professionnelle.

Dr Ta est très professionnelle et ne laisse aucun détail au hasard. Je dois dire que je me sens vraiment en confiance. Sa secrétaire est très gentille et très accueillante. Elle répond rapidement à nos besoins et très professionnelle. Son infirmière très professionnelle aussi.
Doctor Gray is the best in her field, such a professional person

Dr gray is the best in her business...simply......

..
you gave me a life i would never had without your work , psotis palbrebrale , thanks .

une équipe formidable et le médecin excellent et tres humain sa été une réussite pour mes paupieres c'est le meilleur il est un vrai magicien je le recommande il nous mais en confiance mille mercis a vous et a votre équipe

Je l'ai rencontrée une seule fois et elle m'a plu tout de suite. Elle a passé beaucoup de temps avec moi.(problème assez complexe). Elle est très dévouée et aussi très compétente. Je l'ai rencontré dans une clinique de Nicolet par contre. Elle porte le même nom et le même métier... on doit parler de la même Marie Veillette!

Dr.Veillette est très dévouée et soucieuse du bien-être de ses patients. Je suis allée la voir et je l'ai tellement aimé que j'ai décidé d'amener mes deux enfants de 4 et 7 ans. Elle sait comment s'y prendre avec les jeunes enfants et je la conseille fortement.

Ce docteur est très compétent, attentif et minutieux. Il montre de la compassion et de la patience devant la détresse de son patient. Il a accompli une tâche délicate avec adresse et assurance tout en demandant l'avis de collègue pour plus de sûreté. Il a introduit une bulle de gaz dans mon oeil afin de recoller la rétine et ce, en urgence, en me laissant son numéro de cellulaire au cas où.... Plus tard, il a soudé la rétine au laser et tout a été parfaitement bien. Je remercie de docteur qui a sauvé ma vue par ses connaissances et son efficacité. Michelle Arpin

Ce docteur est très compétent, attentif et minutieux. Il montre de la compassion et de la patience devant la détresse de son patient. Il a accompli une tâche délicate avec adresse et assurance tout en demandant l'avis de collègue pour plus de sûreté. Il a introduit une bulle de gaz dans mon oeil afin de recoller la rétine et ce, en urgence, en me laissant son numéro de cellulaire au cas où.... Plus tard, il a soudé la rétine au laser et tout a été parfaitement bien. Je remercie de docteur qui a sauvé ma vue par ses connaissances et son efficacité. Michelle Arpin
If you don’t mind having an old man who happens to be a narcissistic sociopath work on your eyes with a scalpel this guy is for you he really needs to retire. Very condescending & Heartless.
Dr silver is an excellent. However the technician that does the basic eye test is both rude and arrogant.

Don’t go to this place. Dr. Silver is disrespectful, aggressive, 0 professional and 0 patient. My little sister was there this morning. First he didn’t even wear his mask well afterwards, my little sister was afraid of the machines, so the doctor pulled her by the hair to bring her closer to the machine (he pulled her so hard that it still hurts). She was scared and didn’t dare to talk about it in the clinic. Now that I know I’m trying to call the clinic for explanations, but they’re not answering. It is unacceptable, he has no right to touch her or to lack respect for customers!
Rated Dr Silver a day ago, Saw the rating and today it was gone. Very interesting. Seems that only poor ratings show up. He is a good doctor.

I've been seeing Dr Silver for years and always found him helpful. Overall he is and the office is much better since he moved from the West Island to Cote-des-Neiges. Office is a bit dated but it's much faster and on time. I wish him the best at the new location. I usually can get a smile out of him and that's so important.

I just couldn't make an appointment with Dr Barry (by phone) because his secretary was very rude and disrespectful! I want an appointment for somebody that doesn't have medical inssurance , just because i needed she repeat the information for me -my french is no perfect- she demanded me to find someone who speaks french well because she was not going to repeat . When I was telling her that she was not being nice, honestly for being a secretary she lacked of patient and customer service, and asking her name she just left me hanged on the phone!! After read cothe mments here about Dr Silver I understoodnow why he has such a receptionist ...
do not good see this Dr. very bad,bad,bad,bad,bad,.............

Consulted Dr.Silver because because of an eye problem which my opto believed to be related to early multiple-sclerosis symptom. He rejected this possibility in a few minutes without requesting further tests or IRM. Now a few years later with different and multiple symptoms it has been confirmed to be a cyclic multiple-sclerosis. It would have helped having an earlier detection and proper medical follow-up.

Must say that Barry Sylver was a good doctor at one time. Our eyes are the most important organ we need to preserve. Unfortunaly, somewhere Dr.Sylver has forgoten what is important.Good luck to you, after 20 years with all my eye diseases, I am giving you up.

Family member went to his office with potential glass particles in his eye and the person at the front desk said he isn't seeing anyone else today .Good buy. Imagine having a eye doctor that you can't see with something like this. Not impressed.
He is very rude and in my case he prescribed eye glasses that were way too stong.
He has saved the sight in my eye...I trust him totally. He has been available whenever I needed to see him and I would highly recommend him. His secretary Stella is great too. Pat McCaffery
Very helpfull, took me in a emergency patient, with his smiling secretary, it was worth the waiting she is very very pleasant and helpfull, he saved my sight. Very professionnal

I consulted Dr. Silver with a nagging problem that my GP was unable to solve. I didn't find Dr. Silver to be overly chit-chatty, which is good, since patients don't have to sit in the waiting room very long after they arrive for their appointment. In fact, I had several visits, and he was very punctual for all of them (for my GP, I usually have to wait 1 to 2 hours!). During the first visit, he took the time to explain the problem and the treatment options. During all of my visits, he took the time to answer my questions. He provided a close and regular follow-up. In the end, the problem was solved. I found Dr. Silver to be very competent and would definitely recommend him.

After carefully reading all 13 reviews, it seems to me there are distinctly 2 different doctors being rated under 1 name.I do know 1 of them! so the above middle of the road ratings are unconsequential, it's just to enable me to send in my 2 cents. and "I certify that this rating is based on MY OWN experience with this doctor" was with 1 of them.

A family member developed an acute ocular situation. She had previously been followed by Dr. Silver. He took her condition very seriously, examined her 3 times a week to follow her progress and came in on his day off to see her. He was very concerned, consulted with colleagues about her care and gave her excellent care and service. Can't comment on his bedside manner, but we felt she was in excellent hands.
HE'S THE WORST DR I'VE EVER MET. HE SAID MY SON'S VISION WAS FINE BUT HE HAD A DETACHED RETINA THAT CAUSED HIM TO BE BLIND!!!! MY SON JUST HAD SURGERY. DO NOT SEE THIS DR.!!
Prompt, efficient, friendly, great bedside manner. Knows how to talk to patient to put them at ease.

Très impatient et hautain. Il ne connaissait pas le problème des uvéites chez les enfants avec l'arthrite juvénile et semblait ridiculiser mes inquiétudes pourtant fondées. J'ai changé d'ophtalmologiste.

I was an on and off patient of Dr.Silver for a scratched retina that lead to Herpetic Keratitis. He was always brief and to the point but was always very pleasant during the examination. Quite a few times after on initial contact I was a walk-in and he always managed to see me rather quickly as most often I would only require 5 minutes or less of his time. There was a problem with one of his staff, yes... being cold and somewhat unhelpful but otherwise Barry would go the extra distance for me whether it be free samples of eye drops or signing my passport application without charging me at all. If you are reading this Dr. Silver I wanted to thank you again for all that you've done. And hopefully the next time I see you it won't be due to a recurrence, rather just a chance encounter.

I think Dr. B. Silver, knows his business, he always has room for a patient's emergency, the problem his 1 of his secretaries who has been drilled in the military, never a smilethe should inlist her with the US Army. But the other blonde secretary is always smiling, helpfull and always listens to you...Her smile is worth coming back to see such a knowledgeble ophtholmologist

I 'was' a patient of Dr. (Barry) Silver's for over 10 years. He has always been rude and condescending but I continued to go to him and made excuses for his behaviour (..a bad day, his bad back..) Two years ago I had emergency retina surgery at the Montreal General and then again at the Royal Vic with Dr.Oh. She and the other doctors did wonderful work on my eyes..She/they are all extremely busy but always were very professional and polite. I returned for my regular appointments with Dr. (B)Silver and finally decided that no doctor should ever speak or treat a patient like Dr. B. Silver spoke to me. I do not expect a 'bedside manner' but I do expect professionalism. I will never go back to Dr. Silver no matter how knowledgeable he is (or is not!).

He can be a little brusque (which may have something to do with the fact that he is often in pain from a back problem), but if you take a real interest in your own condition, participate in your own treatment and ASK INTELLIGENT QUESTIONS he is more than willing to take the time to inform you.

I have been seen by Dr. Barry Silver for over 5 years and have complained repeatedly of eye pain and blurred vision, and nausea..to have it left untreated by Dr. Silver, and told that I must have migraines..I then asked for a referral to go to see another Dr. for a second opinion, to find that I was diagnosed with closed angle glaucoma and an eye pressure of over 50 which is more than 100% over the normal eye pressure. I was told that by Dr. Silver that I was a difficult patient to take eye pressure from, however, I was able to have pressure taken from me over 5 times by an optomitrist I was referred to by a friend. If you have eye pain, or blurred vision and do not receive proper attention, you could go blind, so get a second opinion...its worth the hassle to keep your sight!

Several years ago I got a small piece of metal stuck in my eye while shaking out a carpet and went to see Dr. Silver. I was nervous,of course, and told him so. His answer, "I've done this on four year olds and they haven't complained". Nice. Found another opthalmologist.

Inpatient and condascending.Hurt me during exam. Charged me $10 for a couple of drops of eye anesthetic (worth about 50 cents). Didn't want to solve my problem. Found another ophthalmologist who cured me. O bedside manner!
Certainly knows his stuff and has always been helpful. If I had to suggest improvement in an area (as it pertains to me), it would likely be a bit more gentleness and patience in bedside manner.
Approachable and knowledgeable but scheduling sometimes delated

Made an appointment , then discovered there were fees.

Prepared to meet him, but saw a technicien & needed to book a 2nd appointment for him.

No explanation & no transparency
He's very good and gentle ! Thank you for care of my grand mother.
gooddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddgggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggggg

J’ai vu Dr Lord suite à une visite à l’urgence du CHUM. Il a pris le temps de bien regarder afin de s’assurer de l’état de ma rétine. Il était calme et répondait à mes questions. Il a été rassurant et empathique. Je me suis sentie prise en charge et sécurisée.

Excellent médecin. Ce dernier prend le temps d’écouter et de clairement expliquer les raisons de ses recommandations. Ses explications sont apaisantes et rassurantes. On ne pourrait que souhaiter que tous les médecins fassent preuve d’un tel professionnalisme. P.T.

Shocking, dehumanizing, unhelpful 10 minute visit after waiting over 2 hours. Don’t ask him a question unless you want to be shot down. He has no respect for people. Please don’t take a vulnerable family member to him.

I am really appalled by Dr. Lord's condecension and entitlement. He was impatient with my discomfort during the exam. The wait time is terrible - people are sitting there like cattle, awaiting his arrival to "lord it over" them. 

I give his knowledge a low rating as well because part of medical knowledge is understanding how to communicate and care.
semms incompetent does not care if he hurst you operation for galauma 3 year sago spoiled my esignt constant pain and inconfort in my eyes since ..non to recommed

My former ophthalmologist (now retired ) never once mentioned in 8 years of treatment any laser treatments or eye surgery. Dr Lord took his place. I have met him 3 times in the last year and have already had one laser treatment (my vision declined) and he is booking me for the other eye, plus mentioned that I would have cataract surgery upcoming, and while in surgery they would do glaucoma surgery. He is not only agressive in booking 'interventions' he raises his voice when his patients ask questions or for more clarifications. I will be changing clinics.

Le complexe du chirurgien, vous connaissez? De ma vie, je nʼai jamais rencontré un médecin aussi froid et arrogant. Mʼobstine sur mon expérience SUBJECTIVE (à laquelle, par définition, il nʼa évidemment pas accès). Sʼadresse à moi avec une condescendance consommée, comme si jʼétais un demeuré fini. Toute son attitude est à mon sens signe dʼun grand sentiment dʼinsécurité. De plus il a essayé de me faire payer 200$ auxquels il nʼavait pas droit à mon premier rendez-vous à sa clinique il y a deux ans. Quelle différence avec mon gastro-entérologue, qui, lui, prend le temps de mʼexpliquer ma situation en détail et calmement, y allant même de petits dessins éclairants — un être humain normal, quoi...

J’ai été opérée par docteur Lord au mois de janvier 2020 pour le glaucome et la cataracte. Je l’ai trouvé très compétent et excellent dans sa spécialité. Je l'ai revu plusieurs fois depuis pour le suivi post-opératoire et ce même pendant la pandémie. C’est un gentil médecin qui n'est pas trop bavard mais si vous posez de bonnes questions vous aurez des réponses.
avoid at all cost seems more inter ested in making money with surgeries very disappointed

Je suis désoler de lire ses commentaire :( mon père a eu une chirurgie de cataracte avec Dr Lord il y a environ 2 mois est le résulta ont étais parfait selon mon père il aurait du se faire opérée bien avant. Merci Dr Lord ..

DO NOT GO SEE DOCTOR LORD . IF You want to keep your eyes please don’t. I never experienced such a cold blooded doctor and the PAIN PAIN . Ever since I saw him the PAIN is worst . He doesn’t care about anyone . You tell him that he is hurting you and he doesn’t care . A real butcher. For me to write a review it’s because I don’t want other people to see him and suffer like we did . Now I’m seeing a new doctor for my eyes . But please don’t go see him Im a nice woman but he is so mean and incompetent
PAIN, PAIN, MORE PAIN. totally incompetent money grabber.

Très mauvaise expérience avec Mr. Frederic Lord. Il est désagréable, peu empathique et manque d’écoute. Dommage de faire tout le cursus demandé pour être médecin spécialiste pour finalement traiter ses patients de façon désinvolte. Si il travaille pour compter son argent, Mr. Lord aurait dû travailler dans une banque. Son compte en banque est plein; son coeur doit être vide.

He treated me for glaucoma. My laser treatment supposed to be at 1:00 pm. At 12:00 the nurse put the drips in my left eye. Doctor appeared at 5:40 pm. Was no staff at that time. He performed alone, and he was very aggressive. He shoot my eye each corner 4 times, and it supposed to be only one, maximum two. I’ve suffered for many months after this terrible treatment. From what I see now, is even worst than 10 years ago.

Ce médecin fait beaucoup attendre ses patientset se montre intimidant quand on ose lui poser des questions pourtant bien légitimes. Il passe plus de temps à expliquer pourquoi on ne devrait pas lui avoir posé telle ou telle question qu'à répondre à la question. Experience extrêmement désagréable.

He does not care for his patient you are just a number went to him but was not realy interested to help me never did anything for me to help my eyes they just got worse and because of him I lost 80% vision on my left eye is that a good doctor not really so please get other referral

A traité ma mère pour du glaucome alors qu'elle n'en a JAMAIS été atteinte. Rendez-vous au 6 mois très très important. depuis plus de 2ans1/2.. À 83 ans se faire traiter pour rien.. de l'arnaque pur et simple.. et attention au coût des examens et aussi Préparez-vous à attendre. Derniers rendez vous entre 2h30 et 3H00. à attendre "Vraiment non recommandable". Ah oui j'oubliais ses techniciennes "Pressées car elles n'avaient pas dîners..." Le professinalisme X 1000 Passez votre chemin!!!

Je ne recommanderai jamais ce médecin , il a été bête avec ma mère qui a osé lui poser une question. Il l'a balayé du revers de la main en 5 secondes comme si elle le dérangeait . Un médecin que tu attends depuis plus de 3 heures et qui envoi promener une personne âgée ne mérite pas d'avoir une clientèle qui doit endurer les sautes d'humeur de monsieur ! Un bulldog aurait plus de façon que lui !

I also had a poor experience with Dr. Lord. I had an appoinment for 8:50 am...when I went to the reception, I saw that appointements had been booked every 10 minutes! I ended up spending almost 3 hours at this place. When I was finally called to sit in a room and the doctor would be there shortly...after 10 minutes of waiting for him and he had yet arrived, I went back into the waiting room to see what would happen. When one of the staff people saw that the room was empty, she called the next patient! When I said that I was in that room, I was told to get back in there in that case. When Dr. Lord did arrive, he explained that I would need cataract surgery. That there was a 3% chance that such and such could go wrong and a 15% chance that something else could go wrong.and that he performed 1,000 of these operations a year! I did not get the surgery with him and I agree with the person who wrote that this doctor is to be avoided.

I saw Dr. Lord after being transferred from Dr. Jean Duperré, a once-great glaucoma specialist who had become irascible, impatient and downright rude in his later years. I believed Dr. Lord would be better, indeed, his nurse assistant assured me he would answer all my questions. Wrong! Not only did he not answer my questions, he treated me as if they were unfounded and was clearly irritated by being asked any questions at all. 

My optometrist, who referred a great number of patients to him, told me that he used to be fantastic, a very competent cataract surgeon, but that she'd heard poor comments about his manner in recent years, including from her own mother-in-law. I concur whole-heartedly. His manner is atrocious. I don't care how competent he is, sending patients out in tears, telling old ladies brusquely to "go home" if they happen to mention they're tired, is not acceptable. 

Sometimes good people have a rough time. I understand that. But if you're going to be dealing with vulnerable patients day in, day out, treating them for problems that are distressing to them as losing one's eyesight can be, then you have an obligation to treat them with respect and decency. 

If Dr. Lord is having an existential career crisis, he should take some time off to sort himself out. 

My advice: Avoid this doctor.

Rien à dire sur ses compétences comme chirurgien. Manque de patience pour répondre à des questions légitimes après ( ou avant) une chirurgie, démontre que ça l'agace. Pour lui ça fait p-e des milliers de chirurgie qu'il fait, pour nous c'est souvent une première. Le personnel: la moitié sont souriantes.

Thinks he's the only doctor for cataracts on the face of the earth. Poor patient relations, arrogant and "know it all"..... babbles on about his competence and knowledge of having operated on hundreds of thousands of patients. Doesn't like questions ..... sure sign of insecurity! People who are as smart as he thinks he is don't boast to the degree that he does, listens to his patients and transmits a sense of respect. Waiting for 1/2 a day to see him is in his opinion worth it! The staff at the reception desk are as arrogant as he is! Not the doctor to see if you want to confer without being treated like your losing his precious time!

Peut-être connaissant mais en effet arrogant et sûrement pas le médecin a voir si vous avez des questions ou explications a vous faire donner.
Totalement insecurisant .

Le contraire du médecin attentionné, et les infirmières n'étaient pas mieux. Si vous allez administrer des goûtes médicales à ma mère, au moins lui expliquer ce que c'est et le pourquoi, et l'avertir d'avance qu'elle aura la vision brouillée pour le reste de la journée. Pour ce qui est du Dr. Lord, soit qu'il ne peut pas, soit qu'il ne veut pas expliquer les caractéristiques d'une maladie, les avantages et les désavantages des différents traitements possibles, les critères de détermination des étapes à suivre, ou toute autre information nécessaire pour qu'un patient prenne une décision éclairée quant à leur bien-être. Lui poser des questions pour comprendre la situation était comme lui arracher des dents, absolument incroyable. 

This doctor is either unable or unwilling to explain things like: progression of a disease, advantages and disadvantages of treatment, potential side effects, criteria of determination of next steps...He is also unable to answer questions without condescension and attitude. But you have to ask him questions, because he will not take the time to inform you otherwise. 

His staff was also rude, shuffling my mother from one room to another, pausing their examinations to chat with each other, and administering medicated eye drops without bothering to explain what they were and what they were for.

Je me suis fait opérée pour les cataractes et ma vision s'est tellement améliorée, je suis très satisfaite des soins obtenus par le Dr Lord. Il me suit depuis des années pour le glaucome et me conseille toujours bien. Il est très compétent et j'ai confiance en lui. Il n'est pas jasant mais j'ai des amis avec qui jaser, je lui demande d'être compétent et non d'être mon ami.
Le docteur Lord est très compétant. Et au contraire de certain, je le trouve très sympa.
absolument compétent mais il a une attitude un peu désinvolte et détachée.Un peu plus d'empathie serait apprécié.

Le Dr Lord est un très bon médecin, il m'a opéré pour les deux yeux et me suit régulièrement, je suis satisfait. C'est vrai qu'il n'est pas trop jasant et n'aime pas se faire poser trop de question, mais je le trouve quand même compétent dans son domaine. C'est au niveau des rendez-vous a l'Hopital Notre-Dame c'est très mal organiser, on donne des rendez-vous a 9 h et on vous passe a 11h c'est comme ça en Opthamologie, je ne sais pas pour les autres départements.
Une attitude de grand spécialiste :: ne pose pas de questions, n'écoute pas, explique si on lui demande mais ça l'irrite ... Techniquement parfait.
WOW!! Le seul mot qui me vient est wow. Service parfait et connaissance parfaite ce docteur est EXEMPLAIRE.
very competent tecnically but he does not seems to réalised the importance of the relation with the patient often i think of changing dr but there is not many specialist for glaucoma

Je trouve un très bon médecin, malheureusement il n'est pas jasant, et n'aiment pas trop se faire poser des questions. Beaucoup d'attente avant de le voir, fixe des rendez-vous et nous fait attendre. Il n'en demeure pas moins un bon Ophtalmologistes. J'ai une grande confiance en lui.

This doctor is one of the morst arrogant people I've met in the last while. I left his office in tears. Because of his attitude, decided to have my surgery done in the private sector. Regardless of his education and expertise, he should accept that there are other intelligent people in the world besides himself. If a patient asks a question, it is not because they are stupid. Answer their question and lose the attitude!

One of the Best eye surgeons in Montreal! Had cataract surgery and vision is 20-20. Lens was aligned perfectly according to optometrist and scar was almost totally absent because of this doctor's dexterity and capabilities and experience.
je me suis sentie comme une carte de guichet. Il n'avait vraiment pas une seconde à gaspiller avec moi. Je ne me ferai pas opérer par lui.
Est plus intéressé à faire beaucoup de clients que de soigner des patients. Je n'avais pas choisi ce médecin, on me l'avait recommandé. Je n'irai plus le voir.
Une vraie usine. Ne prend pas le temps d'expliquer. N'a pas répondu à mes questions. Je n'irai plus voir ce médecin.
Tres bon médecin, a l'écoute et attentionner,tres amical et professionnel.
This doctor is excellent. He fixed my eyes and now I can enjoy my vision again.
Ce médecin est très efficace, à l'écoute, joyeux ce qui aide à détendre ses patients en attente de chirurgie. Il m'a redonné une qualité de vision depuis longtemps perdu. 1000 fois mercis.
Excellente, très grande attention aux détails. Pas Ophtalmologiste mais bien Optométriste. Je lui confie ma vision depuis plusieurs décennies.
ELLE N"EST PAS OPHTALMOLOGISTE MAIS OPTOMÉTRISTE !!!!!!!!!! Quel moineau ici qui l'a mise médecin ????? Un peu de rigueur bordel !
Dre Bergevin prend le temps avec ses patients. Elle donne un très bon service et a une excellente connaissance de son domaine.
Très expérimentée, à l'écoute, ne laisse rien au hasard, professionnelle.
Très professionnelle et grande attention aux détails. Rendez-vous sont très bien respectés. Stationnement sur rue, certaines avec parcomètres.

Médecin froid qui se foute du patient 
ne répond pas à tes questions
il est la pour l'argent devrais prendre sa retraite.

2021 - Dr Zaharian est sûrement payer par le nombre d'Injection qu'il fait. Explique rien à ses patients, il manque souvent son coup quand il injecte dans l"oeil . Il devrait prendre sa retraie et rester chez lui ou encore rentrer dans son pays. TRÈS MAUVAIS DR.

J'ai vu plusieurs ophtalmologues avant de prendre un décision pour ma femme. Dr Zaharia a été le seul qui a répondu à ma question: Qui était le Dr. A. Franceschetti. Les québécois ne connaissent rien qui sort du Québec. et cela dans beaucoup de professions. Pauvres personnes. Bref, quand j'ai vu que Dr Zaharia pouvait me dire que le Dr A. Franceschetti était un éminent ophtalmologue et scientifique. Reconnu comme le plus grand ophtalmologue de tous les temps.
Alors j'ai pris confiance et je n'ai pas été déçus, au contraire. Même que c'est moi qui lui disait: Dr, merci pour toutes vos explications mais vous avez d'autres clients. Vous allez être en retard...Et lui de me répondre: '' Ils attendront, je suis avec vous maintenant''.
L'opération de ma femme a été un succès et je le recommande.
Alain

Very good Doctor!

I was lucky he accepted me as a patient.
Excellent à tout point de vue, le meilleur chirurgien que vous pouvez espérer.
Je suis très satusfait de don duagnostique et plan de traitement.Il m’a dit de avoir un debut de catarat mais vaux mieux attendre l’evolution.Ponctuelle et bon service.

Il est evident que M. Zaharia ne cherche qu'a faire de l'argent. Il n'a aucune consideration pour le patient. Je comprend maintenant pourquoi il est tres simple et rapide d'avoir un rendez vous avec lui comparativement a d'autre ophtalmologiste. Quelle personne desagreable.

Il diagnostique des cataractes à tout le monde, peu importe le problème, vous n’êtes pas un cas payant pour lui alors il vous jette du revers de la main, son assistante fait le gros du travail, n’essayer pas d’avoir une copie de votre dossier il va vous jeter dehors, au-dessus des lois et inattaquable en justice, allez ailleurs.
It looks like the rate 5 not much given must be by family members !
ce docteur m à fait perdre un oeil par son incompétence car il a refusé de venir me voir à l urgence pendant 18 heures même si 2 urgentologues le suppliait de venir me voir ...Dégueulasse

Médecin un peu froid mais assez compétent pour les besoins que j'en ai. La secrétaire devrait apprendre à baisser le ton. Tout le monde dans la salle est au courant des affaires de tout le monde, c'est désagréable.
opération pour catarctes de mon frère a été un fiasco pour son 2 ième œil.

le docteur zaharia est un excellent médecin et un extraordinnaire chirurgien il fait des miracles avec ses opérations notamment de la cataracte en plus il est tres aimable et chaleureux avec ses patients.

pretencieux et desagreable.a l air secret aussitot que je sors de son bureau la secretaire y cours.parle fort pour etre sur qu on le remarque bref il m est tres antiphatique.je lui deja demande de pouvoir aller voir celui de repentigny il n a pas voulu.

Ce medecin m'a diagnostiqué des cataractes. Je lui a demandé ce que je devais faire et m'a répondu qu'il n'avait rien à me conseiller de prendre rdv lorsque je serai prête pour une opération. J'ai demandé s'il pouvait me voir pour mon examen annuel et m'a dit que mon ce n'est pas payant pour lui. Je suis allée consulter un autre ophthalmologiste et m'a dit que c'était prématuré d'opérer mais lui va me revoir pour l'évolution.Donc, évitez Dr Zaharia il ne pense car l'argent, et ne considère pas son patient. A vous de juger...
Je suis très satisfait des services du docteur Zaharia, un peu froid pour les contacts mais très compétent. J-Y Gagné, sherbrooke
Gives the impression that you do not deserve an explanation or results of his examitation. Will not look at you or talk to you when he dismisses you.
Seems like for him, working with patients is more of an inconvenience than a vocation
Ce médecin est négligent, retardataire et son incompétence m'a coûté un oeil.Ses sourires n'effacent pas les conséquences désastreuses sur moi. À déconseiller!

Voici un ophtalmo hors pair. Nous sommes chanceux d'avoir un spécialiste comme lui à Sherbrooke. C'est grâce à lui si aujoud'hui je peux encore voir malgré mon diabète. Ce qui m'impression est que si vous le croisez sur la rue il n'hésitera pas à vous saluer par votre prénom. Merci de me permettre de voir.
Very abrupt, gives no explanation and no anti anxiety medication. Good doctor, operation a success but painful
LE DOCTEUR ZAHARIA EST UN EXCELLENT SPECIALISTE, TOUJOURS AIMABLE ET DE BONNE HUMEUR. PERSONNALITE TRES AGREABLE.

This wonderful Doctor operated me for the left eye cataractes on the 21st of April 2022. He is a miracle worker. Imagine he has only operated one eye and it has changed my life. Can't wait for him to do my right eye. Very nice personality. Thank you Doctor Desjardins.
Ne respecte pas les heures de rendez-vous. 3h30 d'attente sans aucune excuse de sa part.

Excellent spécialiste pour le glaucome . Il a pris le temps de faire de nombreux examens et surtout de bien m'expliquer l'évolution de mon glaucome et des traitements que je dois avoir . Je le recommande . Merci Dr Desjardins . je vous donne 5 étoiles . Gérard Mortier
J'avais un rendezvous pour 11:00 et j'ai passe a 5:00. Ne respecte jamais ses heures de rendez-vous
He is a great doctor. I felt he genuinely cared. He gave me an apt quickly when I was in pain.
Very knowledgeable doctor, treated my problem that no other doctors could

Great Dr. 

patient with my questions, generous with his time.
I was there Aug 2020 . Dr. Ganz and the staff are all very professional, competent and offer. Every precaution for COVID was taken. I won't go anywhere else !

dr corriveau treated my melanoma eye cancer 4 years ago...she is the so caring and one of the best specialists i have ever met...her whole team at notre dame chum are the greatest..thanks to her i am doing well and still have my eye!!!
She treated my retina melanoma over 10 years ago. I remember her as very caring. One of the best doctors I have encountered. Her and her staff treated me very well.
Odieux et incompétent. J'ai dû aller au privé pour sauver mon oeil.

Quel médecin sympathique, professionnel, rassurant, intéressant et intéressé. Plusieurs professionnels de la santé auraient intérêt à prendre exemple sur son humanisme et son écoute. Je le recommande sincèrement.

Le commentaire précédent me surprend énormément, j’ai eu une expérience diamétralement opposée à ce qui y est exprimé, je me sens le besoin de remettre les pendules à l’heure. Je consulte Dr Lasnier depuis près de quatre ans, il m’a été référé par des proches qui n’avaient que d’éloges à son égard. J’ai obtenu une consultation avec lui à Shawinigan et je n’ai pu que constater son grand respect du patient, sa gentillesse et son efficacité. Son diagnostique et les soins exceptionnels qui m’ont été prodigués m’ont permis de retrouver une vision (et une qualité de vie) que je n’espérais même plus! Les délais pour avoir un rendez-vous sont plus que raisonnables et l’attente est moindre que tout ce que j’ai connu ailleurs en province en ophtalmologie. Merci Dr Lasnier de faire LA différence dans ma vie, vous êtes un médecin d’exception, rigoureux, qui a le souci du bien-être de son prochain.
Très à l'écoute de ses patients, super professionnel, délicat et attentif aux besoins et craintes des gens.
En plus d'être adorable et à l'écoute, il est plus compétent que beaucoup de médecins avec 20 ans d'expérience de plus. Comptons-nous chanceux d'avoir un tel professionnel en région.

He is not rude just gives off the impression sometimes that he doesn’t like to be there. Sometimes he was helpful and super enthusiastic to explain to me my test results and other times short and in a hurry to get me out
Seems to be in a hurry to get rid of the patient. Does not like to be asked questions.

He wasn't rude to me like some others said, it's more like he just doesn't want to be there. Seems to be knowledgeable but very short with his explanations and it's like pulling teeth trying to get information and questions answered.
He couldnt explain my problem or maybe he didn't feel like explaining what was wrong. Total waste of my time.

My father is a patient of this doc for 5 years. Last time we saw him we were waiting at the reception for over 30 minutes, we were first in line but we were ignore by staff. they were talking about their weekend and the other secretary was doing a "favor" for another patient calling from her work phone to patient son so he can pick her up. There are public phone available right 5 meters from reception, but it seems more important for them to answer questions about where is restaurant etc. of other people, calling on their behalf. They were rude to me and my dad and start to yell at us when I mentioned that I am standing for over 30 minutes and patiently wait . No professionalism in staff. Now about this doc, he is grumpy, not friendly, acts like he is not liking what his is doing. We were waiting another time for him for 3 hours and 40 minutes to find out that he is going home as he finished his work. I run after him and said that we were still waiting for him he was very rude he said that we were late, I said no, we are waiting for 3 hours and 40 minutes . He reply that he doesn't believe me!! Nobody ever unsalted me like that! I insist he check with his secretary and we found out that my dad's file is still at reception on the middle of the table! No apology from Rosen or his staff, instead he was angry and rude during 1 minute examination of my father, complaining that he has some kind of important appointment and now he is late. I remind his that we waited for almost 4 hours for him and he said it is ok some people wait even longer. He refer my dad to a neurologist and walked out of room without saying goodbye. I hope he will be treated with the same disrespect by his doctors. Avoid if possible!
I have seen him since 1976 an d had three operation procedure done by him . thank you Doc

I read all the negative comments - I disagree with them. He is very professional, his people skill is not great, but polite all the time. His answers are short to provide you pointers to search for it on med websites for details. I feel confident to be his patient.

Dr.Rosen has been my doctor and surgeon for the last 10 years and he is always on time and does not beat around the bush. Prepare your questions and he will answer them. Very efficient and effective. Great to see helping other younger docs.

I'm quite surprised reading all these negative reviews because I have a very different impression. Dr. Rosen was friendly, attentive and answered all my questions. I find his bedside manner perfect. He prescribed two tests just to make sure there's no glaucoma even though he doubted there was. My overall experience was positive.

This doctor should be avoided. He took me in 1 hour late ( after my scheduled appointment), never apologized or acknowledged it. He's rude, abrupt, and just wants you to get out of his office as fast as possible. Does not take time to answer questions and makes you feels like you're imposing on him just by being in his office. Overall a terrible doctor to be avoided.

Very, very unpleasant experience. He gave me the impression that he doesn't care about his patients. I’ve met car mechanics who showed more compassion. 

Do yourself a favor and go see somebody else (somewhere else too - 30 dollars to open a file at this clinic).

My personal experience shows that the other reviews are accurate. This doctor is old, which in itself could be an asset, but he's unfortunately also out of touch. He told me himself that his knowledge of my issue dates back a long time, and he didn't keep track of any possible advances in medicine since his schooling. 

His hands and head are shaky due to old age, so I would definitely not trust him with a scalpel. He's dismissive and unfriendly, more traits of a grumpy old man. I'm sure he was an accomplished ophthalmologist in his prime, but sadly he should have retired many years ago, before he became this indifferent to his patients.

I dealt with 2 secretaries, one was super friendly and smiley, the other was bitter and angry. This clinic ended up referring me to a neurologist, who is also rated extremely badly, with several formal complaints against her. I would suggest avoiding Dr. Rosen, as well as Lakeshore Ophthalmology altogether, there are much better options out there.
a hateful doctor who used me as a teaching experiment of what not to do to his own chosen people

Citron a éviter.Désagréable médecin blasé. Il a annoncé a ma femme qu'elle deviendrait aveugle en mentionnant qu'il n'y aurait pas de suivi et que c'était irréversible.Aucune ampathie et aucune suggestion pour le futur. Clic Clic la carte d'assurance maladie et basta!

Bad experience altogether, this doctor has this short and sweet style and does not answer complicated questions, you really have to push him. I was prepared to ask complicated questions and his customer approach was lazy and old school, he is not unpleasant per se but choosing him is not the right option. I was diagnosed with acute keratitis and had cornea ulcers. He misdiagnosed me once saying that the wound in the left eye was healed, another doctor said it was not a few months after. He did not mention hard contact lenses as the best option for me, despite my multiple questions. He has this lazy, part time like style about himself, his secretary is unpleasant too. I was assigned to him after my illness started and very little was done to help me, finally after he dealt with me for five months, he referred me to another doctor, someone that suggested hard contact lenses right away.
What a wonderful doctor and friendly staff. I had a cataract removed and was very well taken care of.

Great doctor. On the quiet side, but has my full confidence. The front desk staff at the hospital opthalmology clinic however, is another story. One in particular. Never a good morning or smile. Very bad impression every one of the dozen or so times I've been there.
He has looked after my eyes for years - did cataract surgery on both. Recently did laser on W both. Always very pleasant and polite, thorough. Was head of department for many years.

Absolutely horrible !! He has no maners and no patience. Both him and some of his staff. Rude. disrepectful and demeaning. And does not explain the results. of test done to you. He pushes for surgery even when not really needed. I think its about the money.

Tout simplement un médecin extraordinaire. Très à l'écoute de ses patients. Lorsqu'il s'occupe de votre cas, il prend en considération votre historique familial et porte une attention un peu plus importante si nécessaire. Je le recommande fortement.
Docteur Kasner: compétence inégalée, à l'écoute, bon pédagogue, il me suit depuis 4 ans, ai eu une chirurgie au laser de lui; tout a été parfait ! Une soie! Danielle

Dr. KASNER IS PUNCTUAL, KIND AND UNDERSTANDING. MOST OF ALL HE TAKES THE TIME TO LISTEN AND PROVIDE EXCELLENT ANSWERS THAT ARE UNDERSTANDABLE. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND HIM AND I HAVE BEEN TO OTHER DOCTORS. ALSO, HE ASKS QUESTIONS ABOUT THE WHOLE HEALTH OF THE INDIVIDUAL NOT JUST ISOLATING THE EYES AS A SEPERATE PROBLEM TO A PERSON'S HEALTH.
depuis janvier 2000 avec lui profession aucuns problemes

Un ophtalmologiste et chirurgien compétent dans son domaine, humble et souriant. Très patient et serviable envers tous surtout avec les personnes âgées. Il y a une liste d’attente pour avoir un rendez-vous, sauf que s’il y a une urgence, la secrétaire avec l’accord du spécialiste s’en occupe et en donne un dans les plus bref délais. Cela fait 20 ans que nous en sommes des patients et toujours satisfaits. Il est franc et honnête. Je le recommande à tous.
Excellent doctor very knowledgeable and very helpful
pas gentil, travaille avec les personnes agés mais aucune patience pour eux...a éviter!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Dr. Q. Nguyen is exceptional, incredibly competent, and a kind doctor. She takes the time to answer the necessary questions you have. The environment during the surgery is excellent which gives you comfort and confidence. I want to thank Dr Nguyen and her entire staff for making my dream a reality. I highly recommend Dr. Nguyen for anyone seeking excellent results and professionalism. Procedure: Inferior and superior Blepharoplasty + CO2 periocular laser

Worse doctor I have ever seen in my life! She treated me so coldly and harshly while doing 

my eyelid biopsy. She finished the biopsy and just left the room without giving me any information. She had no empathy what so ever.

Had a consultation with her and was beyond unimpressed. Took no time to explain treatments, side effects, nothing! Barely brushed over a diagnostic. As others have said, she only gives short, one-worded answers and makes you feel like she's doing you a favor just by seeing you. I do not doubt that she is qualified in her field but I did not feel reassured or confident at all in receiving treatment from her. Immediately looked elsewhere following consultation

Extremely unimpressed with this doctor. Would not even explain the prognosis properly and simply said that the condition needs to be corrected by surgery. Way to instill a sense of trust in your patients when you don't even take the times to do the most fundamental things properly.

Terrible experience, a real butcher! I never experienced so much pain! And she didn't care. It took me weeks to recover... and guess what? I had to redo the operation somewhere else because she failed miserably.

J’ai eu une blepharoplastie des paupières supérieures par le Dr Quyn Nguyen que j’ai beaucoup apprécié :elle est très professionnelle , prend le temps d’expliquer et de répondre aux questions , très délicate et très aimable. Je la recommande fortement et si besoin c’est certain que je retournerai la consulter.

She is really good but honestly it’s beyond rude to keep your patients waiting so long. Her secretary at the hospital even said ‘don’t come early, there is no point.’ We waited almost 2 hours for 5 minute procedure. Not the first time either. I guess she believes her time is more valuable than her patient’s. Too bad because she is great.
rude and not helpfull.not able to explain properly the disease and the treatment.

Terrible bedside manner, doesn't time to explain anything or give anything other than curt one-word answers. She was close to 2 hours late for my surgery, and was the antithesis of warm or reassuring. She may be competent, but her personality makes for an unpleasant experience.

Je suis suivie depuis quelques années par le Dr Quynh Nguyen, elle est formidable, efficace et compétente! Tres gentille, polie et professionnelle! Je suis grandement surprises par les commentaires négatifs!!!! Je la recommande fortement!

After reading these comments I was terrified to go through with the procedure and I do agree she haas no bedside manner. I never saw her face till the end of the surgery passing her in the hallway. She was quick and the procedure was painless. My questions were answered by her nurse and I was given a prescription without instruction. All in all I am pleased with this doctor. She has no time for small talk but gets the job done. I needed a doctor not someone to talk to...I would recommend this ophthalmologist based on her qualifications and experience not her social skills. Christine

Pire médecin jamais rencontré ! Très bête et aussi chaleureuse qu'un bloc de glace. Aucun sourire et grand manque de respect vis à vis ses patients. Je vous la déconseille. Elle devrait travailler dans l'armée.
Dr. Quynh Nguyen is a masterful doctor. Very informative, excellent advice and very nice!
Tout était mauvais, le service, l'attente, mais surtout Dr. Nguyen, la main dure, militaire presque. Beaucoup de douleur après l'intervention, jamais je ne retournerais. Je déconseille fortement.

Pire ophthamologiste que j'ai vu. Aucune salutation, manque de respect total pour le patient. Elle critique sans demander se qui c'est passé avec mon oeil. Elle prescrit de la crème inefficace pour mon problème d'oeil. J'ai dû consulter un autre ophthalmologiste.

I had the exact same experience as the previous comment. I went for a chalazion (operation of the eye-lid). She was courteous before the surgery, but upon starting, I felt that she was much in hurry, she injected the local anesthesia extremely fast, it hurt like I could not describe, my eye was tearing a lot, she didn't not even notice! I have to say that I had this exact same surgery many times in the past, many, and never felt so much pain, never! Then she finished the surgery extremely fast, and that was it. When I took out the bandage that day, my eye was so swollen and bloody... it was truly scary (remember that I had this exact same surgery more than 6 or 7 times in the past, and this never happened... and twice the chalazion was bigger than this time). I could hardly see so swollen it was. Normally it takes 3 to 7 days for the swelling to go, but this time not even in weeks, and the worst is that I fear now that she did not clean the inside well enough, being too much in a hurry (I saw her schedule, she had one patient every 15 minutes, that's short for a surgery I think). The problem now is that weeks have passed after the surgery, I've been using the eye-drops she prescribed, but the lump the eye-lid she operated is still there, something that I never ever experienced in the past with other surgeons. I will never go back. I had the impression that she didn't care at all, in fact, the impression that she was heartless.

I had an appointment to remove a chalazion with Dr. Nguyen. She was curt and to-the-point for my consultation, but she turned into a demon upon the day of my surgery. She was forty-five minutes late for the appointment, and once I was on the table she snarled and hissed at me constantly. Upon cutting open my skin, she barked, "Are you crying?!" My eye was indeed tearing because of the intense light shining into it. I snapped back, "I don't know! Maybe it's blood?" After an hour of the worst bedside manner I've ever encountered, I resolved to change my opthamologist immediately and never see her again. Her competence as a doctor is acceptable, but her qualities as a person appear to be sorely lacking.

Dr Dre Quynh Nguyen operated both of my eyes, my vision got weaker with age, 76 year old. Results: 20/20 clear vision without my gradual focus glasses. super She is the best ophthalmologist I could ever get.

Worse doctor I ever met. She does not even look at her patient as she speaks to them - she was turning her back to my mother as she was speaking to her. No respect. No empathy - she just told her she would never recuperate her eyesight further to her CVA (stroke) - well guess what my mother can read again!!! I tell you: the worse doctor I ever met.
Very nice personality. Golden hands. Superb!!
Dr. Nguyen is very willing to explain things, is very competent, and very cordial.

I was 15 when she diagnozed me with glaucoma. I kept seeing her but dreaded every appointment with her. She was condescending and never believed me when I said that I take my drops. Was so driven by proving me wrong that she wasted a brand new bottle of drops to experiment and show how I haven't been putting them (Which was wrong) but I didn't argue at the time. What I didn't appreciate by that, is the fact that so many people in this world really need that bottle and potentially might be going blind. she did that for ego satisfaction. Ever since then I see another wonderful doctor but Quevillon follows my thoughts untill today... she was scary... not recommended unless you are a 70 year old woman and above. Then she'll be nice.

L'enfer pour rejoindre son adjointe. On dit que le bureau ouvre à 9 h30. J'ai appeleé à 9 h31 et je vous jure, il est maintenant 1h58 et je n'ai toujours pas réussi à lui parler.... c'est inconcevable qu'en 2013, une telle facon de traiter les patients. Aucun patient qui saigne.... pourtant parler à quelqu'un semble quelque chose d'impossible. Obama est sûrement plus accessible.

Elle me voit depuis plusieurs années. Elle m'apparait sérieuse dans sa pratique et semble très compétente. Cependant, attendez vous à devoir attendre 1 heure et +++ à votre rendez-vous car il y a toujours 4 ou 5 patients déjà en attente. Apportez vous un bon livre, sinon vous allez trouver le temps long!

Je l'ai eu pendant un an et j'ai changé, elle était très condescendante et me lançait chaque fois un commentaire ****e sur les hommes. Elle ne me croyait pas quand je lui disais que je mettais mes gouttes dans les yeux chaque jour. Je ne la recommande pas!

effectivement depuis la nouvelle secretaire c est l enfer c est ma deuxieme année que je recois un coup de fil derniere minute pour annuler rv et on ne me donne pa d autre rv malgre que je dois avoir un suivi pour glucaume je suis découragée et je n ai plus de prescription et évidamment impossible de parler à la secretaire!!! toujours une boite vocale et aucun retour!!!

J'avais un rendez-vous qui fut annulé la veille. La secrétaire m'a remis à un an. Elle devait tout faire pour me fixer un rendez-vous plus tôt, ce qu'elle n'a jamais fait. Difficile à rejoindre et très peu aimable.
Listens very carefully. Inspires confidence. Intense, but no feeling of being rushed.
Il faut prendre un rendez-vous un an à l'avance. C'est la croix et la bannière pour rejoindre sa secrétaire. Semble très compétente mais une loterie pour avoir un rendez-vous.

Dr. Quevillon est une ophtalmologiste qui sait ce qu'elle fait, en ce moment le problème est que sa nouvelle secrétaire met le répondeur toute la journée et répond aux appels seulement le soir après 7 P.M. ce qui n'est vraiment pas normal. Depuis que l'autre secrétaire est partie, je trouve que le service est bien moins bon de ce ce coté. c'est domage, car Dr. Quevillon risque de perde des patients.

Je ne comprends vraiment pas l'histoire d'attente! Je n'ai jamais vécu d'attente déraisonnable avec Dr. Quévillon. Elle me suit depuis 14 ans pour prévention de glaucôme et je vous assure que je la recommanderais à tous. C'est une femme conciencieuse positive et toujours de bonne humeur... Longue vie à cette professionnelle de la santé!

Charges $20.00 for eyes drops for the tests. Be ready to wait a minimum of 2.5 hours to see her. She is ALWAYS late and always in a rush. I've been a patient of her for years only beacause she has my mothers file and she follows me for hereditary diseases. Lately my mother has been having a lot of problems with her eyes and Dr. Quevillion doesn't seem to be helping her.
Très compétente, cherche vraiment à t'aider, mais attente très, très longue avant de la voir.
Très conciencieuse mais TRES hautaine et sans aucune empathie. TRES longue attente: environ 2:30 hres. Ceci est un manque de respect évident de sa part à l'égard de ses patients.
Attente très longue avant de la rencontrer, mais elle vaut la peine, très compétente et cherche vraiment à t'aider.

I have been seeing Dr. Brunette with a serious eye problem for several years now. I find she is the best eye doctor/person one could possibly be lucky enough to be referred to.

My sight has been restored from almost zero to good sight because of her expertise. She is extremely busy but gives you her full attention when we meet. I always look forward to SEEING her.

I will never, never see this woman again. I have never seen someone so unprofessional in my life. She was rude to my husband, she slapped my leg away when i had my legs crossed in the exam chair. She was rushing through everything and every question i asked, she answered as if i were an idiot. My eye dr mentioned about possible glaucoma in my future and told me to ask the dr at the hospital (brunette) about it. When I asked her she said (don't quote me ) "you dont have it, don't bother with that and you don't want to come here (hospital) to treat it, you'll never leave! Not this place!" She acted as if she was too good to be there. I will never forget it and it has changed the way i look at specialists. I wish that I had filed a complaint at the time.
She was rude, disrespectful told my husband to keep quiet and when I asked her about me needing catarac surgery, she not this (maissoneuve-rosemont hospital) you ll never get out of here alive!
À part une seule fois ou l'attente a été d'une heures, aux autres visites, j'ai dû attendre 4 heures, 4 heures 30 5 heures, 5 heures 30. À mon avis, elle est bonne chirurgienne.

Elle n'est pas à l'heure, mais on s'en fou parce qu'elle prend tout le temps nécessaire lorsqu'on est avec elle pour s'assurer que l'on comprend bien, qu'on est à l'aise, etc. Ca vaut tout l'attente du monde. Excellente médecin.
her staff is the best!! the girls are always smiling and happy. she can be late a lot but she takes the time when she sees you
Il est tout simplement excellent ; j'ai été opérée hier, toute l'équipe étaient consciencieuses, a l'écoute, docteur Brian m'expliquait chaque actes qu'il faisait.

Dr. Arthurs was recommended to me by several friends and a couple of neighbours. He is extremely knowledgeable and effective. Also important: I was nervous about my situation and he was patient and caring. I would recommend this doctor as my first choice for any eye (vision or plastic surgery) issue.

I have had at least four eye issues (three were a recurring condition, and one was isolated injury - a piece of metal lodged in my eye). Dr. Arthurs was outstanding every time. He consistently went out of his way to ensure that I had the very best treatment. This surgeon is second to none, in my view. Kind, caring, friendly, and extremely knowledgeable. Thank you Dr. Arthurs!

I had intermittent swollen and red under-eye and eyelids after trying a home-remedy for removing a skin-tag. I waited 2 months to see him, and one day the tag fell off, but still had the redness from time to time, so I kept the appointment. He had 2 students with him, and was upset that he wasn't going to show them how to remove a skin-tag. He was dismissive, rude and sarcastic, telling me I could now write a book on home-remedies. When I asked about what ointment I could use for the problem he said, I have no idea, ask your pharmacist. Then he told me his sister-in-law used sunscreen, when I mentioned it's not supposed to get in your eyes, he said I have no idea. Then he began to pluck at my under-eye skin telling the students what methods he would use for plastic surgery in my case. Very bad example to show students how to treat their patients, and wasted my time as I now have to find another Ophthalmologist to treat my inflammation. My MD referred him because he said he is very skillfull with surgical procedures, but he's obviously arrogant and disrespectful.

This doctor dosen't know what he is doing, having a poor quality trainee who is doing the job instead of him, no secretary, he lose the analysis reports and doesn't have time to see patient. I don't recommend that doctor to any one.

Pas très professionnel. 

Ce Dr m'a oubliée pour un rendez-vous pour une opération cataracte glaucome en 2023. En avril 2024, il m'a référé à la mauvaise personne me disant que cet ophtalmologue de la clinique Precivision était reconnu et très bon pour faire glaucome et cataracte en une seule opération.

* lors de mon rendez-vous le Dr m'a dit qu'il ne pratique pas les opérations glaucome et cataracte 

* que d'est le docteur Luong Nguyen et son bureau qui auraient dû se charger de prendre mon rendez-vous et qu'il aurait su qu'il ne pratiquait pas ce genre d'opération

* qu'en plus le docteur Luong Nguyen n'avait même pas indiqué son nom sur le document de référence.

Opération pour des cataractes

 Payé $3,000 pour des lentilles qui devaient me donner une vision sans lunette. 

 Arnaque !!!!!! 

 Besoin de lunettes plus forte qu'avant mon Opération. J'aurais du prendre les lentilles de base que la RAMQ paye.qui m'auraient rien coûtés
Il était d’une humeur épouvantable lors de ma visite le 9 août 2023. Il m’a dit pas de prochain rv, il n’y a plus rien à faire.

Charges to measure eye for cataract surgery 865$ for 1 eye and 975$ for both eyes not including the lens. Most other doctors are charging 200$ for both eyes. Not to mention he tells you to bring a cheque no credit card. Very ubrupt and rude.

Retard de 40 min et consultation sans exagerer 50 secondes 😂😂😂😂😂😂😂 aucune explication sur la chirurgie voir rien ….vous saviez j’ai mm pas eu le temps de m’assoir que je suis deja devant la porte plur sortir ahahahahha du jamais vue 😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂😂

Cet homme n'est pas un ophtalmologiste mais un ''businessman'' de la pire espèce, à éviter à tous prix. Référé par l'optométriste Rabih Ata, un chic type très compétent, ce qui rend la référence encore plus surprenante, dans le mauvais sends du terme

Je l'ai vu a la clinique a longueuil. Grand manque de professionnalisme, 1h30 de retard, regarde mes yeux rapidement et me dit que tout est beau. J'y allais pour des flash et risque de décollement de la rétine, il a manquer un diagnostic de retinoschisis vu par mon optometriste et confirmé par un autre ophtalmologue par après. Son staff m'a par la suite appeler pour me dire qu'il était impossible pour eux de donner son rapport à mon optometriste car il ne l'a connaissait pas (mon opto est dans une clinique très connue et pratique depuis plusieurs années). Il montrait aucune empathie et l'examen était rapide, sommaire et sans explications.
Not happy with the service and feel as though I’m just a Ginny pig . Will never go there

Absolument rien à dire d'autre que ce médecin est excellent, peut -être pas le plus parlant mais très efficace. Opération pour des cataractes aux deux yeux, finie en 30 min. Pas de complication donc je suis extrèmement satisfait de son travail

Dr. Nguyen needs to learn the meaning of respect. Respect that our time is as important as his. The staff in the front never have a smile and are not interested in the patients'. They are just stoned face and not at all helpful.

Très mauvaise expérience. On surbooke les patients, le staff est débordé donc aucune façon , quant au médecin , aucune façon, examine à peine, ne dis rien et si on pose des questions on a l’air de le déranger profondément .Très mauvaise expérience , cherchez ailleurs pour voir un ophtalmo !!

Very rude man. Had an appointment at 8, finally get to see him quarter to ten. Calls me into the office, and doesn’t say a single thing to me. I greet him with not so much as grunt as an answer. Then his CELL rings, and he answers LEAVING FOR ANOTHER 10 MINS!!!

THIS IS MY FIRST TIME SEEING THIS MAN AND I DONT EVEN KNOW WHO HE IS

He does the tests, and I repeated that I was IN PAIN, even with the numbing drops. FINALLY he finishes, writes something on a paper and says see you in a month. Being a nice person, I say goodbye and he SCOFFS. HE AND HIS RECEPTION STAFF ARE THE MOST INCOMPETENT group of ‘professionals’ I’ve ever met since living in QUEBEC. If you have any say, DONT COME HERE. I wasted my money and missed work all for this garbage.
He doesn't care about his patient. Very bad attitude.
He is very professional. I am very pleased with the results

Très , très déçue par le Dr. Luong Nguyen. Se comporte de manière rude, il est brusque et impatient. Lorsque je lui pose des questions concernant le diagnostic il me répond de façon agressive et il me donne l'impression que je dérange. Il m'annonce de façon brusque que je fais du glaucome, que j'aurais besoin de gouttes pour traiter le glaucome et que les gouttes ont beaucoup d'effets secondaires dont des brûlements intenses dans les yeux. Je lui demande si je peux attendre trois mois avant de commencer les gouttes car dans une semaine je pars à l'étranger pour trois mois donc je ne pourrais pas avoir de suivi pour les gouttes là-bas. Il me répond que je négocie, que je peux partir mais que je vais revenir aveugle et il me dit aussi que si j'avais su que je partais j'aurais dû prendre rendez vous plus tôt. Pourtant j'ai respecté la date du rendez vous qu'il m'avait donné et de plus je ne pouvais pas me douter qu'il va m'annoncer ce diagnostic aussi soudainement. Difficile de croire qu'un médecin peut être à ce point inhumain, impoli et qu'il manque à ce point de considération pour ses patients. Méfiez vous de lui comme de la peste.

VERY HELPFUL AND KNOWLEDGEABLE.STAFF ALL WELCOMING.NEVER BEEN DECEIVED WITH THE SERVICE.
HNG

I would never recommend Dr. Luong Nguyen to anyone, he is an ignorant piece of sh*t who does not care about his patients. The moment you walk into his office you are left with an overwhelming unwelcome feeling. For those who claim he has has humor and smiles is completely false, he is completely the opposite. After he finishes examining your eyes he sits at his desk not saying a word about the examination leaving you with questions on your mind. If you ask him if everything is okay with your eyes he responds rudely with an offensive remark. His staff members are just as bad, they are loud, obnoxious, rude and ignorant towards patients, secondly they are extremely unprofessional with no knowledge of what they are doing whatsoever. The prices are ridiculously high and when you ask the staff why they give an unprofessional ridiculous explanation that is too good to be true. Please do yourself a favor and the safety of your eyesight, do not let this man touch your eyes. There are many experienced professionals ophthalmologist's out there, just make sure you do your searching carefully and ask lots of questions. Be safe, your vision is very important.
Très bon ophtalmologiste avec beaucoup d’expériences. Possède un excellent sens de l’humour. Il a des machines à la fine pointe de la technologie je me sens gatée

Staff correct, mais le médecin incapable de expliquer et d'écouter un patient. Il n' a pas de patience pour bien expliquer le patient, on attend plus d'une 1 hr pour qu'il nous donne moins de 3 min pour nous examiner et expliquer. Le patient pour lui est un montant d'argent.
The wait was so long to see him that after a 2 hour wait, I just left. He is notorious for overbooking and keeping patients in their 90s waiting.
Pas parlable ... et rushé. N'explique rien; si vous n'êtes pas content, c'est peut-être q

Très surpris de voir que des commentaires négatifs à propos de ce médecin. Somme toute, plus d'une fois sur 2, c'est ceux qui se plaignent qui viennent sur cette page. c'est mon opthalmo depuis des années. Très humain et comique tout le monde dans la salle d'attente (il voit 50 patients par jour des fois) l'adore! Je vous le recommande fortement. Seul inconvénient c'est le temps d'attente par fois (j'ai attendu 2h la dernière vois, mais chez le médecin c'est compréhensible).

j avais rendez vous a 13h et j ai passé a 17h de plus il a opéré la même journée on est sortie de la clinique a 19 h inconcevable de plus les frais ne sont pas couvert par la ramq et la fille qui lui avait fait l examen c était trompé d oeil une chance que le médecin a posé des questions car il aurait opéré le mauvais oeil de plus il lui restait qu un oeil de bon donc si l erreur avait pas été corrigé il aurait été aveugle la technicienne a pas trouvé cela si grave de se tromper d oeil
This doc. always pushes for costly tests that are not covered by the RAMQ.

Mon pere s’est fait operer par ce charlatant!!! Il s’est retrouver avec les deux yeux en hémorragie avec tellement de douleur..... le medecin a l’urgence n’en revenait pas de voir ses yeux..... maintenant sa vue baisse a cause de l’operatiin et il n’y a rien a faire..... n’allez pas voir se medicin

Excellent chirurgien. Je viens de me faire opérer pour des lentilles intra occulaire ( pour cataractes). J'avais très peur à cause des critiques négatives sur le web concernant le personnel ou l'attitude de ce médecin. Sincèrement, je vous le recommande. Personnel nouveau :accueillant, rassurant et très flexible, nouveau lieu pour la pratique de sa chirurgie à Brossard: impeccable, et prix raisonnable - en tenant compte que c'est tout de même au privé. Le médecin est patient, répond à toutes nos questions sans détour, très minutieux et pour vous convaincre, les infirmières pendant la préparation de mon opération m'ont chuchoté à l'oreille, qu'il était la cadillac des chirurgiens! Bref, je le conseille à tous ceux et celles qui se cherchent un bon chirurgien et qui sont angoissés comme je l'étais!
My Mother in Law of 88 year Old waited 3 hours tout get her eye operated. UNACCEPTABLE
Ce docteur n'a aucune compétence relationnelle. Incapable de parler et d'écouter un patient. De plus, si on le confronte il rit de vous.

Staff okay, attente normale vis-à-vis les standards du système de santé, coûts légèrement dispendieux, mais je m'y attendais. Tse quand ton oeil est atteint pi tu veux juste que le doc te rassure, ca vaut pas de prix. le DR Nguyen est très sympathique et comique et il connait bien ses affaires. Le rendez-vous n'a duré que 8 minutes, mais je me sens rassuré. Vous êtes entre de bonnes mains je vous l'assure ! côté service clientèle laisse à désirer chez son staff par contre..
Mauvais service... Je ne sais pas s'il est connaissant mais côté relation humaine il vaut rien.

very little information is provided. The cost was unexpected. 80$ first visit plus 300?+ for a variety of tests. Then 600$ for lenses (a choice bc one can use thee gvt provided lenses at no cost) 2 additional post op visits @ 20,00 each for drops and no mention of further follow-up

My optometrist referred me to Dr. Luong about 4 years ago and he had all the tests that were done my the optometrist done over by the optometrist he works with in the BUI Clinic. I told my optometrist later and she was surprised as I am elderly and all this was on Medicare. If you are referring people to Dr. Luong you would expect him to trust your testing.

In 2016 I was again referred to Dr. Luong by my same Optometrist because she saw cataract formation. Instead, Dr. Luong decided that I had dry eyes and did a whole lot of repetitive tests that were already done at my Optometrist and put me on very expensive eye drops. One bottle was $50 a month and the Restasis was $120 a month as it is not covered by RAMQ after 3 months. My Optometrist never mentioned I had dry eyes and I have never had the symptoms of dry eyes. When I asked him what made him think I had dry eyes, he asked, well what are the symptoms you have. I said halos around lights and he said that was it. I did what he told me for 3 months and the halos didn't disappear ..... but I did from Dr. Luong.

Personnel travaillant et connaissant leur domaine, secrétaires qui font de leur possible avec bonne humeur malgré les patients difficile, Dr souriant et enjoué, temps d'attente un peu long mais temps de qualité avec l'équipe et le médecin.

Staff qui laisse a desiré. Pas delicat, pas de sourire. Bete

Une chance que de nguyen a un bon sens de lhumour car je nirais pas pour son personnel ou sa technicienne

J'ai accompagné ma mère pour ce RV sur Monk. Malgré l'heure précise donnée, nous avons attendu 1h. Lorsque nous avons demandé aux réceptionnistes combien de patients avant nous, nous avons été répondu comme si nous étions du bétail. Ma mère, allophone, s'est faite répondre sur un ton particulièrement condescendant "d'aller se rasseoir". Les deux réceptionnistes rondelettes, une à la peau foncée et l'autre aux allures italiennes (dans le but qu'elles se reconnaissent, c'est important!) ont continué à s'adresser à ma mère à l'impératif bien fort pour que la salle d'attente au complet entende "assis, la chaise là!" "hé!" "par la!". Bref, manque de courtoisie, de discrétion et de classe. Complètement outrageux, choisissez un autre médecin ou une autre salle d'attente.
Real professional referd by my surgeon and his wife who is a nurse in the operation team

dr nguyen change de secretaire sans arret, aucune stabilitée. assistante très brusque. dr ne parle pas, ne se retourne pas. les prix sont incroyablement trop cher. il na référé a un autre specialiste parce quil ne savait pas ce que javais. beaucoup trop de retard a sa clinique.

Tres mauvais staff. Son assistante a la peau crevassé est bete et pas delicate. Elle parle fort pour rien et brusque.dr pas professionnel ne sesoucis pas de nous et ne parle pas. Il charge des prix de fou. Longue attente pour rien. Clinique sale et personnel non professionnel

Dr nguyen is one of those dr that make you feel better after you see him.sure there is always a time to way but with all the technologie that he use any desease can pass unnoticed now he is moving to a very big oficce very nice.you should visit it.

très mauvais opthalmo. pas de bonne humeur, il ne sest jamais retourné lorsque je lui parlais. il a ensuite insisté pour me faire un examen à 80$.il était très bête. la clinique était pleine à craqué. il allait sur mon ordinateur pendant que jétais assis sur la chaise. aucun sens professionnel, aucune écoute. il a observé mes yeux et ne ma même pas dit ce que javais. il a remplit une prescrition sans explication !!!! lendroit est sale, sa salle est petite et poussièreuse. a éviter totalement !!!

I went to see him for a chalazion. For those who don't know what that is, a chalazion is a type of cyst on the eyelid, which can only be resolved surgically. First they charged me $10 "for eye drops" at the front desk. I was told that if I didn't pay the $10 the doctor wouldn't see me. So I paid the $10 and went in. When the doctor saw me, without a word he tried to put some eyedrops in my eyes. No explanations regarding the purpose of the drops. I asked for explanations and he explained that it's an anesthetic and that he will check my eye pressure. I told him that I didn't need that, and that I was there for something else. He looked at my eye for a second and gave me a prescription for topical antibiotics. He then took $10 out of his pocket and gave it to me. I told him that I wanted the chalazion removed and he told me that he has to refer me to another ophtalmologist for that. I strongly recommend, avoid him. By the way, I am a doctor myself.

J'avais vu un autre ophtamologiste avant lui dont je n'avais pas apprécié les manières et l'expédition avec laquelle il voit ses patients. (Longueuil) M. Nguyen s'est avéré compréhensif et délicat. Je lui ai fait part de mon appréhension vis à vis tout ce qui touche à mes yeux. Il a pris son temps et a fait divergé mon attention en me parlant de tout autre chose tout en me rassurant. En tant que patient, nous avons toujours la prérogative d'aller voir un 2e médecin. C'est ce que j'ai fait et ne le regrette pas. C'est mon optométriste qui m'a référé à lui.
competent mais trop occupe aucune explication sur notre maladie car il est trop presse
tres competent tres rassurant meme durant l`operation il te met en confiance. Tout a tres bien fonctionné je le recommande fortement

excellent ophtalmologiste, très compétent avec une humour rare...chirurgien exceptionnel mais trop populaire et débordé par ses urgences qu'il ne refuse jamais. Truc: les optométristes d'à côté sont excellentes, il est dans toute avantage de consulter ces deux services pour avoir un soin plus complet ou plus d'explications.
Very unprofessional.He consulted me really fast, didn't allow me to talk much. In a hurry , I don't know why.He doesn't respect his patient though.AVOID>

He doesn't care about his patient. Very bad attitude. Don't give you enough time to talk. N'a pas beaucoup de connaissance en la matiere. C'est vrai qu'il essaie de vendre les lunettes a l'optometrist qui travaille avec lui.

Se fout des gens. Toujours pressé et peu à l'écoute. M'a insulté et demandé pourquoi j'étais allée ailleurs pour l'examen visuel alors que ce n'était en rien relié à mon problème médical. Il veut juste faire vendre des lunettes à l'optométriste qui travaille avec lui.

Très bon médecin, connait super bien sa matière. Comme tout spécialiste, il y des frais et peu de temps mais il sait très bien ou il va et n'a pas de temps a perdre avec des pacotilles. A référer a n'importe qui.
Je peux dire que c'est un médecin très compétent et qui connaît très bien sa spécialité. C'est certain qu'il y a des délais mais c'est comme ça pour presque tous les spécialistes...

One of the worst experiences of my life. Tried to charge me 10 CAD for a "glaucoma screening" even though I was seeing him for a totally unrelated problem. Didn't bother to ask any questions about my reason for seeing him, just did a 2 seconds examination and proceeded to write a prescription. In the end I had the consult and the operation in my home country, Romania. I would not recommend this doctor to my worst enemies.
Rushes you and does not give you time to ask all the questions that could be bothering you. Am not sure how I fell about him. Seems to be knowledgeable enough though.
Toujour trop pressé mais tres professionel mais il y a toujour quelquechose qui faut payé pour et c'est cher.
TRes agreable, bon sens de l humour, memoire fantastique. TRes professionnel. Seul proble,e: un peu trop populaire creant des delais
On time: Generalement en retard de 30 Ã  45 minutes sur l'heure du rendez-vous. Helpful: entrevue avec le patient un peu trop rapide.
très bon médecin m'as opérer sans problème, merci fait des blagues avec les patients.
An operation has been done to me 20 years ago. my vision is 20/20 with glasses. Thanks to dr. Laflamme!!! Denis Schewell
medecin tres bon pour les chirurgies de l oeil
did a very good job,smyle,talk and answer your question.very pleased with him

Expert en son domaine (électrorétinographie), mais communicateur épouvantable. Incompétent à communiquer de mauvaises nouvelles, absence d'empathie. Comme la clinique du CHUM est perpétuellement débordée, l'interaction est garrochée et limitée à quelques phrases. M'a fortement incité à solliciter une seconde opinion, ce qui entraîne des coûts dans le système.
The patient had glaucoma and was followed by this doctor. His lack of care and/or knowledge made the patient went blind from one eye. If this is your doctor, please go for a 2nd opinion.

I was wandering if the doctor is a real doctor or just a simple spa estetician. The 1st thing you notice when you go in his office except the bitterness and harsh attitude of his secretary obviously tolerated by the doctor are the certificates of botox injections. After waiting more then hour even being on time my interaction with him was exactly 5min to give me diagnosis as per glasses I had already from another doctor. I asked him to give me prescription for other glasses due to my headache. He reffered me to optometrist. I asked him for diagnosis-he referred me to a private doctor. Full disappointment and lack of professionalism.

all of you who hate dr. edelstein jokes on you. He is the most knowledgeable man i know. Amazing joke. **** you all for insulting him. Your souls will rest in hell for saying such things to such an amazing man.
He is such a great man! I am so happy my friend told me about him!

Dr. Edelstein is a very wonderful and caring man. He is extremely modest and shy, and beneath his seemingly distant attitude, lies a brilliant and talented man. DR. Edelstein did not grow up in Canada with a silver spoon; he is a Holocaust survivor who lost most of his family, and his teenage years.He came to Canada with his mother as a poor immigrant, put himself through school and specialization.He married a high school beauty queen and had three wonderful children.For many years he was the Chasan at the Jewish General Hospital who conducted the services with a wonderful voice,and displayed much controlled emotion from a past that was stolen from him. To say anything wrong about him is very petty and those who are lucky enough to be his patient greatly appreciate this very sepcial man.

Je suis la mère d'une enfant qui voit souvent un ophtalmologiste présentement en congé de maternité. Je suis allée voir ce médecin pour mon autre fille et je l'ai trouvé excellent. Ma fille a un problème mineur qui nécessite une chirurgie mineur. Il s'est montré très ouvert à ce que cette intervention se fasse à Ste-Justine si elle avait trop peur (ils savent s'y prendre avec les enfants) sans égard à la perte d'argent qui s'en suit pour lui. Je l'ai trouvé professionnel et sa rapidité n'est pas étrangère à sa profession, la population vieillissante n'étant pas étrangère à la surcharge de travail de ces spécialistes (cataracte oblige). Bref, après avoir lu les commentaires plus haut avant de m'y rendre, je peux vous assurer que je fus agréablement surprise.
Said my eye pressure was high in one eye and that I had Glaucoma .... Will definitely get a 2nd opinion on that, I am 41 !
